title: Paula Mclain & Rebecca Plotnick at Little Saint
description:
Venez f√™ter avec nous! 
Grab your Valentine (or Gal-entine) and slip away to Little Saint for a charming, Paris-themed morning in Healdsburg with beloved author Paula McLain and celebrated Francophile Rebecca Plotnick (@everydayparisian). 
We‚Äôre serving full French vibes ‚Äì steaming coffee, elegant teas, flaky croissants, and a sprinkle of Parisian magic courtesy of Little Saint and neighboring art galleries. Think winter-morning-on-the-Left-Bank energy‚Ä¶ just on the Plaza and with better books! 
Doors open at 9:00am, giving you time to linger, sip, and settle in before heading upstairs for the 10:00am event. 
Join us for a reading and curated discussion followed by an audience Q&A and post event book signing with photo opportunities. 
This is a ticketed event, each ticket package includes a signed copy of Paula‚Äôs new book Skylark. Signed copies of Rebecca‚Äôs beautiful gift book Paris Every Day will also be available for purchase during the ticket registration process and on-site at the event. 
A perfect gathering for Francophiles, book lovers, and anyone ready for a little everyday joie de vivre with their favorite people! 
About Skylark: 
The New York Times bestselling author of The Paris Wife weaves a mesmerizing tale of Paris above and below‚Äîwhere a woman‚Äôs quest for artistic freedom in 1664 intertwines with a doctor‚Äôs dangerous mission during the German occupation in the 1940s, revealing a story of courage and resistance that transcends time. 
1664: Alouette Voland is the daughter of a master dyer at the famed Gobelin Tapestry Works, who secretly dreams of escaping her circumstances and creating her own masterpiece. When her father is unjustly imprisoned, Alouette‚Äôs efforts to save him lead to her own confinement in the notorious Salp√™tri√®re asylum, where thousands of women are held captive and cruelly treated. But within its grim walls, she discovers a small group of brave allies, and the possibility of a life bigger than she ever imagined. 
1939: Kristof Larson is a medical student beginning his psychiatric residency in Paris, whose neighbors on the Rue de Gobelins are a Jewish family who have fled Poland. When Nazi forces descend on the city, Kristof becomes their only hope for survival, even as his work as a doctor is jeopardized. 
A spellbinding and transportive look at a side of Paris known to very few‚Äîthe underground city that is a mirror reflection of the glories above‚ÄîPaula McLain‚Äôs unforgettable new novel chronicles two parallel journeys of defiance and rescue that connect in ways both surprising and deeply moving. 
Author: Paula McLain is the New York Times bestselling author of six novels, including The Paris Wife, Circling the Sun, and Love and Ruin, as well as two collections of poetry and a memoir. Her work has been published in over thirty-five countries, and featured in The New York Times, The Guardian, Town & Country, Real Simple, and elsewhere. 
About Paris Every Day: 
Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned traveler or a first-time visitor, enjoy the magical view of Paris in this book from Everyday Parisian blogger, Rebecca Plotnick. 
Paris Every Day reveals the City of Light through Rebecca‚Äôs photography and offers you the insider knowledge to help cultivate a French frame of mind. 
Paris is more than a destination, it‚Äôs a lifestyle. Chocolate or espresso, flower market or Mus e d‚ÄôOrsay, a small park or a favorite rooftop‚Äìyou‚Äôll find ideas for scouting these and more with photographs that reflect Rebecca‚Äôs decades-long love affair with the city. 
Paris Every Day is a sublime sortie that explores jazz bars, picnic spots, and casual bistros. Find advice for each season, including how to dress like a Parisian and indulge in the freshest regional produce. All bolstered by fabulous photos that include landmarks like the Luxembourg Gardens and the Eiffel Tower as well as prime places to people watch. 
It‚Äôs not just about the sights; it‚Äôs how to best enjoy them. Whether you‚Äôre planning a trip or just want an escape, you will turn to this book again and again for Rebecca‚Äôs well-curated wisdom on relishing everyday moments in the City of Light. 
Author: Rebecca Plotnick is American and the founder of Every Day Parisian blog. In 2013, she decided to pack up all her belongings and left Chicago for what would become a nomadic way of living for two years between the United States and France. Everyday Parisian was founded in 2016 as a result of this desire to meld the French lifestyle with American surroundings and to create a community with a shared love for Paris. It aims to highlight the fun and new ways to ‚Äúfrenchify‚Äù daily life, offers travel recommendations, shares fashion inspiration, and much more.Rebecca‚Äôs photographic work has been featured by Pottery Barn for the past decade and has recently been acquired by Ikea. She wears many hats: entrepreneur, photographer, blogger, avid home baker, and globe trotter. She adores her dog, Henri, and enjoys running The Print Shop full-time while sharing insider tips for Paris with her beloved community. Today, the Everyday Parisian family is 50,000 strong and still growing

title: Valentine Embroidery at Sonoma Botanical Garden
location: 12841 HWY 12, Glen Ellen, CA, 95442, United States
description:
Embroidered Valentine Botanicals Workshop at Sonoma Botanical Garden invites guests to explore the Victorian-era tradition of floriography, the language of flowers through a creative, hands-on embroidery experience. Led by artist and maker Robert Mahar, this workshop blends history, design, and needlework as participants learn core embroidery basics and essential stitches while embellishing a custom-printed 18√ó27‚Äù linen-cotton canvas featuring restored vintage floral illustrations associated with love and romance.    The artwork is sourced from an 1896 botanical volume and paired with charming typography, creating a unique, free-form sampler. Attendees will begin their projects in class and leave with the skills to finish at home, resulting in a piece that can be displayed as wall art or used as a tea towel. . Includes Garden admission.

Source: Sonoma.com

title: GALLERY TALK - The Sissiboo Six  - Six Artists on Residency on the Bay of Fundy
location: Backstreet Gallery & Studios down SOFA Art Alley, 312 South A Street, Santa Rosa, CA
description:
The word ‚ÄúSissiboo‚Äù is an adaption of the French and Mi‚Äôkmaq words for six owls and river. Named by explorers, when six owls were spotted together in shoreline timber, the Sissiboo River runs through Weymouth, Nova Scotia where the Maine College of Art & Design offers a team residency to its alum. 
Sonoma County Painter, Mary Vaughan, a MECA & D Alum, spent all of July 2025 with 5 artists of her choosing. Vaughan invites you to hear the group talk about their experiences on the Bay of Fundy on Saturday, Feb 7 at 11am. Their Residency Show based on the region opened on Feb 6 and this Feb 7 Art Talk at Backstreet Gallery in Santa Rosa, just down Art Alley near 312 South A, will bring delightful insights to art and what it meant to have time and quietude to create with a chosen team of makers across her art life. The group of 6 are from NE, CA, TN and IL. 
The Sissiboo Six Exhibit continues all month at Backstreet ‚Äì only Open on Weekends in Feb from 11am to 4pm, which also includes one final gallery day, Sunday, March 1, 11am to 4pm. We hope you will join us for our talk or simply come over on a Weekend to see the show. 
Both Friday Cafe and Red Bird Bakery on our Arts Block just behind Juillard Park are open on Saturdays from 8 am to 2pm if you want to come down for breakfeast beforehand or lunch after our 11am to Noon Art Talk.

title: The Familiar Strangers at Redwood Cafe
location: Redwood Cafe, 8240 Old Redwood Hwy, Cotati, CA
description:
The Familiar Strangers play an Americana grab bag of songs from western swing to blues to country, bluegrass and even a little bit of roots rock! Perfect for smaller venues (no drums) they nevertheless generate a big response from audiences with their friendly banter and responsiveness to requests from audience members. This is a band with a sense of humor but can easily move between material designed to get you up on your feet dancing or tugging at your heart to buy another beer and lose your sorrows. 
Candy Girard ‚Äì fiddle, vocals & killer smile
Tim Sarter ‚Äì bass, vocals & infectious friendliness
Kevin Russell ‚Äì guitar, vocals & set list maker 
In January 2021 the band presents their first collection of western swing and Americana favorites called Masquerade 2020. This project features material from Bob Wills, Russell Smith, Willie Nelson, Lieber & Stoller, Radney Foster, Hank Penny, Leon Russell, Django Rhienhardt, Lennon & McCartney and others.
Fasten your seatbelts for this wild romp through music styles & genres as the trio play a jukebox full of both well-loved familiar songs, as well as equally stellar lesser-known material.

title: Midwinter Music in the Museum
location: Buena Vista Winery, 18000 Old Winery Rd, Sonoma, CA
description:
USA 250: The Immigrant and The Citizen 
In honor of America‚Äôs 250th anniversary and Black History Month, we are highlighting the string quartet music of citizen Florence Price and immigrant Anton√≠n Dvo≈ô√°k in Buena Vista Winery‚Äôs Wine Tool Museum Room. Enjoy an intimate evening of chamber music the way it was meant to be experienced. 
Program includes the Florence Price String Quartet No. 2 in A minor (1935) and the Dvorak String Quartet No. 12 in F major Op 96 ‚ÄúThe American‚Äù (1893, written in Iowa) with musicians Robin Hansen and Ani Bukujian, violin, Elizabeth Prior, viola, and Emileigh Vandiver, cello. The musicians will be introducing the composers‚Äô biographies and American stories. 
Doors open at 6 pm, and the show starts at 7 pm. Wine by the glass and by the bottle, as well as Charcuterie Plates, will be available for purchase.

USA 250: The Immigrant and The Citizen is an intimate chamber music evening honoring America‚Äôs 250th anniversary and Black History Month, set in the Wine Tool Museum Room at Buena Vista Winery. The program highlights the works of citizen composer Florence Price and immigrant composer Anton√≠n Dvo≈ô√°k, celebrating their unique American stories through string quartet music.    The evening features Florence Price‚Äôs String Quartet No. 2 in A minor and Dvo≈ô√°k‚Äôs beloved String Quartet No. 12 in F major, ‚ÄúThe American.‚Äù Performed by violinists Robin Hansen and Ani Bukujian, violist Elizabeth Prior, and cellist Emileigh Vandiver, the musicians will also share insights into the composers‚Äô lives and legacies.    Wine and charcuterie will be available for purchase.

Source: Sonoma.com

title: The Freak Accident Record Release Party at The Big Easy
location: The Big Easy, 128 American Alley, Petaluma, CA
description:
w/ Cut-Rate Druggist and Right To Remain 
Record release party celebrating the seventh release from The Freak Accident (members of Victims Family, Hellbillys,Mongoloid and much more) entitled ‚ÄúThe Midnight Show‚Äù which drops everywhere on February 6th. 
The Freak Accident is a Punk/Math/Garage/Pop/Surf/Rock collision led by Victims Family/Jello Biafra and the Guantanamo School of Medicine guitarist-vocalist Ralph Spight. Through numerous line-up they‚Äôve cranked out 4 LP‚Äôs and 2 EP‚Äôs of genre-hopping smart-ass punk and rock, equal parts comedy and tragedy and a healthy side of psychedelic noise. The new line-up of bassist Henry Austin Lannan and ‚ÄúStark Raving‚Äù Brad Kopp (Hellbillys,Marginal Prophets,Antler Family,Stark Raving Brad) on drums dropped their first LP/CD together entitled ‚ÄúOuter Space Is Boring‚Äù (Nerve Center, 2023) and has performed throughout Northern California in support of that release playing shows with Dead Bob, Supersuckers, The Hangmen,Middle-Aged Queers, The Darts and many others and have played after-parties at Mosswood Meltdown. Their new album ‚ÄúThe Midnight Show‚Äù is a co-release with Nadine Records (the adventurous Portland label run by Nasalrod/Berzerk bass legend Mandy Morgan) is a kitchen sink of punk,indie,noise,psych and surf textures that surprises with every listen. It hits the streets on February 6th,2026 with regional and national tour dates to follow. 
Cut-Rate Druggist is a dynamic duo characterized by dual vocals intertwined with heavy drums and a bass guitar, culminating in a crushing wall of sound. Their powerful presence on stage earned them opportunities to support renowned acts such as Team Dresch, Beyond The Lamplight, The Avengers, Margaritas Podridas, The Dollyrots and Betty Blowtorch. 
Petaluma‚Äôs own Right To Remain open the show and bring their frantic impassioned hardcore that‚Äôs made them a favorite all over Northern California.

Source: GoLocal Cooperative

title: Shirley Valentine presented by Sonoma Arts Live
location: Sonoma Arts Live at Andrews Hall, Sonoma Community Center, 276 East Napa Street, Sonoma, CA
description:
The heroine in this actor‚Äôs tour-de-force is an ordinary middle class English housewife. As she prepares chips and eggs for dinner, she ruminates on her life and tells the wall about her husband, her children, her past, and an invitation from a girlfriend to join her on holiday in Greece to search for romance and adventure. Starring Jennifer King (Bad Dates, Belle of Amherst.) 
1989 Tony Award Nominee By Willy Russell. Directed by Sharon Winegar.

title: Cameron Mackintosh & Disney‚Äôs Mary Poppins at 6th Street Playhouse
location: 6th Street Playhouse G.K. Hardt Theatre, 52 West 6th Street, Santa Rosa, CA
description:
The beloved story of Mary Poppins soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers‚Äô timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing‚Äîuntil the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.
Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like ‚ÄúA Spoonful of Sugar‚Äù and ‚ÄúSupercalifragilisticexpialidocious!‚Äù

location: 6th Street Playhouse, 52 W. 6th Street, Santa Rosa, CA
description:
In the city of Verona, two young lovers from feuding families ignite a passionate romance that defies their world of hatred. As their secret union unfolds, a series of uncontrollable events leads to a heart-wrenching conclusion. 
Romeo & Juliet remains one of William Shakespeare‚Äôs most celebrated works, delving into the depths of love, fate, and the societal pressures that can lead to tragedy. Its timeless narrative continues to resonate, highlighting the enduring question of fate versus free will.

Anjelah Johnson-Reyes is one of the most successful stand-up comedians today. She has six comedy specials streaming on various platforms, and she‚Äôs selling out theaters across the world. Her most recent special, Say I Won‚Äôt, debuted on YouTube with over 3.8M views. 
Anjelah published her first memoir titled, Who Do I Think I Am?: Stories of Chola Wishes and Caviar Dreams, in March 2022. Born and raised in San Jose, California, and of Mexican and Native American descent, Anjelah has guest starred on shows such as Life & Beth, Superstore, The Shield, Ugly Betty, and Curb Your Enthusiasm. Her film roles include Enough Said, Our Family Wedding, and Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel.

title: Tom Relling
description:
Tom Relling


Wednesday, February 11, 2026 at 5:00PM
Tune in Wednesday, February 11 at 5PM to watch an exclusive Luther Locals Online recording of Tom Relling on our Facebook page! 


Born in Pasadena CA and raised in St. Louis MO, songwriter and guitarist Tom Relling landed in San Francisco in 2010, and soon established himself as a musical presence in the Bay Area scene. Tom‚Äôs hard rock spin on power-pop has drawn comparisons to acts of the 60‚Äôs and 70‚Äôs (think T Rex meets MC5) merging clever lyrics, catchy melodies, and stunning guitar work. With dynamic stagecraft and top-tier musicianship of rhythm section Alex Dang-Lozano (drums) and Will Durkee (bass), Tom Relling Band consistently delivers full-tilt live performances, uplifting and astounding audiences with high energy guitar-based rock n‚Äôroll. New LP ‚ÄúPeace In Love‚Äù is out now on Shaky Records. 
All views expressed in this broadcast are those of the artist.

title: World Ballet Company Presents Swan Lake
description:
Back to All Shows


World Ballet Company Presents
Swan Lake

Thursday, February 12, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 



The legendary tale of Swan Lake takes flight in a breathtaking production from World Ballet Company, as fate and magic entwine in a timeless battle between good and evil. Featuring a cast of 50 international dancers, over 150 radiant hand-sewn costumes, and stunning hand-crafted sets, this spellbinding performance captures every heart-pounding moment. from the ‚ÄúDance of the Little Swans‚Äù to the Black Swan‚Äôs iconic 32 fouett√©s, and every pirouette in between. 
With Tchaikovsky‚Äôs unforgettable score filling the air, immerse yourself in this mesmerizing journey where dreams, heartbreak, and redemption unfold right before your eyes. 
Based in Los Angeles and led by Sasha Gorskaya and Gulya Hartwick, World Ballet Company presents the most beloved and iconic ballets of our time in cities nationwide. Driven by the belief that ballet is for everyone, performances appeal to newcomers and seasoned ballet goers alike. The company attracts many international artists and comprises renowned professional dancers representing over 10 countries. To date, World Ballet Company has traveled to more than 300 cities, reaching an audience of more than 500,000 fans. 
For ages 5 and older. 



	          
THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Hanami Stroll at Sonoma Botanical Garden
location: 12841 HWY 12, Glen Ellen, CA, 95442, United States
description:
Immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of Asian magnolia blossoms, many of which are endangered in their native habitats. During peak bloom, more than a dozen magnolia trees and shrubs come alive with vibrant pink and white flowers set against bare winter branches, creating a striking seasonal display.    Guests are invited to enjoy a guided hanami stroll, the Japanese tradition of flower viewing, offering a peaceful opportunity to admire these rare and beautiful blooms. After the walk, continue the experience with a visit to The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms, where expertly crafted miniature landscapes highlight the artistry and harmony of nature. This immersive experience celebrates the beauty of the season through flowers, culture, and living art.

title: YWCA Sonoma County Presents Love Letters
description:
Back to All Shows


YWCA Sonoma County Presents
Love Letters

Friday, February 13, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Celebrating 50 years of service to the community, the domestic violence service provider YWCA Sonoma County is presenting for one show only, a fundraising performance of Love Letters, the acclaimed play by A.R. Gurney. 
The production will reprise the performances of Madeleine Keegan O‚ÄôConnell, CEO of YWCA Sonoma County, as Melissa Gardner, and former Press Democrat columnist Chris Smith as Andrew Makepeace Ladd III. The longtime Sonoma County friends first appeared in Love Letters in 2016. 
Ticket sales for the play will raise much-needed funds for YWCA‚Äôs vital and singular domestic violence programs serving local families who find themselves in danger in their homes ‚Äì the place we should all feel safest. For 50 years, YWCA Sonoma County has been the county‚Äôs answer to the need by families for refuge, advocacy, and support with domestic violence. 
Love Letters is based on the lifelong, intimate correspondence of these two characters whose entire story unfolds through written words exchanged in the form of letters. In a relationship spanning 50 years, their letters contain their hopes and ambitions, dreams and disappointments, victories and defeats throughout their separate lives. 
After debuting in 1988, Love Letters quickly moved to both Off-Broadway and Broadway productions. Over the years, the roles were performed by notable actors such as Brian Dennehy and Mia Farrow, Carol Burnett with Dennehy, and Alan Alda and Candice Bergen, as well as Angelica Huston and Stacy Keach, Diana Rigg and Martin Sheen. 
According to Madeleine Keegan O‚ÄôConnell, ‚ÄúIn addition to the basic needs of food, clothing and shelter, people deserve respect, dignity and safety to conduct productive lives and care for their children. YWCA is honored to be a leader in the efforts to address needs so many people take for granted.‚Äù¬† 
Chris Smith, who retired from the PD in 2021 but still contributes to the newspaper on occasion, said, ‚ÄúBringing the power of the written word and the lost art of letter writing together with support for YWCA Sonoma County is a winning combination for me.‚Äù

Back to All Shows


Peppa Pig: My First Concert

Wednesday, February 18, 2026

6:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Peppa Pig: My First Concert is a fun, interactive introduction to a live orchestra for ages 18 months and older. Peppa and George learn all about the different sounds that instruments make together and enjoy some of their favorite music from the British animated series, performed by Southbank Sinfonia Youth Orchestra. They also get to discover some other exciting orchestral pieces perfect for children. Little piggies can join in with Peppa and her family and make music of their own! 


 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Trisha Yearwood: The Mirror Tour An Intimate Acoustic Evening of Stories & Songs
description:
Back to All Shows


Trisha Yearwood: The Mirror Tour
An Intimate Acoustic Evening of Stories & Songs

Wednesday, March 4, 2026

7:30 pm


BUY TICKETS 
With a career spanning three decades,¬†Trisha¬†Yearwood is a Grammy¬Æ, CMA¬Æ, and ACM¬Æ award-winning icon whose powerhouse voice and passion have captivated millions. Singer, actress, author, chef, and entrepreneur, Yearwood has achieved multiplatinum success while continuing to evolve as an artist. Most recently, she released two acclaimed albums,¬†The Mirror, a deeply personal collection of songs co-written by Yearwood, and¬†Christmastime, a joyful holiday project featuring festive favorites, a new original, and sweeping orchestral arrangements. 
In 2019,¬†Trisha released¬†Every Girl, her first full-length country album in over a decade, which included an acoustic re-recording of her breakthrough single, ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs in Love With The Boy,‚Äù the most-listened-to country song by a female artist in Billboard‚Äôs Country Airplay Chart history.¬†Trisha‚Äôs influence continues to reach new heights, recently inducted into the Austin City Limits Hall of Fame, she also celebrated 25 years with the Grand Ole Opry, received the ACM Honors Icon Award and CMT Awards June Carter Cash Humanitarian Award. Beyond music, she is the Emmy¬Æ winning host of¬†Trisha‚Äôs Southern Kitchen, authored four New York Times bestsellers, and co-owns Nashville‚Äôs largest honky-tonk. 


 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Italian Ricotta Favorites: Sweet and Savory Classics
description:
Schedule

Saturday, March 14, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Bilingual, Culinary Arts

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$100 ‚Äì Registration CostExplore ricotta three ways in this Italian cooking class. Make delicate gnudi, whipped ricotta crostini, and traditional torta di ricotta romana.

What you‚Äôll do

Discover the incredible versatility of ricotta cheese in this hands-on Italian cooking class featuring three distinct preparations that showcase this beloved ingredient. You‚Äôll learn techniques ranging from delicate pasta-making to elegant appetizers and classic Italian desserts. Start by creating pillowy ricotta gnudi, those cloud-like dumplings that are lighter than traditional gnocchi, served with a vibrant tomato sauce. Master the art of achieving the perfect texture and learn how to handle the delicate dough for consistently beautiful results. Next, prepare whipped ricotta crostini topped with honey and fresh thyme, an elegant appetizer that balances creamy, sweet, and herbaceous flavors on crispy bread. Finally, you‚Äôll bake torta di ricotta romana, a traditional Roman ricotta cake that‚Äôs subtly sweet and wonderfully moist. This classic dessert demonstrates how ricotta creates tender, delicate baked goods with authentic Italian character. Throughout the class, you‚Äôll gain confidence working with fresh ricotta, understanding how its moisture content and handling affect each dish differently. Whether you‚Äôre looking to expand your Italian cooking repertoire or simply love ricotta, this class provides techniques and recipes you‚Äôll return to again and again. Perfect for intermediate home cooks ready to explore authentic Italian preparations.Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 109, Rotary Kitchen

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

A fun¬†and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps. This class will help the student gain coordination and confidence to take into their daily lives. Small performing opportunities based upon a child‚Äôs interest but is not mandatory. title: Sea Chantey and Songs of the Sea Singalong
description:
Please note the change of venue and time from our previous sing-alongs.\* Avast, ye saucy sailors! Come brave the perilous waters of Point Reyes and join us for a rollicking good time at Point Reyes National Seashore's Sea Chantey Sing-along at the Ken Patrick Visitor Center. Please bring your arsenal of sea chanteys, any musical instruments you'd like, and a willingness to laugh a lot!  It's so much fun when audience members lead shanties for the rest of us to join in on the chorus, and leading a song is encouraged! If you'd like to find a song \(or songs\) to share, I highly recommend setting one of your online music services to a sea chantey radio station and hear what's out there! Practice lyrics! Teach the chorus to our audience at the singalong! Our format is informal, mellow, and supportive, so if you've been wanting to push your comfort edge and lead a song, this is a perfect low-pressure opportunity. If you'd rather just singalong with the chantey choruses, that's fine too. We always have a great time no matter what. This free event is for chantey singers of all levels. Due to the nature of sea chanteys, there may be lyrics that are not appropriate for children. Reservations not required. To be added to the notification email list for future singalong dates, please email pore\_info@nps.gov For more information, please visit: nps.gov/pore/planyourvisit/calendar.htm

description:
**Four Southern women turn life‚Äôs curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate‚Äîand an impromptu happy hour‚Äîand decide it‚Äôs high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they‚Äôve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment‚Äîand most importantly, realize it‚Äôs never too late to make new old friends.

BUY TICKETS 

Whitney Cummings is a comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, and host of the hit podcast Good for You. Best known for creating and starring in the NBC series Whitney and co-creating the syndicated, Emmy-nominated CBS comedy 2 Broke Girls, she has become a leading voice in modern comedy. Cummings has released six stand-up specials, including Money Shot \(2010\), I Love You \(2014\), I‚Äôm Your Girlfriend \(2016\), Can I Touch It? \(2019\), Jokes \(2022\), and her latest, Mouthy, which debuted on OnlyFans in November 2023. She has also appeared in numerous television series and films, such as Good Mourning, Studio 666, How It Ends, and FOX‚Äôs Accused, further solidifying her presence on both the big and small screens. 

Beyond performing, Cummings is a successful author and filmmaker. In 2017, she published her memoir, I‚Äôm Fine‚Ä¶ And Other Lies, and made her directorial debut with the feature adaptation of Louann Brizendine‚Äôs bestseller, The Female Brain. She continues to create, produce, and perform across platforms, bringing her sharp humor and fearless perspective to audiences worldwide. She currently lives in Los Angeles.

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Charlie Hunter Trio
description:
Charlie Hunter \(born May 23, 1967\) is an American guitarist, composer and bandleader.  First coming to prominence in the early '90s Hunter has since become one of the leading names in jazz, recording 17 albums. Hunter is noted for playing custom-made seven and eight-string guitars, on which he simultaneously plays basslines, rhythm guitar, and solos. Critic Sean Westergaard describes Hunter's innovative guitar technique as "mind-boggling ... he's an agile improviser with an ear for great tone, and always has excellent players alongside him in order to make great music, not to show off."

title: Safari West Presents! Native Bird Connections
description:
Conservation Dinner Series: Jenny Papkra from  Native Bird Connections joins us in the elephant room after dinner to give a talk about birds. The conservation dinner series is complimentary to all dinner guests. If you want to attend this presentation, please call our reservations team at \(707\) 566-3667 or \(800\) 616-2695 and they can book it for you. Dinner starts at 7:00 PM.    About the Speaker: Jenny has a Bachelor's degree with honors from UC Davis in Environmental Interpretation. She has been involved with wildlife since 1988, first with Lindsay Museum for 13 years and now with Native Bird Connections for 22 years. Native Bird Connections is permitted with the State and the Federal Fish and Wildlife Departments to conduct educational programs within Northern California. NBC supports 13 non-releasable raptors as educational partners. Jenny maintains the NBC collection, delivers all of the programs and consults with organizations locally and beyond. She is an advisor for the Peregrine Team and the Kestrel Campaign in the Mt Diablo region Jenny has working experience with most California native wildlife and over 30 species of raptors. She received the William Penn Mott Jr. Environmental Award from the Orinda Association in 2009.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Spirit Sisters
location: Arlene Francis Center for Spirit, Art, and Politics
description:
SPIRIT SISTERS REIKI SHARE10AM - 12PM

Join us for a Reiki share to embrace

Embrace and share the power of energy healing, conveniently timed right before our monthly sister circle!

Join us as we exchange Reiki Energy Healing with one another, to support, heal and empower each other! This is a great opportunity to practice your Reiki or energy healing gifts in a safe communal space.

Release stress, restore balance and recharge your body, mind and spirit with our magical Reiki Circle. It consists of many healing hands on one person at a time.

Each share will start with a general introduction, then the circle will be grounded by one of our masters with a guided meditation, followed by treatments until each person has had a chance to receive healing.

This is a time and space for teachers, practitioners, those who are interested in sharing in connection and healing, as well as anyone who would like to learn more about Reiki.

Bring:

- A water bottle for yourself to replenish and hydrate

- Any healing tools such as tuning forks, crystals, etc. that you may want to use

- A $1 minimum cash, Venmo or PayPal donation

Join us afterwards for our monthly sister circle!

Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County is a spiritually based women's group for aligned women to be their true, authentic selves. Our events are to empower and connect with like-minded women in a safe and sacred space. Learn more about Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County at

spiritsistersinc.org .

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

SPIRIT SISTERS CIRCLE - 12:15PM - 3PM

For our March Sister Circle, we are honored to have community member Tara leading an Intuitive Art workshop!

In this workshop, you will learn how to use your intuition and expression in an artistic way. Through art, you'll learn how you can heal, play, transform and find answers within yourself!

No art experience necessary!

Bring:

- A Vegan Potluck Item

- A $1 minimum donation

Please:

‚Ä¢ We want anyone who is called to join us, and we'd rather you come late than not at all! We request that if you are running late, please enter through the front door of the building and enter the schoolhouse room quietly to prevent significant disruption to the group.

‚Ä¢ Due to our circles being a safe space for women to get vulnerable, this is an adult woman only event.

About the Sponsored Circle Host: Tara Dickinson

Tara grew up in an ashram \(intentional community\) with a spiritual teacher whose main message was kindness, feed everyone \(body, mind & soul\), and serve. Through these decades of inner work, silent meditation, and awareness, she can hold a space of stillness & understanding for others while we dive into what wants to be expressed.

With a background in fine arts and years of teaching a variety of art labs to kids & grownups, Tara enjoys sharing tools to help everyone feel comfortable in the creative process while learning new techniques.

Tara holds a Bachelor's in Fine Arts and works to combine her education and life experiences to create programs that encourage people to live their best lives by minimizing stress, opening to awareness, and making choices that are tailored to their needs and lifestyle.

More info can be learned at

Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County is a spiritually based women's group for aligned women to be their true, authentic selves. Our events are to empower and connect with like-minded women in a safe and sacred space. Learn more about Spirit Sisters of Sonoma County at

spiritsistersinc.org .

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: 2026 Seal Watch Volunteer Training
description:
Do you love and want to connect people with the dynamic and beautiful Sonoma Coast? Do you care about the harbor seals at the mouth of the Russian River? Join us as a volunteer for Stewards Seal Watch Program. Volunteers support the safe viewing of harbor seals during weekends in the spring and summer months at Goat Rock State Beach near the mouth of the Russian River. Volunteers can join shifts at Goat Rock Beach, beach near the river mouth, and at an education table at the Jenner boat launch next to the visitor center. With your help, park visitors can learn about harbor seals and their pups, the natural history of the area, and how the Marine Mammal Protection Act ensures their safety.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

location:

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
In Her Power

A Collaboration by Priscila Soares & JeanCherie

In Her Power is a group exhibition celebrating women‚Äôs presence, strength, and creative expression. Anchored by a collaborative, life-size sculptural work by Priscila Soares and JeanCherie, the exhibition brings together works by women artists exploring power as something lived, embodied, and deeply personal.

At the heart of the gallery stands a mountain lioness woman ‚Äî a guardian figure shaped by two artists working together, each bringing her own voice, materials, and vision. Surrounding this central work, invited artists contribute pieces that reflect their own relationship to power, resilience, intuition, and selfhood.

Rather than offering a single definition, In Her Power invites viewers to witness many expressions of strength ‚Äî quiet and fierce, ancestral and contemporary, individual and shared. It is both a celebration of women artists and an invitation to step into presence, creativity, and connection.

Opening Reception:

March 1, 12‚Äì4pm

Gallery Hours:

Sundays in March, 12‚Äì4pm

110 Pintado St.

description:
In this 4 week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. The class will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step by step layering process, that trains the artist to see value and color

Our subject matter will be flora and fauna - a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬†

This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With 4 class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬†

All materials provided.

Location: Bohemian Flowers Farm, 121 Bohemian Hwy, Freestone, CA

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: The Savannah Sipping Society; a Jones Hope Wooten Comedy
description:
**Four Southern women turn life‚Äôs curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate‚Äîand an impromptu happy hour‚Äîand decide it‚Äôs high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they‚Äôve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment‚Äîand most importantly, realize it‚Äôs never too late to make new old friends.

7:00 pm

One of the shyest attention hogs ever to do comedy, Ralph Barbosa‚Äôs disarming and laid-back style has made him a stand-out on stage, on TV, and as host of the Formula Bean YouTube channel with Luis Cisneros. Last summer, Barbosa premiered his second hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Planet Bosa, as part of Hulu‚Äôs new Hularious comedy brand. 
His first hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Cowabunga, premiered on Netflix on October 31, 2023, and ranked as the #3 TV show on Netflix throughout its first week on the service. 
In July 2024, Barbosa was selected as one of Variety‚Äôs 10 Comics to Watch for 2024 and toured theaters throughout North America, including two sold-out theater shows as part of the Netflix Is A Joke Fest 2024, as well as hosting the kick-off show. 2023 was Barbosa‚Äôs break-out year, during which he was a guest on The Joe Rogan Experience, made his debut on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, and performed Comedy Central Stand-up Featuring: Ralph Barbosa, which topped 6 million views on YouTube. 
Barbosa also starred in the HBO Max comedy special, Entre Nos: The Winners 3 in 2022, and earlier that year his Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy performance was released on YouTube and now has over 6 million views.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:

Learn the fundamentals of creating handbuilt, functional objects with clay in this 8 week course. Thoughtfully explore the tried and true techniques of ceramic work!

What you‚Äôll do

Deborah Donahower takes you through the fundamentals of working with clay in hand building in this 8 week course. Designed for all levels \(beginners and those more experienced\) Deborah thoughtfully explores the tried and true techniques of ceramic work with her students through structured assignments, allowing her students to develop their own creative voice in the process. This course will emphasize building functional forms with creative surface design in mind; focusing on forms with large areas to explore texture, painterly surface techniques, and much more. Students will receive instruction in hand building, and basic glazing techniques. With your 8 week class registration, students receive the opportunity to purchase a studio pass for ¬Ω off during the duration of their class. title: Developing Your Drawing Eye
description:
Schedule

Mondays, March 9 ‚Äì April 20, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM Exceptions: No class March 23

Experience Level

Beginning

Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$270 ‚Äì Registration Cost $10 ‚Äì Materials Fee $280 ‚Äì Total Registration CostDeveloping Your Drawing Eye

Learn to draw without pressure or grades. Build foundational skills at your own pace through observational techniques. Perfect for beginners. Materials included.

What you‚Äôll do

It‚Äôs never too late to learn to draw ‚Äì especially when nobody‚Äôs grading you. Whether you are an abject beginner, haven‚Äôt picked up a pencil since high school, or you‚Äôre a creative who has always felt intimidated by observational drawing, this six-week class is offered with you in mind. We‚Äôll take the mystery ‚Äì and the pressure ‚Äì out of drawing from observation. You‚Äôll learn how to really see like an artist, practice simple techniques step by step, and build skills at your own pace. No talent required, and perfection is off the table. Studying observational drawing offers a foundational skill set that you will carry into every medium you might wish to explore. Discover the joy of drawing and build practical skills to expand your creative expression! All materials are provided.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

description:

All services provided in centers are free. You‚Äôll enjoy: Personalized help Center guests can receive personal help from volunteers in one of more than 5,400 centers worldwide. Access to exclusive records Visitors to FamilySearch Centers get special access to images of historical records that are only available in centers. title: After School - Create Your Own Storybook World!
description:
Every Tuesday 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM

Please see website: Exact dates are available on Enrichment.kids. Click the registration links below.

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Kids

Age\(s\)

7-11

$100 ‚Äì Monthly Session Cost

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you‚Äôll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist: ¬†Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\),¬†Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\)¬†. Inspired by their playful styles, students will¬†design and develop their very own characters‚Äîdeciding where these characters¬†live, work, play, eat, and sleep!¬†Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.¬† Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

¬†watercolor, paint, pens,¬†and¬†collage

¬†recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use¬†watercolor techniques¬†to add color and mood

How¬†scale¬†helps characters and environments feel real

The¬†arc of a story‚Äîbeginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using¬†background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

**$360** ‚Äì Registration CostPresented by the Sonoma Community Center in partnership with The Game Academy

Join Adventure Gaming classes with The Game Academy! Play D&D, build community, and grow empathy through weekly storytelling sessions.

About the class

class descriptionAdventure Gaming classes presented by The Game Academy are held weekly for¬†2-hour sessions over an 8-week term.¬†Participating players explore collaborative storytelling in a mentorship model using¬†games like Dungeons & Dragons to build community, foster¬†empathy, and support social-emotional growth. Our trained Educator-Gamemasters guide players in choosing the kinds of stories that interest them, then support unique and dynamic character creation, and finally¬†present an engaging narrative filled with puzzles and mysteries to be solved, social role-play to navigate, and¬†tactical challenges to be overcome‚Ä¶ all based on the players‚Äô interests.¬†This uniquely tailored experience¬†provides a rich context of personal investment, and engages our players with a fun and collaborative activity that helps them overcome social and emotional challenges, teaches them to engage with a growth mindset, supports the development of critical thinking and cooperative problem-solving skills, and helps them form lasting bonds with their peers. We hope your child will join us for a new adventure this coming Fall Term at the Sonoma Community Center.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

description:
**We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†**No experience is necessary**¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

title: BLS Certification Class (American Heart Association)
description:
BLS Certification Class \(AHA\) - In Person, Instructor-Led

American Heart Association BLS certification class \(in-person, instructor-led class in our Rohnert Park classroom\). BLS \(Basic Life Support\) is the required CPR class for healthcare providers. Includes cardiac and respiratory arrest management, CPR, AED use, and choking treatment for all ages. This class is appropriate for initial BLS or BLS renewal.

Vive CPR is an American Heart Association \(AHA\) Training Site. AHA "BLS Provider" certifications are issued on the same day.

We also offer Blended Learning BLS certification courses \(online course plus in-person Skills Session\).

Learn from a top-rated, local CPR training company with over 900 5-star reviews! Our classes are fun, engaging, and expertly taught by experienced first responders.

Learn More & Enroll: https://vivecpr.com/class/bls-certification/

Questions? Call/text \(707\) 612-3277 or https://vivecpr.com/contact

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

description:

Wednesday, March 11 ‚Äì April 22, 2026 11:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

Intermediate

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$225** ‚Äì Registration CostAdvance your drawing skills with deep study of composition, value, and technique. Strengthen your creative process through focused practice.

About the Class

In this class, we will explore composition, value, and other aspects of drawing but on a deeper level. Beginning drawing classes have a lot of ground to cover so the concepts are skimmed over in order to give you exposure to as many as possible. Next-level drawing takes the time to do a deeper dive into some of the principles of drawing. When drawing we use limited tools which allow us to isolate both our strengths and weaknesses. Using this opportunity to really investigate our own process will serve to strengthen all aspects of our creative work. Drawing can be a challenge but when you see how it enhances the creative process, you will know it is worth it. This class is suitable for students who have a basic understanding of drawing and want to work on their skills. Please bring the following materials to class: 20‚Ä≥ x 26‚Ä≥ drawing board with clips, 18 ‚Äúx 24‚Äù Strathmore drawing pad (other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal (Char-kole brand black), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black (one fine-tip and one medium-tip).Membership has its benefits

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description:
Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

TIME: 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

WHERE: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Markham Vineyards

DETAILS:

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. A collector‚Äôs journey through the past, present, and future of Napa Valley Cabernet.

Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

title: Sweet and Savory Tamales: Traditional Techniques
description:
Schedule

Wednesday, March 18, 2026 5:00 PM ‚Äì 8:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Bilingual, Culinary Arts

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$100 ‚Äì Registration CostMaster traditional tamal-making with sweet and savory variations. Learn masa preparation, filling techniques, and steaming methods for authentic results.

What you‚Äôll do

Dive into the rich tradition of tamal-making in this comprehensive hands-on class exploring both sweet and savory variations of this beloved Latin American dish. Whether you‚Äôre new to tamales or looking to refine your technique, you‚Äôll gain confidence in every step of the process from preparing masa to achieving perfectly steamed results. Learn to work with masa dough, understanding the proper texture and consistency that creates light, tender tamales. You‚Äôll prepare savory fillings that might include seasoned pork, chicken with salsa verde, cheese with peppers, or black bean and vegetable options. Explore sweet variations featuring cinnamon, fruit, chocolate, or traditional piloncillo for dessert-style tamales that are perfect for celebrations or breakfast. Master the art of spreading masa evenly on corn husks, portioning fillings appropriately, and folding techniques that ensure your tamales hold together beautifully during steaming. You‚Äôll learn the secrets of proper steaming for consistent cooking and discover tips for making large batches ahead for freezing. Tamales are central to celebrations and family gatherings across Latin America, and this class honors that tradition while making the process approachable for home cooks. Leave with recipes, techniques, and the skills to host your own tamalada.Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 109, Rotary Kitchen

description:

Light Cardio Class 5:15 - 6:15pm This class will be a light cardio class where we will be doing some exercises seated in a chair; some light stretching, and other less intense cardio movements. Cardio Dance Fitness 6:30 - 7:30pm This intermediate class is designed for those who are interested in a more rigorous style training and requires endurance. Activity will mostly involve dance cardio mixed with some calisthenics training to include jumping, running, or participating in rigorous dance cardio. Think of it as boot camp dance cardio training! The library will provide basic supplies like paper, glue sticks, scissors, etc., but you should feel free to bring your own materials and tools. You can also bring zines that you are excited about to share out with others. Snacks will be provided but you are also welcome to bring your own.

title: Marin Farmers Markets
description:
Price: Free

Sponsor: Marin Center

Explore the bounty of summer at the Marin Farmers Markets. Taste vine-ripened tomatoes, corn that was picked that morning, and peaches so juicy you have to bend over just to get a bite. Farm-fresh eggs, grass-fed beef, artisan c heeses, raw milk, and freshly baked breads complete the shopping exper ience. Specialty prepared foods and handmade art add to the magic of the market.

Enjoy the intimate feeling of the Thursday Marin Farmers Market, an ideal place to meet for lunch and pick up fresh produce for the weekend. Discover the abundance and diversity of product at the celebrated Sunday Marin Farmers Market, the third largest farmers market in California. Turn your dollar into a vote for local sustainable agriculture, shrink your eco-footprint, and revive the feeling of being intimate ly connected to your food by meeting your farmers face-to-face. The market takes place rain or shine.

www.aginstitutemarin.org
