title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Picnic Lunch and Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
Begin your wine-tasting experience with a guided tasting led by our host, who will introduce you to our exclusive estate Russian River Valley wines. Once you have found your favorite, choose a glass from our specialty curated wine flight to enjoy with a delicious picnic lunch, prepared by our local partners at Willow Wood Market & Cafe. Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

Source: Press Democrat

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
A relaxed and elegant garden experience! Your host will guide you through a tasting of our Russian River Valley estate wines. In inclement weather, this experience will be hosted in our charming tasting room.

Enhance your visit with an option to add-on cheese & charcuterie or artisanal chocolates to make your wine country experience even more delightful.

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

Club Member: Four Complimentary Tastings per Visit

Source: Press Democrat

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Source: Press Democrat

description:
Thursdays, January 29 ‚Äì March 19, 2026 2:00 PM ‚Äì 5:00 PM

All Levels

17\+

$265 ‚Äì Registration Cost $30 ‚Äì Materials Fee $295 ‚Äì Total Registration Cost

Deborah Donahower takes you through the fundamentals of working with clay in on the wheel in this 8 week course.

What you‚Äôll do

Deborah Donahower takes you through the fundamentals of working with clay in on the wheel in this 8 week course. Designed for all levels \(beginners and those more experienced\) Deborah thoughtfully explores the tried and true techniques of ceramic work with her students through structured assignments, allowing her students to develop their own creative voice in the process.Students will receive instruction in wheel work, glazing, and finishing pieces. With your 8 week class registration, students receive the opportunity to purchase a studio pass for ¬Ω off during the duration of their class. Sign ups for membership will be included in your pre class email.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

title: Barbies & Bags Workshop
location:
Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
Schedule

Sunday, February 15, 2026 1:00 PM ‚Äì 4:00 PM

Location

Room 201, Fiber Arts Studio

Experience Level

All Levels

Kids, Programming, Sustainability

Age\(s\)

All Ages are welcome to attend Children under 16 must be accompanied by an adult

$25 ‚Äì One Bag or Doll Entry $40 ‚Äì Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 ‚Äì 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we‚Äôll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: TTRPG Club (Tabletop Role-Playing Game Club)
description:
Join us for a monthly Tabletop Role-playing Game Club \(TTRPG\) on the third Thursday of every month from 4-5pm. For Tweens and Teens \(grades 4-12\) Play TTRPG games like D&D \(Dungeons and Dragons\) and a variety of TTRPGs like Library Cats and Hero Quest. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Games will be run by a variety of Librarian and Teen DMs. Bring your own already-made character sheet or choose from one of our premade characters \(https://dndadventureclub.com/resources/characters\). Players are encouraged to bring their dice, books, miniatures, etc. No personal materials are needed to play, but attendees are encouraged to bring their supplies if they own them. Please be on time and ready to play. Sessions are about 30-45 minutes. Please register for this program so we have an estimate for group sizes and so that we can email notifications about this program. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Looking for DMs! Are you a 13-18 and interested in running a game for tweens and teens? Email us at kdargeou@sonomalibrary.org ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Tabletop roleplaying games \(TTRPGs\) empower students to be creative and solve problems as a team.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
Celebrating the brilliance of Joni's Ballads, Art Songs, and Jazz, The Joni Mitchell Situation invites you to come in out of the wet cold to hear her words and music live, presented with heart and good humor. Kate Foley-Beining on vocals, piano, guitar, and dulcimer is backed by Sonoma County jazz greats: Tom Shader on bass, Kevin Dillon on drums, and Christian Foley-Beining on guitar. Experience her genre-bending array of styles from Goodbye Porkpie Hat to The Fiddle and the Drum, from Black Crow to Shine.

title: The Joni Mitchell Situation
description:
Celebrating the brilliance of Joni's Ballads, Art Songs, and Jazz, The Joni Mitchell Situation invites you to come in out of the wet cold to hear her words and music live, presented with heart and good humor. Kate Foley-Beining on vocals, piano, guitar, and dulcimer is backed by Sonoma County jazz greats: Tom Shader on bass, Kevin Dillon on drums, and Christian Foley-Beining on guitar. Experience her genre-bending array of styles from Goodbye Porkpie Hat to The Fiddle and the Drum, from Black Crow to Shine.

Source: Press Democrat

title: Monthly Men's Circle - 3rd Thursday
location: The Unstruck Drum - Center for Shamanism
description:
This monthly gathering meets every third Thursday of each month. We have the intention of offering a safe space for all men who walk a path of seeking authenticity. Led by Collin Hoctor, this group brings community, shares wisdom, and brings healing to those who desire to walk a deeper, more meaningful life.

From Collin:

I am a psychotherapist and guide whose work weaves together spirituality, nature-based practices, psychedelic therapy, and recovery. My path has been shaped by a foundation in existential philosophy and psychology, medicine circles, and a lifelong study of contemplative and esoteric traditions. Out of my own longing for community and a commitment to the needs of the moment, I am passionate about creating spaces for men to gather in honesty, vulnerability, and authenticity ‚Äî places where we can face our struggles, share our truths, and remember the healing power of connection.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Encaustic + Mixed Media
description:
Join us at Encaustic Open Studio, a monthly workshop designed for you to refine your encaustic painting skills¬†under the guidance of knowledgeable instructor Susan¬†Heeringa Piper. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced artist, this is the perfect opportunity to immerse yourself in the captivating world of encaustic art.

Encaustic painting is an ancient technique that involves using molten beeswax and pigments to create stunning, textured masterpieces. This unique medium allows for endless possibilities, as it can be layered, carved, scraped, and fused to create mesmerizing effects and depth. From ethereal landscapes to abstract creations, encaustic painting offers a truly immersive and tactile experience.¬†

Bring your own substrate or project to work on, or start something new!

title: Marty O'Reilly
description:
There‚Äôs something about Marty O‚ÄôReilly‚Äôs music that feels like it‚Äôs always been here‚Äîlike an old story being told in a new way. His voice is raw and real, his guitar playing gritty and soulful. It‚Äôs music that doesn‚Äôt try to be anything other than honest, and that‚Äôs exactly why it hits so hard.

He pulls inspiration from the roots of Americana; his sound references folk greats like Woody Guthrie, blues legends like Howlin‚Äô Wolf,  gospel pioneers like Sister Rosetta Thorpe, and master storytellers like Tom Waits. It‚Äôs a sound that captivates and connects audiences, and leaves them wanting more.

His live shows aren‚Äôt just concerts‚Äîthey‚Äôre cathartic experiences. One moment it‚Äôs soft and haunting, the next it‚Äôs wild and electric. The kind that stay with you long after the lights come up.

But it‚Äôs not just about the sound. Marty‚Äôs songs dig deep into the human experience‚Äîloneliness, connection, love, loss. Whether it‚Äôs an intimate solo set or a full band show, he makes every audience feel like they‚Äôre part of the story.

Over the years, Marty has built a dedicated following through relentless touring and staying true to his craft. He‚Äôs shared the stage with artists like Shakey Graves, St. Paul & The Broken Bones, Sarah Jarosz, and Alice O‚ÄôDonovan and played at festivals like Bottlerock, SXSW, and High Sierra Music Festival, but his focus has always been on making music that means something.

Marty has poured everything into his music‚Äîspending years on the road, self-funding his albums, and navigating the ups and downs of life as an independent artist, husband, and father. But through it all, he‚Äôs never lost sight of why he started: to make honest music that connects.

If you‚Äôre looking for music that feels real, that makes you stop and listen, Marty O‚ÄôReilly is someone you need to hear.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Painting Flora and Fauna in Watercolor
description:
Schedule

Fridays, March. 20- April 24, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

All Levels

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$275** ‚Äì Registration Cost **$25** ‚Äì Materials Fee **$300** ‚Äì Total Registration CostIn this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium.

About the Class

In this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. We will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational drawing skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step-by-step layering process that trains the artist to see value and color. Our subject matter will be flora and fauna ‚Äì a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬† Instructor Hannah Day is a passionate nature lover and watercolorist and will share her unique approach to rendering botanicals and animal portraits in watercolor. This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With six class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬† This class is open to artists of all skill levels. All materials are provided.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
Price: Adult $10, Senior/Full Time Student $5 \(Plus a $2 p er ticket service Charge Online\)

Ticket Info:

Sponsor: Marin Center

Link: http://www.marincounty.org/depts/cu

The Frank Lloyd Wright-designed Marin County Civic Center is a national- and state-designated historic landmark. Ninety minute docent-led tours of the Civic Center are offered every Wednesday and Friday at 10:30 am, leaving from the second floor Caf√©, Room 233. The cost is $10 adults and $5 seniors and students. No reservations are required. Groups of ten or more can arrange a private docent tour by calling the Visitor Services Office at \(415\) 473-3762.

title: TASTE OF PLACE - SEASONAL VINES & WINES TOUR
description:
Step into the heart of Campovida's organic farming practices with our Taste and Tour - a genuine journey where the vineyard unfolds its stories, like two familiar friends catching up. Immerse yourself in the history of winemaking as our guides share tales of the vineyard's heritage, tracing the evolution from humble beginnings to the exceptional wines we produce today. Feel the connection to the land as you touch the grapes and absorb the essence of the very soil that defines our winemaking legacy. Explore our 150 acres of thriving vineyards, starting with the award-winning Viognier right in our front yard and moving on to the backyard for some Sangiovese goodness. These vines, like the stories they hold, have been organically grown for decades. Farm = Life

Source: Press Democrat

Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. title: Bell Brothers
description:
Meet The Bell Brothers, a dynamic duo whose harmonies and songwriting prowess have resonated with audiences for nearly two decades. Comprised of brothers Russ and Scott, this powerhouse team has etched their mark on the musical landscape with a fusion of Country, Rock, and Americana, delivering a sound steeped in passion, musicianship, and gritty authenticity.

For nearly 20 years, The Bell Brothers have honed their craft, evolving their sound while staying true to their roots. From intimate coffee shops to electrifying stadiums, their live shows are a testament to their commitment to delivering authentic performances that leave audiences captivated.

Whether they're crooning heartfelt country ballads or belting out anthemic rock tunes, The Bell Brothers' music speaks to the soul, forging a deep connection with listeners wherever they go. With each strum of the guitar and each note sung in harmony, they continue to leave an indelible mark on the hearts of fans old and new alike.

description:
Join our beginner salsa class. No experience or partner is needed. Just comfortable shoes and desire to have fun!

Great for first timers!

No dance experience required

Non-marking shoes soles

No partner necessary

We know it can be challenging to learn something new. As such, the beginner salsa class is geared for people who are starting out or those that are returning to refresh their skills. Our relaxed environment is perfect for learning salsa basics, as we make it fun and enjoyable. In this class you will learn basic directional steps, proper frame for partner-work and simple turn patterns. We organize our curriculum so that the movements are easy to remember. Join us to learn the fundamentals! No experience is necessary and no partner is required. Drop-in fee is $20.

title: Intermediate Salsa with Tyler
description:
Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?

Are you a salsa dancer who has the basics down but is ready to add more? Our Intermediate Salsa Class with Tyler is designed to help you transform your dancing moves. In this class, you‚Äôll go beyond the basics to learn intricate footwork, enhance your leading and following skills, and master the body movement that will make you shine on the dance floor. This class is for anyone ready to learn the techniques and intermediate steps needed to take their dancing to the next level.

You‚Äôll learn intermediate dancing techniques that will help you:

Express yourself with sharper footwork and styling.

Master complex turn patterns and combinations.

Strengthen your lead and follow for seamless, connected dancing.

Adapt to different partners and music with ease on the social dance floor.

What to Expect:¬†Instructor Tyler blends a fun, supportive atmosphere with structured lessons, so you‚Äôre always challenged but never overwhelmed. Helping you progress steadily while keeping the joy of salsa front and center.

No partner necessary‚Äîrotations ensure everyone dances.

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
**We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†**No experience is necessary**¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

Sound Sessions is our monthly Friday night series where the format changes but the vibe stays the same: welcoming, unpretentious, and all about bringing people together through music.

Celebrate women in music through the crackle and warmth of vinyl. March‚Äôs Sound Sessions honors Women‚Äôs History Month with a curated listening party featuring iconic female artists. We‚Äôll spin selected albums, share context and stories, not as background- but as the main event. If you have an album you‚Äôd like to play and tell us what it means to you, please bring it to share!

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: Documenting Current Events Through Poetry: A Workshop
description:
Learn about writing impactful documentary poems. Examples will be shared that combine personal observations and information collected from news outlets and other sources. Beginners welcome. This workshop will be led by Sonoma County Poet Laureate Dave Seter and Sonoma County Librarian Terra Emerson. Dave Seter is a poet, nature writer, translator, and the author of the full-length poetry collection Don't Sing to Me of Electric Fences \(Cherry Grove Collections, 2021\), and the chapbooks Somewhere West of the Mississippi \(Mammoth Publications, 2025\) and Night Duty \(Main Street Rag, 2010\). Educated as a civil engineer, he writes about social and environmental issues. He has been an Affiliate Artist at the Headlands Center for the Arts, and served on the Board of Directors of Marin Poetry Center. He has been named Sonoma County Poet Laureate 2024-2026.

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: MovingWriting: Embodied Expressive Writing
description:
In¬†MovingWriting¬†workshops, we play with movement/dance and words to help us connect with our deep and creative selves in the company of a supportive circle. Giving voice to our own stories and witnessing the stories of others brings healing, aliveness, and connection with others.

No moving or writing experience necessary!

Here's what a few recent¬†MovingWriting¬†participants had to say about their experience:

‚ÄúLoretta's well-crafted writing prompts sparked a writer inside me that I didn't know I had‚Ä¶ I left feeling invigorated, accomplished and proud of myself for trying something new.‚Äù

‚ÄúI'm neither a writer nor a dancer, but Loretta made it easy to put aside my inhibitions and let my emotional body lead the way‚Ä¶ I recommend this class for anybody at all!‚Äù

"It felt delicious to dive into my creative moving and language self with others. For days after, I felt both emptied and filled up creatively in ways that I hadn‚Äôt felt in a long time."

"I felt refreshed, renewed, and like I had processed some emotional blockages‚Ä¶ The paths were opened and the words just flowed."

Come move and write with us! Visit www.MovingWriting.com to learn more & register for upcoming events.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: 2026 Spring Tour USA - HopMonk
description:
Corb Lund is an alt-country singer-songwriter from Alberta, Canada. He grew up in a ranching and rodeo family in the foothills of Southern Alberta, then spent the early years of his career writing songs and playing bass for the indie rock band  called the smalls. 

Lund‚Äôs music reflects his Western heritage and rock and roll roots. His distinct blend of Americana-meets-roots-meets-alt-country has attracted accolades from critics in Canada and the U.S., who have called him ‚Äúone of the best contemporary country songwriters‚Äù \(Popmatters\) and one of the ‚Äú10 New Country Artists You Need to Know‚Äù \(Rolling Stone Country\). 

Lund‚Äôs 2015 release, Things That Can‚Äôt Be Undone, was produced by Grammy Award-nominated producer Dave Cobb \(Jason Isbell, Sturgill Simpson, Chris Stapleton\). His previous record, 2014‚Äôs Counterfeit Blues, was recorded at the legendary Sun Studio in Memphis, TN, and was the focus of a 2-hour CMT special. Previous to that, 2012‚Äôs Cabin Fever debuted at \#1 on the Billboard Canadian Charts, and Hair In My Eyes Like A Highland Steer is certified Platinum in Canada. 

Along with his band, the Hurtin‚Äô Albertans, Lund tours extensively throughout Canada, the U.S., Europe, and Australia. Currently signed to New West Records, Lund is an eight-time Canadian Country Music Awards Roots Artist of the Year, the 2017 BreakOut West Roots Solo Artist of the Year, and has many other awards and accolades, including a JUNO Award, under his belt.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Santa Rosa Symphony - Rossini & Schubert
description:
Rossini & Schubert March 21, 22 & 23, 2026 Weill Hall, Green Music Center Francesco Lecce-Chong, conductor Elizabeth Prior, viola Adelle-Akiko Kearns, cello Roy Zajac, clarinet Robert Giambruno, trumpet Bruce Chrisp, trombone Allen Biggs, marimba GIOACHINO ROSSINI: Overture to Il barberiere di Siviglia \[The Barber of Seville\] SHUYING LI: Coping Cadences \(World Premiere\) FRANZ SCHUBERT: Symphony No. 8 in B minor, D.759, Unfinished GIOACHINO ROSSINI: Overture to Guillaume Tell \[William Tell\] Celebrate the artistry of two musical giants: Rossini's sparkling wit and Schubert's moving melodies. With its theatrical flair and rhythm-driven energy, Rossini's William Tell Overture contrasts beautifully with Schubert's Unfinished Symphony, which offers a glimpse of his profound creative brilliance and introspective lyricism. Additionally, the world premiere of Shuying Li's concerto grosso Coping Cadences ignites the imagination while merging traditional and contemporary elements. Programs, dates, artists, and prices are subject to change without notice. Tickets are nonrefundable and subject to availability.

title: Mouths of Babes
description:
‚ÄúIf I was forced to categorize it, I‚Äôd call it modern folk. It‚Äôs powerful, romantic, and giddy. And the two are insanely infectious together onstage, like a musical and a personal love fest all at once.‚Äù  ‚Äì Huffington Post  With more than a dozen albums and over a thousand shows between them, Ty Greenstein and Ingrid Elizabeth of Mouths of Babes are no strangers to the contemporary folk music scene. For years, their respective bands Girlyman and Coyote Grace captivated thousands of loyal fans as they criss-crossed the country, rocked festival main stages, and toured with the likes of the Indigo Girls and Dar Williams. Now, as Mouths of Babes, Ty and Ingrid have distilled the very best of the songwriting, musicianship, and humor of their previous groups into a new duo that brings more style and depth than ever before.  Mouths of Babes recorded their highly anticipated first full-length album, Brighter In the Dark at Prairie Sun Studios in northern California last summer on the strength of a wildly successful, 800-backer, $56,000 Kickstarter campaign. Released in January 2017, the self-produced album contains twelve original songs with contrasting themes of light and dark, tragedy and comedy, personal and political. Mixed by Stewart Lerman \(Dar Williams, Bob Dylan\), Brighter features guest appearances from Birds of Chicago, Tania Elizabeth \(The Avett Brothers\), Mai Bloomfield \(Jason Mraz\) and others.  No Depression writes, ‚ÄúMouths of Babes could never have predicted how necessary Brighter In The Dark \[would be\] in a post-Trump world. The album title is fitting. We need music that shows people struggling against social expectations, that reminds us that we all have the resilience we need to make it through.‚Äù Thinking Lyrically blog gives the album 9 stars out of 10: "An eclectic arsenal of songs, showcasing their knack for fusing blues, folk, and soul with poetic lyrics \[and\] great choruses...an incredibly versatile record. One of my new favourite listens.‚Äù  The key to the Mouths of Babes magic is in the contrast; the differences in both their songwriting and personal styles makes for an unusually satisfying yin and yang. Of their live show, the Chicago Tribune writes, ‚ÄúThey offer unique counterpoints to one another‚Ä¶the laidback Ty, nattily dressed in a tie and crisp suit jacket, has a rich, lovely alto. Ingrid, clad in a sultry pink satin mini-dress, is a sassy chanteuse with a lilting soprano. Trading jokes and sharing elegant harmonies, the two women display an intuitive professional bond.‚Äù They easily switch off lead vocals and play a wide array of instruments, with Ty on acoustic and electric guitars and foot percussion, and Ingrid playing upright bass, ukulele, and cajon.  Onstage, Ty makes a quiet impression as a gifted lyricist, talented multi-instrumentalist, and magnetic presence. ‚ÄúThe poignant honesty that Ty brings to \[her\] tunes gives them an emotional intensity that‚Äôs as bracing as it is moving,‚Äù says Relix Magazine.  The Americana Gazette writes, ‚ÄúTy‚Äôs practice of extending metaphors out toward a precipice keeps an unpredictable edge to her songs. Most writers would stop at the easy close. Ty jumps, leaving much to the imagination, to powerful effect.‚Äù Ingrid, a natural performer, easily commands audiences with her larger-than-life sassiness and professional dancer‚Äôs grace. "With a background in burlesque, sex-education, and good ol' American roots music," writes Kithfolk, "Ingrid Elizabeth brings a ton of charisma to her performances." Curve Magazine calls Ingrid ‚Äúthe fiery redheaded bassist...the unabashed, unapologetic woman who isn‚Äôt afraid to yell it all from the rooftops.‚Äù  Both Ingrid and Ty come from notable musical families, and their influences \(namely, 60‚Äôs folk music and Motown\) are deeply embedded in Mouths of Babes‚Äô sound. Ty‚Äôs father, Ron Greenstein, is a member of the legendary folk harmony trio The Chad Mitchell Trio \(where John Denver got his start\), while Ingrid‚Äôs uncle Tom Eyen wrote the world-famous, Tony-winning musical Dreamgirls.  MTV News writes: ‚ÄúThe songs Mouths of Babes writes and performs together fuse blues, folk, and soul, and the depth of emotion found in their lyrics is reminiscent of all that‚Äôs moving about the Dreamgirls soundtrack.‚Äù  ‚ÄúHands down the best new music I've heard in years. It's damn near perfect. The instrumental performances, the arrangements, the production, the songwriting and singing‚Ä¶this is the kind of music that makes you glad to be alive. ‚Äù ‚Äì Michael Mullane, Cafe Veritas Mouths of Babes is Ty Greenstein \(Girlyman\) & Ingrid Elizabeth \(Coyote Grace\). Equal parts celebration and blues. Folky, soulful deliciousness. Get some.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: In Her Power
location:
Mare Island Art Studios

110 Pintado St.

Vallejo, CA

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
In Her Power

A Collaboration by Priscila Soares & JeanCherie

In Her Power is a group exhibition celebrating women‚Äôs presence, strength, and creative expression. Anchored by a collaborative, life-size sculptural work by Priscila Soares and JeanCherie, the exhibition brings together works by women artists exploring power as something lived, embodied, and deeply personal.

At the heart of the gallery stands a mountain lioness woman ‚Äî a guardian figure shaped by two artists working together, each bringing her own voice, materials, and vision. Surrounding this central work, invited artists contribute pieces that reflect their own relationship to power, resilience, intuition, and selfhood.

Rather than offering a single definition, In Her Power invites viewers to witness many expressions of strength ‚Äî quiet and fierce, ancestral and contemporary, individual and shared. It is both a celebration of women artists and an invitation to step into presence, creativity, and connection.

Opening Reception:

March 1, 12‚Äì4pm

Gallery Hours:

Sundays in March, 12‚Äì4pm

Mare Island Art Studios

110 Pintado St.

Vallejo, CA

title: Flora & Fauna - Watercolor Course with Hannah Day at Bohemian Flowers Farm
location:
Bohemian Flowers Farm, 121 Bohemian Hwy, Freestone, CA

Dates: Four Sundays - March 8, 15, 22, 29

Time: 1 - 4 pm

Ages: Adults

Skill Levels: All Levels

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
In this 4 week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. The class will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step by step layering process, that trains the artist to see value and color

Our subject matter will be flora and fauna - a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬†

This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With 4 class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬†

All materials provided.

Location: Bohemian Flowers Farm, 121 Bohemian Hwy, Freestone, CA

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Santa Rosa Symphony - Rossini & Schubert
description:
Rossini & Schubert March 21, 22 & 23, 2026 Weill Hall, Green Music Center Francesco Lecce-Chong, conductor Elizabeth Prior, viola Adelle-Akiko Kearns, cello Roy Zajac, clarinet Robert Giambruno, trumpet Bruce Chrisp, trombone Allen Biggs, marimba GIOACHINO ROSSINI: Overture to Il barberiere di Siviglia \[The Barber of Seville\] SHUYING LI: Coping Cadences \(World Premiere\) FRANZ SCHUBERT: Symphony No. 8 in B minor, D.759, Unfinished GIOACHINO ROSSINI: Overture to Guillaume Tell \[William Tell\] Celebrate the artistry of two musical giants: Rossini's sparkling wit and Schubert's moving melodies. With its theatrical flair and rhythm-driven energy, Rossini's William Tell Overture contrasts beautifully with Schubert's Unfinished Symphony, which offers a glimpse of his profound creative brilliance and introspective lyricism. Additionally, the world premiere of Shuying Li's concerto grosso Coping Cadences ignites the imagination while merging traditional and contemporary elements. Programs, dates, artists, and prices are subject to change without notice. Tickets are nonrefundable and subject to availability.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

With its theatrical flair and rhythm-driven energy, Rossini‚Äôs *William Tell Overture* contrasts beautifully with Schubert‚Äôs *Unfinished Symphony*, which offers a glimpse of his profound creative brilliance and introspective lyricism. Additionally, the world premiere of Shuying Li‚Äôs concerto grosso *Coping Cadences* ignites the imagination while merging traditional and contemporary elements.

title: Napa, CA: Taking Tangents Tour
description:
Leaving Dublin, Ireland where he was born and raised until the age of 22, Dave got drunk on travel and never quite hit sobriety of it. He has lived and worked in twelve countries and visited over seventy. His shows draw on his wide travels, cultural observations, attempts at language study, \(occasional\) international drinking session\(s\) and being a mildly confused immigrant. 

Dave is the winner of the prestigious annual San Francisco Comedy Competition, \(previous finalists include Robin Williams, Ellen DeGeneres and Dana Carvey\) and runner up in the Moth‚Äôs largest US Grandslam storytelling competition. He recorded his debut special for Dry Bar Comedy in 2019 and has been featured on TED.com, The Irish Independent, Inc, NPR, and the Huffington Post among others. A festival favourite Dave‚Äôs videos have also gone viral many times over with over 150 million views and a social following of over one million.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Tord Gustavsen Trio
description:
A rare opportunity to be up close and personal with the Tord Gustavsen Trio

"A Norwegian pianist of lyrical and often halcyon sensibilities" \(NY Times\), Gustavsen and his trio bring a stripped-down approach in which beauty and emotional intensity are united. His new ECM release, Opening, explores the concept of openness and taking inspiration from the forces that surround us.

A pianist of poetic cast, an exceptionally lucid player with a sure sense of melodic structure and an often-astonishing lyrical imagination. - JazzTimes

Cool and mysterious, pristine and intensely emotional, the music of Norwegian pianist Tord Gustavsen has earned a vast following while making few populist concessions. Easily the most acclaimed composer and pianist on the Norwegian jazz scene, he's released a series of critically hailed albums that have climbed high on the Norwegian pop charts, starting with his 2003's ECM debut Changing Places.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Handbuilding 101
description:
Mondays, January 26 ‚Äì March 23, 2026 9:30 AM ‚Äì 12:30 PM Exceptions: February 16, Presidents Day

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Ceramics

Age\(s\)

17\+

$265 ‚Äì Registration Cost $30 ‚Äì Materials Fee $295 ‚Äì Total Registration Cost

Learn the fundamentals of creating handbuilt, functional objects with clay in this 8 week course. Thoughtfully explore the tried and true techniques of ceramic work!

What you‚Äôll do

Deborah Donahower takes you through the fundamentals of working with clay in hand building in this 8 week course. Designed for all levels \(beginners and those more experienced\) Deborah thoughtfully explores the tried and true techniques of ceramic work with her students through structured assignments, allowing her students to develop their own creative voice in the process. This course will emphasize building functional forms with creative surface design in mind; focusing on forms with large areas to explore texture, painterly surface techniques, and much more. Students will receive instruction in hand building, and basic glazing techniques. With your 8 week class registration, students receive the opportunity to purchase a studio pass for ¬Ω off during the duration of their class. Sign ups for membership will be included in your pre class email 

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

title: Santa Rosa Symphony - Rossini & Schubert
description:
Rossini & Schubert March 21, 22 & 23, 2026 Weill Hall, Green Music Center Francesco Lecce-Chong, conductor Elizabeth Prior, viola Adelle-Akiko Kearns, cello Roy Zajac, clarinet Robert Giambruno, trumpet Bruce Chrisp, trombone Allen Biggs, marimba GIOACHINO ROSSINI: Overture to Il barberiere di Siviglia \[The Barber of Seville\] SHUYING LI: Coping Cadences \(World Premiere\) FRANZ SCHUBERT: Symphony No. 8 in B minor, D.759, Unfinished GIOACHINO ROSSINI: Overture to Guillaume Tell \[William Tell\] Celebrate the artistry of two musical giants: Rossini's sparkling wit and Schubert's moving melodies. With its theatrical flair and rhythm-driven energy, Rossini's William Tell Overture contrasts beautifully with Schubert's Unfinished Symphony, which offers a glimpse of his profound creative brilliance and introspective lyricism. Additionally, the world premiere of Shuying Li's concerto grosso Coping Cadences ignites the imagination while merging traditional and contemporary elements. Programs, dates, artists, and prices are subject to change without notice. Tickets are nonrefundable and subject to availability.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Access to exclusive records Visitors to FamilySearch Centers get special access to images of historical records that are only available in centers. title: After School - Create Your Own Storybook World!
description:
Every Tuesday 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM

Please see website: Exact dates are available on Enrichment.kids. Click the registration links below.

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Kids

Age\(s\)

7-11

$100 ‚Äì Monthly Session Cost

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you‚Äôll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist: ¬†Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\),¬†Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\)¬†. Inspired by their playful styles, students will¬†design and develop their very own characters‚Äîdeciding where these characters¬†live, work, play, eat, and sleep!¬†Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.¬† Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

¬†watercolor, paint, pens,¬†and¬†collage

¬†recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use¬†watercolor techniques¬†to add color and mood

How¬†scale¬†helps characters and environments feel real

The¬†arc of a story‚Äîbeginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using¬†background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Room 116

description:

**$360** ‚Äì Registration CostPresented by the Sonoma Community Center in partnership with The Game Academy

Join Adventure Gaming classes with The Game Academy! Play D&D, build community, and grow empathy through weekly storytelling sessions.

About the class

class descriptionAdventure Gaming classes presented by The Game Academy are held weekly for¬†2-hour sessions over an 8-week term.¬†Participating players explore collaborative storytelling in a mentorship model using¬†games like Dungeons & Dragons to build community, foster¬†empathy, and support social-emotional growth. Our trained Educator-Gamemasters guide players in choosing the kinds of stories that interest them, then support unique and dynamic character creation, and finally¬†present an engaging narrative filled with puzzles and mysteries to be solved, social role-play to navigate, and¬†tactical challenges to be overcome‚Ä¶ all based on the players‚Äô interests.¬†This uniquely tailored experience¬†provides a rich context of personal investment, and engages our players with a fun and collaborative activity that helps them overcome social and emotional challenges, teaches them to engage with a growth mindset, supports the development of critical thinking and cooperative problem-solving skills, and helps them form lasting bonds with their peers. We hope your child will join us for a new adventure this coming Fall Term at the Sonoma Community Center.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
**We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†**No experience is necessary**¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
Schedule

Wednesday, March 11 ‚Äì April 22, 2026 11:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

Intermediate

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$225** ‚Äì Registration CostAdvance your drawing skills with deep study of composition, value, and technique. Strengthen your creative process through focused practice.

About the Class

In this class, we will explore composition, value, and other aspects of drawing but on a deeper level. Beginning drawing classes have a lot of ground to cover so the concepts are skimmed over in order to give you exposure to as many as possible. Next-level drawing takes the time to do a deeper dive into some of the principles of drawing. When drawing we use limited tools which allow us to isolate both our strengths and weaknesses. Using this opportunity to really investigate our own process will serve to strengthen all aspects of our creative work. Drawing can be a challenge but when you see how it enhances the creative process, you will know it is worth it. This class is suitable for students who have a basic understanding of drawing and want to work on their skills. Please bring the following materials to class: 20‚Ä≥ x 26‚Ä≥ drawing board with clips, 18 ‚Äúx 24‚Äù Strathmore drawing pad (other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal (Char-kole brand black), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black (one fine-tip and one medium-tip).Membership has its benefits

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

Club Member: Four Complimentary Tastings per Visit

Source: Press Democrat

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Source: Press Democrat

title: Picnic Lunch and Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
Begin your wine-tasting experience with a guided tasting led by our host, who will introduce you to our exclusive estate Russian River Valley wines. Once you have found your favorite, choose a glass from our specialty curated wine flight to enjoy with a delicious picnic lunch, prepared by our local partners at Willow Wood Market & Cafe. Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

Source: Press Democrat

title: Markham Vineyards Private Tasting: The Cabernet Connoisseur‚Äôs Experience
description:

DATE: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

title: Wise Girl Workshops - School Year Wellness Workshops
description:
Whose ready to be a part of an amazing group of girls and youth who are open minded and hearted‚Äîready to make new friends AND develop essential life skills to help them learn to live well?

We are now enrolling for our School Year Wellness Workshops for girls in 3rd-8th grades.

Meeting for a full 15 weeks, members make fantastic friendships, have fun engaging in activities and art projects, and learn social-emotional-physical tools that will help them throughout their lifetime.

We‚Äôve got 3 amazing facilitators and workshops are hosted at McKinley School in Petaluma-though members come from a variety of schools and towns to attend opening up even further opportunities for making even more friends!

title: Stitch Together
description:
Join us for Stitch Caf√©, a cozy open studio held twice a month. Whether you're working on your own project or eager to explore new mending techniques like darning and appliqu√©, this is the perfect space to gather, share ideas, and sew together. We provide hand-sewing supplies and materials, but feel free to bring your own - it's all about community, creativity, and enjoying the process.By repairing what we already have and re-using materials, we're not just preserving memories and adding unique touches to our belongings - we‚Äôre also reducing waste and contributing to a more sustainable lifestyle. We can extend the life of our clothes and fabrics, and take small but meaningful steps toward caring for the planet.

title: Cardio Dance Fitness
description:
Want to relieve stress and get fit at the same time?Come boogie with me at the library for an upbeat workout, jamming to some Hip Hop, R&B, Latin, and Bollywood tunes. This workout involves a combination of dancing and other cardio-aerobic, non-weight training. Light Cardio Class 5:15 - 6:15pm This class will be a light cardio class where we will be doing some exercises seated in a chair; some light stretching, and other less intense cardio movements. Cardio Dance Fitness 6:30 - 7:30pm This intermediate class is designed for those who are interested in a more rigorous style training and requires endurance. Activity will mostly involve dance cardio mixed with some calisthenics training to include jumping, running, or participating in rigorous dance cardio. Think of it as boot camp dance cardio training! Please note: This class is not for people with mobility ailments or injuries preventing active movement.
