title: Spooky Book Club
description:
Spooky Book Club meets at 6pm on the last Wednesday of each month. Read any novel, novella, graphic novel, etc. that fits the monthly theme and join us for great conversation and community.

THEMES

January

Monsters & Creatures:¬†Vampires, werewolves, demons, cryptids, or anything non-human and terrifying. 

February

Folk Horror & Urban Legends:¬†Curses, rituals, superstition, isolated communities, local myths.

March

Survivor‚Äôs Guilt:¬†Survivors, slashers, killer-on-the-loose stories.

April

Psychological Terror:¬†Unreliable narrators, paranoia, mind games, and slow-burn dread.

May

Haunted Places:¬†Ghosts, cursed houses, abandoned buildings, restless spirits.

June

Weird Fiction & Cosmic Horror:¬†Eldritch vibes, the unknowable, reality-bending strangeness

July

Body Horror:¬†Transformation, disease, medical terror, the uncanny in flesh.

August

Dark Academia:¬†Creepy campuses, secret societies, intellectual obsession.

September

Eco-Horror & Nature Strikes Back:¬†Creatures, plants, or environmental forces turning hostile.

October

Supernatural Thrillers:¬†Possessions, exorcisms, occult forces, or mysterious powers.

November

International Horror:¬†Any horror written by or set in another country/culture.

December

Gothic Classics & Modern Gothics:¬†Old mansions, family secrets, brooding atmosphere, gothic romance elements.

description:

Karaoke moves to the main showroom big stage every Wednesday at 9pm, following Open Mic, and runs until late. Hosting the night is KJ Danny D (Danny Duclos)‚Äîone of the most popular and in-demand karaoke hosts around. We‚Äôre genuinely stoked to have him bringing his style, energy, and crowd-moving presence to Downtown Santa Rosa.

This isn‚Äôt sleepy bar karaoke. Danny brings a fresh, high-energy approach that turns singing into a full-on late-night experience. Big stage, great sound, packed room, and the kind of momentum that keeps people singing well past closing time.

title: Marin Farmers Markets
description:
Price: Free Sponsor: Marin Center

Explore the bounty of summer at the Marin Farmers Markets. Taste vine-ripened tomatoes, corn that was picked that morning, and peaches so juicy you have to bend over just to get a bite. Farm-fresh eggs, grass-fed beef, artisan c heeses, raw milk, and freshly baked breads complete the shopping exper ience. Specialty prepared foods and handmade art add to the magic of the market. Enjoy the intimate feeling of the Thursday Marin Farmers Market, an ideal place to meet for lunch and pick up fresh produce for the weekend. Discover the abundance and diversity of product at the celebrated Sunday Marin Farmers Market, the third largest farmers market in California. Turn your dollar into a vote for local sustainable agriculture, shrink your eco-footprint, and revive the feeling of being intimate ly connected to your food by meeting your farmers face-to-face. The market takes place rain or shine. www.aginstitutemarin.org

Source: Press Democrat

title: BLS Certification Class (American Heart Association)
description:
BLS Certification Class \(AHA\) - In Person, Instructor-Led

American Heart Association BLS certification class \(in-person, instructor-led class in our Rohnert Park classroom\). BLS \(Basic Life Support\) is the required CPR class for healthcare providers. Includes cardiac and respiratory arrest management, CPR, AED use, and choking treatment for all ages. This class is appropriate for initial BLS or BLS renewal.

Vive CPR is an American Heart Association \(AHA\) Training Site. AHA "BLS Provider" certifications are issued on the same day.

We also offer Blended Learning BLS certification courses \(online course plus in-person Skills Session\).

Learn from a top-rated, local CPR training company with over 900 5-star reviews! Our classes are fun, engaging, and expertly taught by experienced first responders.

Learn More & Enroll: https://vivecpr.com/class/bls-certification/

Questions? Call/text \(707\) 612-3277 or https://vivecpr.com/contact

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Picnic Lunch and Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting
description:
Begin your wine-tasting experience with a guided tasting led by our host, who will introduce you to our exclusive estate Russian River Valley wines. Once you have found your favorite, choose a glass from our specialty curated wine flight to enjoy with a delicious picnic lunch, prepared by our local partners at Willow Wood Market & Cafe. Reservations required with advanced booking of 48 hours.

$85 per guest | Club Member: $45 per guest

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Vineyard Garden Wine Tasting

Enhance your visit with an option to add-on cheese & charcuterie or artisanal chocolates to make your wine country experience even more delightful.

$40 per guest | Refundable with two bottle purchase

location:

$25 ‚Äì One Bag or Doll Entry $40 ‚Äì Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 ‚Äì 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we‚Äôll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Vanessa Collier
description:
5x BLUES MUSIC AWARD WINNER

2025 BMA WINNER "HORN PLAYER OF THE YEAR"

2024 BMA WINNER "HORN PLAYER OF THE YEAR"

2022 BMA WINNER ‚ÄúCONTEMPORARY BLUES FEMALE ARTIST OF THE YEAR‚Äù

2020 BMA WINNER ‚ÄúHORN PLAYER OF THE YEAR!‚Äù 

2019 BMA WINNER ‚ÄúHORN PLAYER OF THE YEAR!‚Äù 

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a young lady \[Vanessa Collier\] came onstage with me, I forget where I was, but she‚Äôs playing an alto saxophone, and man, she was amazing.‚Äù

 Those are the words of Buddy Guy in an issue of American Blues Scene, describing an impromptu performance with Vanessa Collier on the Legendary Rhythm & Blues Cruise. If you haven‚Äôt been fortunate enough to meet Vanessa and witness one of her head-turning, fiery, and passionate performances, you should definitely make sure you do. As a master musician and multi-instrumentalist, Vanessa Collier, weaves funk, soul, rock, and blues into every powerful performance and she is downright impressive. With soulful vocals, searing saxophone, and witty songwriting, Vanessa is blazing a trail, racking up an impressive arsenal of honours, and has already singled herself out as an artist of distinction and one we would all do well to watch.

It‚Äôs not simply the accolades she has accumulated so far, although they‚Äôve been many -- two Blues Music Awards for ‚ÄúHorn Player of the Year‚Äù, and a third BMA for ‚ÄúContemporary Blues Female Artist of the Year‚Äù, eight Blues Music Award Nominations \(BMAs\), a Blues Blast Award nomination, the Jammingest Pro Award bestowed by the Legendary Rhythm & Blues Cruise, First Place for lyrics in the International Songwriting Competition, Best of 2014 Blues Breaker on Dan Aykroyd‚Äôs BluesMobile -- it‚Äôs the fact that she has accumulated all these honours even while her career is still in its infancy. A 2013 graduate of the prestigious Berklee College of Music, she‚Äôs toured nationally and internationally, released four critically acclaimed albums \(2014‚Äôs Heart, Soul & Saxophone, 2017‚Äôs Meeting My Shadow, and 2018‚Äôs Honey Up, 2020‚Äôs Heart On The Line. Honey Up spent 9 weeks atop the Billboard Blues Album Charts Top 15, 3 months on the Living Blues Charts at \#10 and \#23, and continues to be spun on Sirius XM‚Äôs B.B. King‚Äôs Bluesville radio station! 

It‚Äôs not surprising that the press has been quick to commend her efforts as well. Blues Blast Magazine affirms, ‚ÄúVanessa Collier is a fresh face on the American blues scene, and in addition to her soulful vocals, she brings a mighty sax to the table...‚Äù Blues Music Magazine proclaims, ‚ÄúCollier is a fresh face who comes to the blues stage carrying her reed instruments, a dual degree from Berklee College of Music in Boston, a major label debut, almost two years of touring with Joe Louis Walker, and a mature musical vision‚Ä¶Collier commands center stage with her vocals, soloing, and stage presence.‚Äù Midwest Record exclaims, ‚ÄúThis bluesy singing sax player knows how to bring the slinking funk to her captivating, award winning sound that has echoes in young Bonnie Raitt/Maria Muldaur vocal sounds‚Ä¶Killer stuff on every level, this sounds like one of the reasons you first became a music fan. Killer stuff.‚Äù and AXS.Com declares that she ‚Äúmight as well go ahead and add another shelf to her trophy case because clearly, she‚Äôs going to need it. With a voice that often recalls that of blues-rock stalwart Bonnie Raitt, Collier turns up the heat...‚Äù

Having first picked up the saxophone at the age of nine, Collier embarked on her road to recognition at Berklee, earning dual degrees in Performance and Music Production & Engineering. While still completing her degree, Collier landed a position touring with Joe Louis Walker for a year and a half before Joe encouraged her to strike out on her own. And strike out she did.

These days, Collier spends much of her time on the road, performing at some of the most prestigious music festivals in the world. Her talents have taken her to the Blues Music Awards Show where, in the words of the Blues Foundation, Vanessa ‚Äúblew the doors off the Blues Music Awards!‚Äù; Ottawa Blues Festival, where she earned two front page newspaper photos and rave reviews after her foot stomping debut there; twice on the Legendary Rhythm and Blues Cruise, where she earned the Jammingest Pro Award and was a featured artist with Tommy Castro‚Äôs Blues Review; Briggs Farm Festival, where she was the ‚Äúmost popular Briggs Farm act in 2017‚Äù \(Elmore Magazine\), and the list continues. 

Vanessa has won 3 Blues Music Awards - two for ‚ÄúHorn Player of the Year‚Äù in 2019 and 2020 and one in 2022 for ‚ÄúContemporary Blues Female Artist of the Year‚Äù!! She has been nominated for eight Blues Music Awards since 2017, which puts her in elite company with artists such as Beth Hart, Samantha Fish, Shemekia Copeland, Ruthie Foster, Trombone Shorty, Al Basile, and Jimmy Carpenter.

As for Collier, she says she‚Äôs happy performing on stages across the world, hoping that she can make a difference with fans and followers along the way. ‚ÄúI am driven to do this because I find it a total form of expression and connection,‚Äù she explains. ‚ÄúI love connecting with an audience and feeling their energy and I hope to inspire people to follow their dreams and passions, to find what brings them joy, and then to pursue it doggedly.‚Äù Vanessa also takes that message to young people as she runs clinics across the country and is active with Blues in the Schools programs. At a recent Blues in the School program, Vanessa invited a stage full of elementary and middle school aged kids up to dance around her while she performed a blues shuffle. Watching the joy on the faces of Vanessa, the kids, and everyone in the auditorium, it is no wonder why Vanessa has become awe-inspiring to all who meet her. On top of talent and hard work, Vanessa shares an incredible heart and a strong purpose. To borrow from the words of an article in Blues Blast Magazine, ‚ÄúVanessa is an important part of the future of the blues, and it would be cool to support her journey."

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
Schedule

Fridays, March. 20- April 24, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

All Levels

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$275** ‚Äì Registration Cost **$25** ‚Äì Materials Fee **$300** ‚Äì Total Registration CostIn this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium.

About the Class

In this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. We will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational drawing skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step-by-step layering process that trains the artist to see value and color. Our subject matter will be flora and fauna ‚Äì a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬† Instructor Hannah Day is a passionate nature lover and watercolorist and will share her unique approach to rendering botanicals and animal portraits in watercolor. This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With six class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬† This class is open to artists of all skill levels. All materials are provided.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

title: Safari West Presents! SaveNature.org
description:
Conservation Dinner Series: Norman Gershenz of  SaveNature.Org joins us in the elephant room after dinner to give a talk about bugs. There will be live bugs! The conservation dinner series is complimentary to all dinner guests. If you want to attend this presentation, please call our reservations team at \(707\) 566-3667 or \(800\) 616-2695 and they can book it for you. Dinner starts at 7:00 PM.    Bio for Norman Gershenz Norman Gershenz is the CEO and co-founder of SaveNature.Org and director of the Insect Discovery Lab. SaveNature.Org has raised more than $4.7 million to help preserve thousands of acres of rainforest, coral reef and desert habitat around the world. Norm created and developed the first Adopt An Acre program in the United States as well as the award-winning Conservation Parking Meter; both raise funds for international conservation. SaveNature.Org's work has been highlighted in National Geographic, Time Magazine, and ABC's World News Tonight. Norm was affiliated with the San Francisco Zoo for more than 18 years as an educator, member of the animal care staff, fundraiser, and researcher. Norm has tracked black rhinos in Zimbabwe, chased orangutans in Borneo, and stalked the elusive platypus in Australia. He has handled boas and bobcats, pandas and elephants, snow leopards and koalas, hippos and hornbills. He has worked as a field biologist and naturalist in Borneo, Malaysia, India, Nepal, Costa Rica and Namibia. \>In 2010 Norm was awarded the prestigious Elizabeth Terwilliger Prize for conservation. In 2015 Norm created Smiles of Hope, a new Nature Assisted Therapy program for hospitalized children. Norm is also a noted gourmet insect chef, a lecturer in biology, an expert birder AND can spot a beetle at 50 mph.

title: A Year to Live
location:
Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
with Vinny Ferraro, Frank Ostaseski and Pam Dunn

This yearlong journey, inspired by Stephen Levine‚Äôs¬†*A Year to Live*, is a heartfelt invitation to people of all ages, at any stage of life. Together, in the spirit of community, we will explore how contemplating death can profoundly deepen our experience of living.

In our modern world, where we often shy away from the reality of our mortality, we rarely pause to consider the preciousness of each moment. The Buddha encouraged us to reflect on death not out of fear, but as a way to awaken to the fleeting beauty of our lives. By embracing this practice, we come to appreciate the fragility and impermanence of our existence.

This program is a yearlong exploration of forgiveness, gratitude, and letting go. Through guided meditations, thoughtful inquiry, and intimate group discussions, we will support one another in discovering what death has to teach us about life and vice versa.

**Program Includes**

**Format**: Online via Zoom (must know how to join a specific breakout room manually)

**Teachings**: Monthly (12) large group sessions (attendance at 10 of 12 live sessions required; this must include the first session on Jan 31st)

**Home Groups (required!)**: Monthly (12), 1-hour, self-facilitated, self-hosted Home Groups that meet in between large group sessions. They are a foundational aspect of this program and will be organized by Spirit Rock. Each group will determine a time/day and location (online or in-person) that works for everyone during the January large group session.

**Home practice**: Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

Register online, and we‚Äôll take you through the basics in some of our stable and beautiful rowing craft: the classic Whitehall rowboat, the classy Adirondack Guideboat, and the cute but sturdy Captain‚Äôs Gig.

No experience necessary, and no $$, either. This is our gift to you.

title: A Year to Live
location:
Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections \(estimated 5-7 hours/month \+ monthly Home Groups \+ daily meditation\)

Access: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

Q&As: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded \(optional\)

Source: Press Democrat
description:
with Vinny Ferraro, Frank Ostaseski and Pam Dunn

This yearlong journey, inspired by Stephen Levine‚Äôs¬†A Year to Live, is a heartfelt invitation to people of all ages, at any stage of life. Together, in the spirit of community, we will explore how contemplating death can profoundly deepen our experience of living.

In our modern world, where we often shy away from the reality of our mortality, we rarely pause to consider the preciousness of each moment. The Buddha encouraged us to reflect on death not out of fear, but as a way to awaken to the fleeting beauty of our lives. By embracing this practice, we come to appreciate the fragility and impermanence of our existence.

This program is a yearlong exploration of forgiveness, gratitude, and letting go. Through guided meditations, thoughtful inquiry, and intimate group discussions, we will support one another in discovering what death has to teach us about life and vice versa.

Program Includes

Format: Online via Zoom \(must know how to join a specific breakout room manually\)

Teachings: Monthly \(12\) large group sessions \(attendance at 10 of 12 live sessions required; this must include the first session on Jan 31st\)

Home Groups \(required!\): Monthly \(12\), 1-hour, self-facilitated, self-hosted Home Groups that meet in between large group sessions. They are a foundational aspect of this program and will be organized by Spirit Rock. Each group will determine a time/day and location \(online or in-person\) that works for everyone during the January large group session.

Home practice: Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections \(estimated 5-7 hours/month \+ monthly Home Groups \+ daily meditation\)

Access: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

Q&As: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded \(optional\)

title: UC Master Gardeners - Climate Adaptation in Your Yard
description:
This talk offers concrete, achievable, science-based means to use your own garden for carbon sequestration, food security, plant and animal habitat, and increased resilience to extreme weather and other climate change events. Leah Halper is a Master Gardener and Garden Sense consultant who helps Sonoma County residents transition their yards to use less water and support more beneficial plants and animals. She is also a UCANR-trained Climate Steward with special interest in resilience food gardening, carbon sequestration, and preserving habitat for plant and animal species at risk. Registration Encouraged: Visit Upcoming Events to complete your registration. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about attending the library talk. Learn about home gardening, pest management, water conservation practices, and more from your Sonoma County UC Master Gardeners! Different presentation topic per location.

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: An Evening in Seville! Rotary Fundraiser
description:
Windsor Rotary Community Foundation Fundraiser

Empowering Windsor Youth

Saturday, March 28 ‚Ä¢ 5‚Äì10 PM ‚Ä¢ Huerta Gym, Downtown Windsor

Join the Windsor Rotary Community Foundation for an unforgettable evening dedicated to strengthening our community and uplifting the next generation. On Saturday, March 28, Huerta Gym transforms into a vibrant celebration filled with rich flavors, dynamic entertainment, and a shared commitment to Empowering Windsor Youth.

Guests will enjoy a delicious spread of tapas, paella, wine, and beer, creating the perfect setting for connection and celebration. Special guest Flamenco dancers will ignite the room with the artistry and passion of Spain, setting the tone for an evening steeped in culture and community spirit.

At the heart of the night is our Silent & Live Auction, featuring unique items, experiences, and local treasures‚Äîall raising essential funds for youth programs that shape Windsor‚Äôs future.

HELP FUND THESE PROGRAMS & MORE

Windsor Unified School District

- Windsor Middle School AVID Program

- AAC Communication Devices ‚Äì Special Education

- Windsor Middle School Farm to Table Program

- Windsor Middle School Student Theatre Program

- 5th Grade Science Camp at Nature Bridge Golden Gate

Community & Youth Development Partners

- Circuit Riders ‚Äì Ecological Restoration & Workforce Training Center

- Chief Doug Williams Gazebo ‚Äì Mark West Area Community Park

- Pacific Coast Air Museum ‚Äì Student STEM Enrichment Program

‚Ä¶and many more programs that inspire, empower, and open doors for Windsor‚Äôs youth.

EVENT EXPERIENCE

Immerse yourself in the vibrant flavors and traditions of Seville with live music, passionate flamenco performances, and both silent & live auctions that bring the community together for a powerful cause.

What‚Äôs Included

- Flamenco Performances

- Wine & Beer

- Tapas & Paella

- Live Music

- Silent Auction

- Live Auction

Evening Highlights

- Authentic Spanish cuisine featuring delectable tapas and paella

- Exhilarating flamenco performances

- Silent & live auctions with one‚Äëof‚Äëa‚Äëkind items

- Special guests and unforgettable entertainment

- Stunning casetas‚Äëstyle d√©cor inspired by Seville‚Äôs iconic Feria de Abril

We are actively accepting sponsorship support and donations of food, beer, wine, and auction items.

More Details: http://www.windsorrotary.org/an-evening-in-seville.../

WHY YOUR SUPPORT MATTERS

With youth services facing increasing challenges and budget cuts, Rotary remains steadfast in its mission to protect and expand opportunities for young people in our community. Your support‚Äîwhether through sponsorship, auction donations, or attending the event‚Äîdirectly fuels these programs and keeps them thriving.

Together, we can make a meaningful impact. Together, we can raise up our youth. Together, we can build a stronger, brighter future for Windsor.

Join the fun. Join the movement. Join us in empowering Windsor‚Äôs youth.

ABOUT ROTARY

Windsor Rotary provides year‚Äëround support to our community. We rely on the generosity and involvement of neighbors like you to continue this important work. Discover more about our club and the people who help make Windsor one of the best places to call home.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Live Music Saturday: Joyce Grant & Co
description:
Joyce Grant singer/songwriter, is no stranger to Vallejo. She performs regularly at the Vallejo Ferry Bldg. Taproom, the Coalshed as well as the Benicia Taphouse. A mezzo-soprano with a voice like dark honey, Grant has been singing jazz and R&B in the Bay Area for over 30 years at venues such the Donatello Hotel in San Francisco, the Ledson Hotel in Sonoma, the Empress Theater in Vallejo, Sam's Chowder House in Half Moon Bay, Nick's in Pacifica to name a few. She is the great-great-niece of famed ragtime composer Scott Joplin and is a frequent participant in the West Coast Ragtime festival. For the past 3 years she has been the lead vocalist for the Walnut Creek Jazz Band, an 18- piece big band. As a songwriter she has released the CD In The Morning \(co-produced with Doug McKeehan , 2010\), a collection of original songs ranging in style from jazz to blues to R&B. She continues to bring her sensitive and powerful vocal interpretations to appreciative audiences that keep coming back for more.  Event website

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

title: In Her Power
location:
Mare Island Art Studios

110 Pintado St.

Vallejo, CA

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
In Her Power

A Collaboration by Priscila Soares & JeanCherie

In Her Power is a group exhibition celebrating women‚Äôs presence, strength, and creative expression. Anchored by a collaborative, life-size sculptural work by Priscila Soares and JeanCherie, the exhibition brings together works by women artists exploring power as something lived, embodied, and deeply personal.

At the heart of the gallery stands a mountain lioness woman ‚Äî a guardian figure shaped by two artists working together, each bringing her own voice, materials, and vision. Surrounding this central work, invited artists contribute pieces that reflect their own relationship to power, resilience, intuition, and selfhood.

Rather than offering a single definition, In Her Power invites viewers to witness many expressions of strength ‚Äî quiet and fierce, ancestral and contemporary, individual and shared. It is both a celebration of women artists and an invitation to step into presence, creativity, and connection.

Opening Reception:

March 1, 12‚Äì4pm

Gallery Hours:

Sundays in March, 12‚Äì4pm

Location:

Mare Island Art Studios

110 Pintado St.

Vallejo, CA

title: Flora & Fauna - Watercolor Course with Hannah Day at Bohemian Flowers Farm
location:
Bohemian Flowers Farm, 121 Bohemian Hwy, Freestone, CA

Dates: Four Sundays - March 8, 15, 22, 29

Time: 1 - 4 pm

Ages: Adults

Skill Levels: All Levels

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
In this 4 week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. The class will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step by step layering process, that trains the artist to see value and color

Our subject matter will be flora and fauna - a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬†

This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With 4 class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬†

All materials provided.

Location: Bohemian Flowers Farm, 121 Bohemian Hwy, Freestone, CA

Dates: Four Sundays - March 8, 15, 22, 29

Time: 1 - 4 pm

Ages: Adults

Skill Levels: All Levels

title: Marjorie Prime
description:
**Artificial Remembrance: The Intersection of Technology and Memory**

***‚ÄúJordan Harrison‚Äôs gently uncanny play imagines a future solution for a person in mourning: the recreation of someone you love as an artificial intelligence.‚Äù* ‚ÄîKate Wyver, The Guardian**

**In *Marjorie Prime*, playwright Jordan Harrison delves into the intricate dance between human memory and artificial intelligence. Set in the not-so-distant future, the narrative centers on 85-year-old Marjorie, whose mind is gradually succumbing to dementia. To combat her fading recollections, her family introduces her to a ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù‚Äîa lifelike holographic projection of her late husband, Walter, programmed to retell the stories of their shared past. As Marjorie interacts with Walter Prime, the lines between authentic memories and reconstructed narratives blur, prompting profound questions about identity, the reliability of our recollections, and the extent to which technology can replicate the essence of human connection. This thought-provoking drama challenges audiences to consider what we choose to remember, what we wish to forget, and how the digital age reshapes the very fabric of our personal histories.**

***Marjorie Prime* has garnered critical acclaim for its insightful exploration and profound commentary on the human condition in an era where technology increasingly intertwines with our daily lives.**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: One hour, 20 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33 Fri/Sat Eve Adult $39.95; Senior $36.95; Under 18 $26.95 Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $47.95; Senior $44.95 \*All prices include fees (707) 523-4185 **boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

title: Nattali Rize
description:
‚Äú‚Ä¶ Enuff corporate noise in the ears of the youth ‚Ä¶ Time to spread the Truth.‚Äù 

With a deep Reggae Influence the Nattali Rize band bring heavy beats & conscious rebel lyrics to a progressive electronic, roots, reggae, dub foundation. But this is more than genre labels; The music, message & intention trancends all that, forget the borders and waters that divide us, the movement is to ignite the great remembrance of who we are, our collective power, what we can be, to break the mental conditioning and find full freedom in this lifetime.

The Nattali Rize project launched out of Jamaica into the US, EU and beyond in 2014 with a strong run of captivating festival performances and national club shows. Now with tours alongside the likes of Michael Franti and Spearhead, Katchafire, Third World, J-Boog, Julian Marley, Tribal Seeds and more under their belt, the worldwide movement is ever rizing!

This is a global mash up of raw energy and vibe that together has been rocking stages since the band first burst onto the scene in 2015.

Ask Nattali where she comes from, she‚Äôll tell you ‚ÄúAll Directions‚Äù, with no fixed address, Nattali is now based where the music takes her, Nattali Rize claims not to belong to any nation state, but to the ever-evolving community of awakening consciousness. The global mission - to uplift, unify consciousness & Rize together

‚ÄúNattali is a bright light in the world with a vision that extends beyond the stage.‚Äù- Michael Franti \(Spearhead\)

Nattali Rize is recognised globally for her unwavering commitment to using her voice and music for the global shift toward Full Freedom and the movement of Truth and Justice over the systemic exploitation of the people and our planet. 

."Our intention with our music is to ignite that memory in ourselves of our individual and collective power to live life to the fullest and recognize our selves and each other as evolving beings of light. A reality of Full Freedom is a possibility on this earth and in these times. We use music to sound frequencies infused with this idea, and to resonate at a higher level than what is currently being permeated across current world culture. People are powerful; we want them to reclaim that power and no longer be servants to a system that has never, and will never, serve them to their fullest potential. As such, our frequency in this system is a rebel ‚Ä¶  Rebel Music, Rebel Frequencies we deal with!‚Äù - Nattali Rize.

The debut album Rebel Frequency, released in May 2018 is available on all platforms now.

December 2018 also sees the release of the official merchandise through the bands brand Rize Nation Wear.

‚ÄúOne of the nation‚Äôs most refreshing voices‚Äù - Rolling Stone.

‚ÄúINFECTIOUS!‚Äù- NPR

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: Developing Your Drawing Eye
description:
Schedule

Mondays, March 9 ‚Äì April 20, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM Exceptions: No class March 23

Experience Level

Beginning

Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$270 ‚Äì Registration Cost $10 ‚Äì Materials Fee $280 ‚Äì Total Registration CostDeveloping Your Drawing Eye

Learn to draw without pressure or grades. Build foundational skills at your own pace through observational techniques. Perfect for beginners. Materials included.

What you‚Äôll do

It‚Äôs never too late to learn to draw ‚Äì especially when nobody‚Äôs grading you. Whether you are an abject beginner, haven‚Äôt picked up a pencil since high school, or you‚Äôre a creative who has always felt intimidated by observational drawing, this six-week class is offered with you in mind. We‚Äôll take the mystery ‚Äì and the pressure ‚Äì out of drawing from observation. You‚Äôll learn how to really see like an artist, practice simple techniques step by step, and build skills at your own pace. No talent required, and perfection is off the table. Studying observational drawing offers a foundational skill set that you will carry into every medium you might wish to explore. Discover the joy of drawing and build practical skills to expand your creative expression! All materials are provided.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

Date & Time: Mondays @ 7PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Brainstormer Trivia with Rick Tosh
description:
So, Trivia-Mongers,¬†you think you're smart? Here's your chance to prove it. Join Quizmaster, Rick Tosh for "Brainstormer Trivia". Six rounds of compelling trivia that boggles the mind and stirs the soul! An entertaining evening of fun, and ephemera in a friendly team trivia competition. title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you‚Äôll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist: ¬†Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\),¬†Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\)¬†. Inspired by their playful styles, students will¬†design and develop their very own characters‚Äîdeciding where these characters¬†live, work, play, eat, and sleep!¬†Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.¬† Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

¬†watercolor, paint, pens,¬†and¬†collage

¬†recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use¬†watercolor techniques¬†to add color and mood

How¬†scale¬†helps characters and environments feel real

The¬†arc of a story‚Äîbeginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using¬†background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
**We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†**No experience is necessary**¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

title: Bachata with ALEX
description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

About Efren

A health-fitness educator and mentor with over 15 years of experience leading group exercise classes, including aerobics, stretching, strength¬†training, Zumba, and dance workouts. AFAA, NASM, and trained as a Myofascial Release and¬†Precision¬†NMT‚ÄîTMJ Myofascial Practitioner.

description:

Wednesday, March 11 ‚Äì April 22, 2026 11:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

Intermediate

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$225** ‚Äì Registration CostAdvance your drawing skills with deep study of composition, value, and technique. Strengthen your creative process through focused practice.

About the Class

In this class, we will explore composition, value, and other aspects of drawing but on a deeper level. Beginning drawing classes have a lot of ground to cover so the concepts are skimmed over in order to give you exposure to as many as possible. Next-level drawing takes the time to do a deeper dive into some of the principles of drawing. When drawing we use limited tools which allow us to isolate both our strengths and weaknesses. Using this opportunity to really investigate our own process will serve to strengthen all aspects of our creative work. Drawing can be a challenge but when you see how it enhances the creative process, you will know it is worth it. This class is suitable for students who have a basic understanding of drawing and want to work on their skills. Please bring the following materials to class: 20‚Ä≥ x 26‚Ä≥ drawing board with clips, 18 ‚Äúx 24‚Äù Strathmore drawing pad (other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal (Char-kole brand black), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black (one fine-tip and one medium-tip).Membership has its benefits

title: Stitch Together
description:
Join us for Stitch Caf√©, a cozy open studio held twice a month. Whether you're working on your own project or eager to explore new mending techniques like darning and appliqu√©, this is the perfect space to gather, share ideas, and sew together. We provide hand-sewing supplies and materials, but feel free to bring your own - it's all about community, creativity, and enjoying the process. By repairing what we already have and re-using materials, we're not just preserving memories and adding unique touches to our belongings - we‚Äôre also reducing waste and contributing to a more sustainable lifestyle. We can extend the life of our clothes and fabrics, and take small but meaningful steps toward caring for the planet.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Lawyers in the Library
description:
Local volunteer attorneys offer free legal information and referral for general law matters. These lawyer consultations will last up to 20 minutes. Sign-ups are first come, first served in person and begin at 4:30 pm. \(30 minutes before the program begins\) --- The attorneys are volunteers and provide only legal information. They do not provide specific legal advice and should not be considered as personal lawyers for any reason. You will be required to sign a waiver before speaking to an attorney that states that no attorney-client relationship is being created with this free service. No language translation services or interpreters are offered or provided by library staff. Participants must bring their own interpreter if one is needed. Participants may also bring support persons, family members or other affiliated persons to meet with the attorney together. For deaf and hard of hearing participants, the Sonoma County Bar Association will make arrangements for ASL interpretation with at least two days' advance notice. Please contact Reception@SonomaCountyBar.org or \(707\) 542-1190 ext.100 for assistance. The program is a partnership between the Sonoma County Library, the Sonoma County Law Library, and the Sonoma County Bar Association and is staffed by volunteer attorneys. Learn more about the Lawyers in the Library program here.

title: Petaluma River Full Moon Paddle
description:
Come play on the river at night.

Join The Floathouse for a magical evening paddle on the Petaluma River‚ÄîPetaluma‚Äôs Longest Park‚Äîtimed to catch the full moon rising over the wetlands just south of downtown. As twilight fades, we‚Äôll head out together in Hobie pedal kayaks for a relaxed, guided glide that turns nighttime into playtime.

These pedal-powered kayaks make the journey smooth and easy, even if there‚Äôs a breeze or moving tide. We‚Äôll cruise about a mile and a half downriver to the perfect moonrise vantage point, where calm water, wide skies, and glowing reflections set the scene.

This is a social, feel-good outdoor experience designed for anyone looking for something a little different to do after dark‚Äîpart nature, part adventure, part pure vibe.

**$60 per person includes everything:** ‚Ä¢ Hobie pedal kayak ‚Ä¢ PFD and safety lights ‚Ä¢ Experienced local guide ‚Ä¢ A memorable, moonlit river experience

‚ú® Easy. Playful. Peaceful. Spend your evening under the full moon‚Äîon the water.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: Barbies & Bags Workshop
location:
Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. description:
Schedule

$25 ‚Äì One Bag or Doll Entry $40 ‚Äì Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 ‚Äì 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we‚Äôll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Revolutionize your routine and ignite your spirit with our¬†Morning Jazz Dance¬†class! This is more than just a dance class‚Äîit‚Äôs a vibrant, energetic start designed to flood your body with feel-good endorphins and set a positive, unstoppable tone for the hours ahead.

Enjoy a Fun, Energizing Warm-up:¬†Wake up your muscles and mind with a dynamic warm-up that gets your blood pumping and prepares your body for movement.

Build Foundation with Technique:¬†We‚Äôll introduce simple, accessible jazz technique and exercises focused on¬†strengthening your core¬†and¬†improving flexibility and coordination.

title: Painting Flora and Fauna in Watercolor
description:
Schedule

Fridays, March. 20- April 24, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

All Levels

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$275** ‚Äì Registration Cost **$25** ‚Äì Materials Fee **$300** ‚Äì Total Registration CostIn this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium.

About the Class

In this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. We will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational drawing skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step-by-step layering process that trains the artist to see value and color. Our subject matter will be flora and fauna ‚Äì a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬† Instructor Hannah Day is a passionate nature lover and watercolorist and will share her unique approach to rendering botanicals and animal portraits in watercolor. This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With six class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬† This class is open to artists of all skill levels. All materials are provided.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Frank Lloyd Wright Civic Center Tours
description:
Price: Adult $10, Senior/Full Time Student $5 \(Plus a $2 p er ticket service Charge Online\)

Ticket Info:

Sponsor: Marin Center

Link: http://www.marincounty.org/depts/cu

The Frank Lloyd Wright-designed Marin County Civic Center is a national- and state-designated historic landmark. Ninety minute docent-led tours of the Civic Center are offered every Wednesday and Friday at 10:30 am, leaving from the second floor Caf√©, Room 233. The cost is $10 adults and $5 seniors and students. No reservations are required. Groups of ten or more can arrange a private docent tour by calling the Visitor Services Office at \(415\) 473-3762.

title: Common Ground Book Club: books by & about people with disabilities
description:
Meet with others to discuss books centering disability voices! Copies of each month's books are available at the Sonoma County Library Catalog. Pre-Register to receive a reminder email. Drop-ins are welcome. If you didn't have time to read or finish the month's book, you are still welcome to attend. Snacks will be provided. Common Ground Society serves families who have loved ones with any sort of unique need while also educating our community on how to be inclusive. Held the 1st Friday of the month from 10:30-11:30am. We will not be meeting in January. 12/05/2025- December's title is Unfit Parent : A Disabled Mother Challenges An Inaccessible World by Jessica Slice 2/06/2025- Disability Intimacy: Essays on Love, Care, and Desire: Edited by Alice Wong 3/06/2025- The Kiss Quotient by Helen Hoang 04/03/2025- True Biz by Sara Noviƒá 05/01/2025- Second Life: Having a Child in the Digital Age by Amanda Hess
