Are you a salsa dancer who has the basics down but is ready to add more? Our Intermediate Salsa Class with Tyler is designed to help you transform your dancing moves. In this class, you‚Äôll go beyond the basics to learn intricate footwork, enhance your leading and following skills, and master the body movement that will make you shine on the dance floor. This class is for anyone ready to learn the techniques and intermediate steps needed to take their dancing to the next level.

You‚Äôll learn intermediate dancing techniques that will help you:

Express yourself with sharper footwork and styling.

Master complex turn patterns and combinations.

Strengthen your lead and follow for seamless, connected dancing.

Adapt to different partners and music with ease on the social dance floor.

What to Expect:¬†Instructor Tyler blends a fun, supportive atmosphere with structured lessons, so you‚Äôre always challenged but never overwhelmed. Helping you progress steadily while keeping the joy of salsa front and center.

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
**We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†**No experience is necessary**¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

Source: Press Democrat

title: John Doe
description:
John Doe was born in 1977 when he arrived in Los Angeles. His previous life in Tennessee, Wisconsin & Baltimore was a great & fertile time but new music and social changes led him to events that created a life in art. He graduated from Antioch College in Baltimore in 1975, worked as a roofer, aluminum siding mechanic, and ran a poetry reading series. Ms. Meyers was his landlord in the rural black community of Simpsonville , MD.

John met Exene Cervenka at the Venice poetry workshop Nov 1976 and he started working with Billy Zoom around the same time. When DJ Bonebrake joined X in mid-1977 the line up was complete. They released six studio records, five or six singles and one live record from 1978-1993. Five of X‚Äôs records have been re-issued along with two compilations. The Unheard Music documents their lives and progress as a band from 1980-83. In 2009 the film was included in the Sundance UCLA Archive of greatest films of all time. They appeared several times on American Bandstand, Solid Gold and David Letterman. As one of the last original punk rock bands standing, they continue to tour. The day that X played a free noontime concert in Fullerton, CA, they caused Orange County‚Äôs greatest high school truancy rate to date.

In 1988 John started a family and lived in the Tehachapi Mountains, near the ‚ÄúGrapevine‚Äù of Highway 5, which separates southern and central California. He has recorded 8 solo records w/ numerous renowned singers and players, more recently including Patty Griffin, Dan Auerbach, Aimee Mann, Don Was, Kathleen Edwards and Greg Liesz. He has appeared in over 50 films and television productions, with some of his most notable roles in Road House, Georgia, Roadside Prophets, Great Balls of Fire, Pure Country and Roswell. He continues to act these days but more sporadically as his touring schedule has become more demanding.

Other musical side projects include work with the Knitters, Jill Sobule and The Sadies. He continues to write poetry and has even taught workshops from time to time. He currently lives in Austin, TX.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Vallejo Piecemakers Quilt Guild Meeting
description:
Together, the Vallejo Piecemakers Quilt Guild \(VPQG\) brings the art of quilting to our members and the communities we touch. We meet on the first Saturdays of the month for a business meeting, workshops and open sew. Whether you‚Äôre working on an old project or beginning a new one, VPQG is a place to come together and create. We hope you will join us.

VPQG is a 501\(c\)7 social club supported by its membership. Everyone is welcome to attend one meeting per year as our guest, but we would request that you join the guild before attending additional meetings.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Natural Inks + Bookmaking in Inverness
description:
Spend a restorative day in Inverness exploring the art of natural inks and handmade books. We‚Äôll begin by painting botanical inks on fine papers‚Äîusing organic pigments and creative mark-making techniques‚Äîthen transform those pages into folded book forms tucked into beautiful handmade covers.

Each participant will take home a finished book and a packet of inks and papers, along with instructions to continue creating at home.

This intimate workshop will be held at Kate's¬†House in Inverness¬†and includes all materials. Please bring a lunch to share and enjoy a creative, communal afternoon by the coast.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

**DATE:** ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Begins October 1, 2025, Offered Daily

**TIME:** 11am-1pm and 2-4pm

**WHERE:** ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Markham Vineyards

Discover the pinnacle of Markham Cabernet Sauvignon. This privately guided tasting features rare library vintages, limited single-vineyard wines, and an exclusive barrel tasting of The Philanthropist, our flagship 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, expertly paired with local cheeses, charcuterie, and chocolates. Each booking is private and guided by a dedicated Ambassador. Guests will also step inside the Markham winery to sample a yet-to-be-released vintage of The Philanthropist Cabernet Sauvignon from a French Oak barrel.

title: For the Love of Comics 2026
description:
Teens are invited to create a comic all the way from idea to finished product! Completed comics will be published and sold in a book compendium called For the Love of Comics, vol. V. Taught by Gio Benedetti, a local professional illustrator and author of graphic novels. Class is free and includes professional level supplies. One class a week for eight weeks with the expectation that teens will work on their comic in between. Class dates: 2/7, 2/14, 2/28, 3/7, 3/14, 3/21, 3/28, and 4/4 Registration required!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Saturday Drawing Club
description:

Children must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. Please no ink or paints. The art gallery is open during the Drawing Club. Free, everyone is welcome!

City Arts Gallery open hours:

Thursdays 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.

Fridays 4 p.m. to 8 pm\* and until 9 pm on 2nd Friday Art Walk

Saturdays 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.

title: Saturday Live Music at Spicy Vines feat. Adam Lieb
description:
Where unforgettable wines, live music, and good vibes come together.

Join us every Saturday from 3‚Äì6 PM at Spicy Vines for a tasting room experience like no other ‚Äî where top local musicians from across the Bay Area meet our award-winning small-lot wines. From Rock & Roll and Blues to Jazz, Bluegrass, and Americana, each weekend brings new sounds and new reasons to raise a glass.¬†

Adam Lieb

Blending rock, blues, soul, and global folk influences, singer-songwriter and guitarist¬†Adam Lieb¬†delivers music infused with passion, craftsmanship, and deep cultural roots¬†

Details

No cover. Walk-ins are welcome, but this event tends to fill up quickly, so we recommend making a reservation. We are dog and family friendly!

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Live Music - The Ukulele Ramblers - Open Uke Jam!
description:
Join us for a chill evening of live music and good vibes with The Ukulele Ramblers at our happy hour event!

Welcome to **Live Music - The Ukulele Ramblers - Open Uke Jam!** Join us for a fun-filled evening of live music and ukulele jamming at Barrel Proof Lounge. Bring your ukulele and strum along with The Ukulele Ramblers, a talented group of musicians who will be performing a mix of classic tunes and original songs. Whether you're a seasoned ukulele player or a beginner looking to learn, this event is perfect for all music lovers. So mark your calendars for Sundays and get ready to enjoy a night of great music and good vibes. See you there! Open Uke jam hosted by your friendly neighborhood Ukulele collective.

Bring your singing voice and your Uke if you've got one, and enjoy the comfortable, welcoming space at Barrel Proof Lounge!

21+

Live Music 3-6 pm

Free Popcorn!

***www.UkuleleRamblers.net***

Check out¬†***www.BarrelProofLounge.com***¬†for all sorts of good times ahead!

title: Ben Allison
description:
Against the backdrop of over 25 years of creative collaboration, Ben Allison, Steve Cardenas, and Ted Nash weave musical conversations that are full of subtlety and surprise. They take turns arranging for the trio, which has released four albums. For this concert, they will be playing a selection of music from each of their recordings: Quiet Revolution: which features classics by Jimmy Giuffre and Jim Hall, Somewhere Else: which features our arrangements of songs from Leonard Bernstein‚Äôs West Side Story, Quiet Revolution: which features classics by Jimmy Giuffre and Jim Hall, Healing Power: which features music by the iconic composer/arranger Carla Bley and Tell the Birds I Said Hello: which features previously unrecorded gems by the genius pianist/composer Herbie Nichols. To date, their albums have been streamed millions of times, and they have performed at countless festivals throughout Europe, the US, and South America. The group is modeled after reedist/composer Jimmy Giuffre‚Äôs drummerless trios of the 1950s and 60s. As jazz was becoming more expressionistic and at times bombastic, musicians like Giuffre were going in the opposite direction. They were envisioning quieter music that maintained elements of blues and folk while also embracing the emerging qualities of free playing. Ben, Steve and Ted create music that is intimate and highly conversational in tone‚Äîa ‚Äòmusical trialogue,‚Äô where group interplay is the focus.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: ICON Concerts Presents Becky Robinson: The Beasts In Me Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


ICON Concerts Presents¬†
Becky¬†Robinson: The Beasts In Me Tour

Saturday, April 4, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Originally from Portland, Oregon, Becky Robinson is an LA-based comedian, writer, actor, and voice-over star who has gone from viral sensation to a sold-out theater act. 
You may also know her as the ‚ÄúEntitled Housewife,‚Äù the outspoken viral golf character Robinson created to co-star in two self-produced virtual comedy variety specials that helped spread laughter during the pandemic. Her unique character antics and viral videos have racked up millions of views across social media and garnered fans across the country (and the country clubs). In 2022, she released the original song ‚ÄúMama Needs a Claw.‚Äù 


VIP Add-On Option: 

Post Event Meet & Greet



 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Developing Your Drawing Eye
description:
Schedule

Mondays, March 9 ‚Äì April 20, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM Exceptions: No class March 23

Experience Level

Beginning

Drawing & Painting

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$270 ‚Äì Registration Cost $10 ‚Äì Materials Fee $280 ‚Äì Total Registration CostDeveloping Your Drawing Eye

Learn to draw without pressure or grades. Build foundational skills at your own pace through observational techniques. Perfect for beginners. Materials included.

What you‚Äôll do

It‚Äôs never too late to learn to draw ‚Äì especially when nobody‚Äôs grading you. Whether you are an abject beginner, haven‚Äôt picked up a pencil since high school, or you‚Äôre a creative who has always felt intimidated by observational drawing, this six-week class is offered with you in mind. We‚Äôll take the mystery ‚Äì and the pressure ‚Äì out of drawing from observation. You‚Äôll learn how to really see like an artist, practice simple techniques step by step, and build skills at your own pace. No talent required, and perfection is off the table. Studying observational drawing offers a foundational skill set that you will carry into every medium you might wish to explore. Discover the joy of drawing and build practical skills to expand your creative expression! All materials are provided.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 116

title: Sonoma Mountain Cemetery Tour April 6
description:
Who provided 6,000 gallons of his own wine reserves to squelch the big fire of 1911 on East 1st Street? Who was pals with Jack and Charmian London and received birthday cards from several past and present U.S. presidents on her 100th birthday? Who created a whole new industry \(not wine!\) that brought thousands of tourists and dollars to the Sonoma Valley?

¬†Learn about these and more personalities interned at the City of Sonoma Mountain Cemetery when the Sonoma Valley Historical Society \(SVHS\) inaugurates the Mountain Cemetery Tour on Sunday, April 6, 2025. Tour groups of 10-15 will be staggered from mid-morning to early afternoon. The groups will start the tour at the Mountain Cemetery water fountain \(look for signs upon arrival\). Parking available in the Overlook Trail and Veterans Memorial Building parking lots or on 1st Street West.

¬†The cemetery is situated on the western slope of Schocken Hill and will therefore require tour guests to be capable of walking on steep terrain, wearing suitable walking/hiking footwear, bringing drinking water, and a walking stick \(optional\). The tour will last approximately one hour and fifteen minutes.

¬†Cost: $20 plus fees. Space is limited; first come first served. There will be 3 groups at 10 minute intervals starting at 10:30 am To register for the tour

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sonoma-mountain-cemetery-tour-tickets-1289131730709?aff=oddtdtcreator¬†

Inquiries about the tour can be made at: info@sonomavalleyhistory.org.

SVHS is a 501\(c\)\(3\) non-profit corporation whose mission is collecting, preserving and sharing the story of our community as told by many voices throughout Sonoma Valley history.‚Ä¶ Please visit our website at: www.sonomavalleyhistory.org .

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sonoma Mountain Cemetery Tour April 6
description:
Discover the fascinating figures of Sonoma's past on the Mountain Cemetery Tour, hosted by the Sonoma Valley Historical Society. Hear stories of local legends, from a vintner who used 6,000 gallons of wine to fight the 1911 fire to a trailblazer who launched a thriving industry. Tours run mid-morning to early afternoon in small groups, beginning at the Mountain Cemetery water fountain. Expect steep terrain; proper footwear, water, and optional walking sticks are recommended. Parking is available at the Overlook Trail and Veterans Memorial Building lots or on 1st Street West. The tour lasts approximately 75 minutes and space is limited-reserve your spot early!

Source: Press Democrat

title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

Date & Time: Mondays @ 7PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

description:

Join us on a guided hike around Lake Lagunitas, where we will learn about the history of stewardship on the watershed and reflect on the natural spaces that we hold dearly. Along the way, we will come across a wide diversity of life that calls Lake Lagunitas home. This hike will be a dedicated time for folks to gather outside in community and take time to notice the detailed beauty of our natural world.

Source: Press Democrat

description:
Discover your family story at our Family Search Center You will find our center in the Lakeport building in the room next to the nursery. Local volunteers can help jumpstart your family history journey. Our center is staffed on Tuesdays from 1pm - 4pm, reach us in person or by phone \(707\) 280-9545 during those hours. All services provided in centers are free. You‚Äôll enjoy: Personalized help Center guests can receive personal help from volunteers in one of more than 5,400 centers worldwide. Access to technology Centers offer complimentary access to computers, internet, and subscription family history websites. Available resources vary by location. Access to exclusive records Visitors to FamilySearch Centers get special access to images of historical records that are only available in centers. Websites available at all locations: Ancestry, My Heritage, Family Search, Find My Past, American Ancestors, Geneanet https://www.family search.org Explore videos about family history and temples at collection/temple-and-family-history-messages-from-leaders?lang=eng

low impact

building muscles

movement

confidence

title: After School - Create Your Own Storybook World!
description:
Every Tuesday 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM

Please see website: Exact dates are available on Enrichment.kids. Click the registration links below.

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Kids

Age\(s\)

7-11

$100 ‚Äì Monthly Session Cost

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you‚Äôll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist: ¬†Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\),¬†Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\)¬†. Inspired by their playful styles, students will¬†design and develop their very own characters‚Äîdeciding where these characters¬†live, work, play, eat, and sleep!¬†Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.¬† Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

¬†watercolor, paint, pens,¬†and¬†collage

¬†recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use¬†watercolor techniques¬†to add color and mood

How¬†scale¬†helps characters and environments feel real

The¬†arc of a story‚Äîbeginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using¬†background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

All Silver Memberships and above receive 10% off the registration cost for any purchase over $40. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

Location

Room 116

description:

Experience Level

Age(s)

10-15

**$360** ‚Äì Registration CostPresented by the Sonoma Community Center in partnership with The Game Academy

Join Adventure Gaming classes with The Game Academy! Play D&D, build community, and grow empathy through weekly storytelling sessions.

About the class

class descriptionAdventure Gaming classes presented by The Game Academy are held weekly for¬†2-hour sessions over an 8-week term.¬†Participating players explore collaborative storytelling in a mentorship model using¬†games like Dungeons & Dragons to build community, foster¬†empathy, and support social-emotional growth. Our trained Educator-Gamemasters guide players in choosing the kinds of stories that interest them, then support unique and dynamic character creation, and finally¬†present an engaging narrative filled with puzzles and mysteries to be solved, social role-play to navigate, and¬†tactical challenges to be overcome‚Ä¶ all based on the players‚Äô interests.¬†This uniquely tailored experience¬†provides a rich context of personal investment, and engages our players with a fun and collaborative activity that helps them overcome social and emotional challenges, teaches them to engage with a growth mindset, supports the development of critical thinking and cooperative problem-solving skills, and helps them form lasting bonds with their peers. We hope your child will join us for a new adventure this coming Fall Term at the Sonoma Community Center.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

Meeting for a full 15 weeks, members make fantastic friendships, have fun engaging in activities and art projects, and learn social-emotional-physical tools that will help them throughout their lifetime.

title: The Valentine Tour
description:
You can‚Äôt water old flowers. Yes, you fall in love, you make mistakes, and so do they. You run through blackberry fields in the summer of your youth, dream in passenger seats gazing past towns and fields, imagining a future life where everything works out. I fell head over heels in love at nineteen. The kind of love where you call up your best friend and say, ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôve found my soulmate.‚Äù The pull towards that first true love is strong. It consumes you, makes you question your own dreams. 

We taught each other, grew up together, we were family. We fit just right, for a time. Then one day, after a long and rocky nine year road, life changed and became a complicated mess too hard to untangle. We couldn‚Äôt get our love back, no matter how many dreams that shadowed this hard truth. We grew resentful, selfish, harboring past mistakes and holding them up like armor from every blow. We grew up and our paths diverted. 

On New Year‚Äôs Day, 2018, a great horned owl dropped dead at my exes‚Äô feet in my mother‚Äôs yard. It felt like a daunting omen, ushering on change for the both of us. We were distraught. We couldn‚Äôt afford the taxidermy, so we placed it in a big blue plastic garbage bin. Now it felt so cheap, that mystic creature in a plastic coffin. That‚Äôs how love feels sometimes ‚Äì like we don‚Äôt serve it the ending it deserves. 

The omen was true. That year, I started to see the woman I could be, the woman I wasn‚Äôt yet. Anytime I felt like myself, I was alone and wandering, and I knew that was a sign that it was time for change. New Year‚Äôs Day 2019, I said goodbye to my first true love and moved across the country. Losing someone you spend every day for nearly a decade with is intense. We talked in our dreams. I knew where he was, even before I entered a place. He‚Äôd always be there if I had a feeling. Humans are connected in unexplainable ways. 

I was writing a lot after we broke up as a healing technique, preserving each memory like an emotional archaeologist. Late one night, I woke up from a dream where I was searching for him, my ex, at a carnival. It was so vivid. I woke myself up to write a song on my piano. The next morning, he reached out to me for the first time in months. We went out, had a drink, caught up, and he told me that the hardest part about our separation was a reoccurring nightmare where he searched for me at a carnival. In that moment, I knew, humans have ways of connecting beyond words and touch. I truly believe that. We had the same dream, without seeing each other for months. 

Even with all the mystic symbolism that year presented, this is an age-old story I can‚Äôt make up. We fall in love, we grow up, we change, and they don‚Äôt change with us. ‚ÄòOld Flowers‚Äô is about heartbreak. There are a million records and songs about that, but I did not lie when writing these songs. This album is about loving and caring for the person you know you can‚Äôt be with. It‚Äôs about being afraid to be vulnerable after you‚Äôve been hurt. It‚Äôs about a woman who is alone, but okay with that, if it means truth. 

This was my truth this year ‚Äì my nine year relationship ended, and I‚Äôm a woman alone in the world, but happy to know herself.  

These songs came to me alone, late nights in Bisbee, Lisbon, Nashville, and London. Sometimes I‚Äôd just cry and sing, and a song would come out. I drank too much wine while writing this record, lit too many candles. You could say this was my attempt to summon the muse, but that‚Äôs bullshit, because she was just standing there naked looking me in the eyes. So I told her the truth. 

This is my story of the most heartbreaking, but soul-revealing, year of my life. I drove myself mad. I drove to the smoky mountains just to drive back. I danced with a Portuguese boxer and cried on his shoulder in a Fado cafe. I did everything an artist is ‚Äúsupposed to do.‚Äù But at the end of the day, beyond all the romance, these songs are my truth. I think they might be yours too.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

Date & Time: Tuesdays @ 6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

title: Adult Gymnastics Class
description:
**We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†**No experience is necessary**¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

title: Cass McCombs
description:
Maybe a minute passed before I knew I‚Äôd be singing ‚ÄúKaraoke‚Äù for the rest of my life. The second song on Heartmind, the tenth album by Cass McCombs, ‚ÄúKaraoke‚Äù is a god-level burst of power-pop perfection, as fetching as anything Cass has ever cut. The springy staccato guitar, the vaporized electric keys, the melody seemingly born for singing or clapping or dancing along: Cass triangulates a perch of his very own out among The Go-Betweens, The dB‚Äôs, and The Cure, and vibrates there, a beacon. And then, of course, there is the song‚Äôs playful if painful lyrical conceit‚Äîthe lover who is making all the sacred motions of commitment but whose feelings may be no more deep or real than someone simply reading the lyrics for ‚ÄúVision of Love‚Äù or ‚ÄúStand by Your Man‚Äù from some crowded bar‚Äôs TV screen.  

 

So after harmonizing alone with ‚ÄúKaraoke‚Äù for the twentieth time during a solo cross-country drive, I had to ask Cass for myself how it all went down: Was this heartbreak, or was it legit love? He paused, thought, then laughed. ‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs the question,‚Äù he said slowly. ‚ÄúNeither?‚Äù Or maybe, he finally averred, both? That is‚Äîto me, anyway‚Äîthe true joy of Heartmind, an eight-song album that feels more like a journey among assorted tuneful feelings, somehow shaped to meet whatever it is a particular listener needs, to mirror whatever they bring to these uniformly incandescent and tragicomic tracks. Cass has set the stage, but you get to pick the heroes and villains, the winners and losers, the jokes and the drags. He doesn‚Äôt want to give you the questions, let alone the answers.  

 

To wit: Did the soldier at the center of the aching country epic ‚ÄúUnproud Warrior‚Äù abdicate responsibility or finally claim it? As the percussion shuffles and horns sigh beneath ‚ÄúKrakatau,‚Äù will you agree that you can be cleansed without being killed‚Äîor be anything better than you already are while still remaining yourself? Do you identify with being enraptured by music for so long that it ultimately drained you, too, as Cass suggests \(maybe?\) during the wiry opener, ‚ÄúMusic Is Blue‚Äù? These are just a few of the questions that come to mind when I hear Heartmind, but I don‚Äôt even know if they‚Äôre the right questions. Still, I can now sing along to every word. 

 

There are, at least, some basic facts to share about Heartmind, logistical evidence that may in turn shape your own questions: Cass recorded these songs in multiple sessions on both coasts, in Brooklyn and Burbank. The great Shahzad Ismaily not only cut the staggering ‚ÄúUnproud Warrior‚Äù and four others here but also played lots of bass. Buddy Ross tracked ‚ÄúNew Earth,‚Äù a paean of post-humanity renewal with several sharp wisecracks. Ariel Rechtshaid‚Äînow a dozen years into his collaboration with Cass, which began with 2009‚Äôs Catacombs‚Äîcaptured Cass‚Äô scintillating guitars on ‚ÄúBelong to Heaven,‚Äù a thoughtful consideration of what we all lose when we lose an old friend to the inevitable end. The steadfast Rob Schnapf \(who previously produced McCombs‚Äô ANTI- debut, Mangy Love\) mixed and merged it all.  

 

Wynonna Judd \(yes, that one\) offers harmonies, while her beau Cactus Moser provides some lap steel. Joe Russo, Kassa Overall, Danielle Haim, Nestor Gomez: I don‚Äôt actually need to tell you how good everyone who pitches in here is, because you‚Äôll be able to hear it for yourself the moment you listen. 

 

Speaking of hearing it for yourself, here‚Äôs how I hear at least some of these songs: ‚ÄúUnproud Warrior,‚Äù featuring the aforementioned Wynonna, is a necessary anthem for these times, where we all seem to have opinions about the critical news of the day without ever quite knowing what to do about it. Invoking Stephen Crane, S.E. Hinton, and fast-food restaurants, it is an allegory about our perception and ownership of responsibility, set to an elegant C&W ache. ‚ÄúNew Earth‚Äù celebrates the renewal that‚Äôs possible when humanity‚Äôs finally done with its bullshit, when all our temporary madness self-destructs long enough to let nature reset itself. Sorry, but you‚Äôll be humming along to predictions of your own destruction here. And using much of the same band of rootsy weirdos as ‚ÄúUnproud Warrior,‚Äù ‚ÄúBlue Blue Band‚Äù unfurls as a sequel to Gillian Welch‚Äôs Ruination Day suite, where the offering up of oneself for entertainment always entails at least a sliver of self-destruction. Also, Cass sings that the bassist, Fritz, ‚Äúcooks it hotter than grits,‚Äù which is about all any Southerner needs to hear in order to love any song. 

 

At the risk of being didactic, I need to reiterate something here: Aside from the credits, I might be wrong about everything I‚Äôve said about these songs. Again, sorry. Where I hear dark humor, you might hear relentless pain; where I hear winning cynicism, you might hear harrowing nihilism. And that is, in some way, the point for Cass‚Äîto write songs that speak of his moment, and then let everyone else decide how or even if they speak to their moment. These are honest offerings for absurdist times, funny confessions of frailty amid circumstances that often seem too tense for even the humble chuckle. On Heartmind, Cass McCombs enters the double-digit-album phase of his career, a quantitatively rarified place for any songwriter; rarer still, though, is the fact that he does not yet seem to have settled into a qualitative sound or pattern, of singing the same thought twice \(or perhaps even once\).  

 

One more thing I can say for certain, then? For Cass, this has never been karaoke. ‚ÄîGrayson Haver Currin

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
This program is presented in Spanish. Spanish Music & Movement is a tour of culture, language, and fun! This presentation is not for sitting - your family will be active characters in these adventures, participating with colorful scarves, instruments, and animals as you move to the sound of language. Even if you are not fluent Spanish speakers, see the language come alive through the animated and energetic activities designed for children under 6 years and family.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Family Law Consultations at Sonoma County Public Law Library
description:
Local volunteer attorneys offer free legal information and referral for matters of family law only. These lawyer consultations will last up to 20 minutes. Sign-ups are first come, first served in person and begin at 10 am. \(30 minutes before the program begins\) The attorneys are volunteers and provide only legal information. They do not provide specific legal advice and should not be considered as personal lawyers for any reason. You will be required to sign a waiver before speaking to an attorney that states that no attorney-client relationship is being created with this free service. No language translation services or interpreters are offered or provided by library staff. Participants must bring their own interpreter if one is needed. Participants may also bring support persons, family members or other affiliated persons to meet with the attorney together. For deaf and hard of hearing participants, the Sonoma County Bar Association will make arrangements for ASL interpretation with at least two days' advance notice. Please contact Reception@SonomaCountyBar.org or \(707\) 542-1190 ext.100 for assistance. The program is a partnership between the Sonoma County Library, the Sonoma County Law Library, and the Sonoma County Bar Association and is staffed by volunteer attorneys. Learn more here.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:
Schedule

Wednesday, March 11 ‚Äì April 22, 2026 11:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

Intermediate

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$225** ‚Äì Registration CostAdvance your drawing skills with deep study of composition, value, and technique. Strengthen your creative process through focused practice.

About the Class

In this class, we will explore composition, value, and other aspects of drawing but on a deeper level. Beginning drawing classes have a lot of ground to cover so the concepts are skimmed over in order to give you exposure to as many as possible. Next-level drawing takes the time to do a deeper dive into some of the principles of drawing. When drawing we use limited tools which allow us to isolate both our strengths and weaknesses. Using this opportunity to really investigate our own process will serve to strengthen all aspects of our creative work. Drawing can be a challenge but when you see how it enhances the creative process, you will know it is worth it. This class is suitable for students who have a basic understanding of drawing and want to work on their skills. Please bring the following materials to class: 20‚Ä≥ x 26‚Ä≥ drawing board with clips, 18 ‚Äúx 24‚Äù Strathmore drawing pad (other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal (Char-kole brand black), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black (one fine-tip and one medium-tip).Membership has its benefits

All **Silver Memberships** and above receive **10% off the registration cost for any class purchase over $40**. Materials fees are not discounted.

Become a member today and find community, connection, and creativity.

title: Sofia Talvik LIVE at  St. Helena Public Library
description:
If you like the sound of Laura Marling, Lucinda Williams, Gillian Welch, Emmylou Harris... then this is a concert for your taste.

Sofia Talvik is a rare artist and an avid storyteller with a voice comparable to giants like Joni Mitchell, or as the Folk/Americana Magazine NoDepression said it ‚ÄùA singer/songwriter who is able to evoke the essence of Laurel Canyon circa the ‚Äò60s as expressed in the work of Joni Mitchell, Judy Collins, Buffy Sainte-Marie and others who were able to paint beautiful tapestries from words and music.‚Äù.

Not unlike the 70's coffeehouses and speakeasy's, you will be up close and personal with a world class act that has played big festivals like Lollapalooza and SxSW and opened for artists like Maria McKee and David Duchovny \(X-files, Californication\). It is in this kind of setting where she can casually joke and communicate with the audience that her strength as a performer shines the most.

Her delicate songs are performed in an intimate way, showing off Sofia‚Äôs angelic voice enhanced only by a tasteful mix of harmonies and delays, accompanied by the steady picking of her acoustic guitar and the rhythm section consisting of her own two feet, bells and a stomp box.

She's an experienced international touring artist who has toured through 48 U.S states, many of the countries in Europe and far away places like New Zealand.

Her latest album "Center of the Universe" was released in 2023. Throughout the 10 songs on the album, there is a broad range of topics of some of life‚Äôs most earnest moments, ranging from the Ukraine War, American women‚Äôs rights, the thousands of missing children in the US and the torment of domestic violence survivors across the world. The album went straight into the top 20 on Folk Radio Charts USA in August 2023, with the first single charting in the top 10. The album was considered for a Grammy nomination for "Best Folk album" 2023.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Library Commission Regular Meeting
description:
The Rohnert Park - Cotati Library hosts library commission meetings in the Armando Flores Room. The Sonoma County Library Commission is an 11-person body responsible for governing the library. Commissioners are appointed by the cities in Sonoma County and the county Board of Supervisors. The commission establishes policy; sets goals and objectives; hires and evaluates the director; establishes and monitors the annual budget; and exercises such other powers, consistent with the law to foster the effective use and management of the library. The commission generally meets monthly, with additional special meetings as needed. Meetings are open to the public and recordings are accessible online through

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Rainbow Book Club: All Systems Red: Murderbot Diaries by Martha Wells
description:
The Rainbow Book Club is cohosted by Mindy from Napa County Library and Napa Bookmine staff members Kass and Jules. The book club focuses on books that explore and embrace queer identity. This is a free event but we appreciate your RSVP so we can plan for your attendance! We look forward to welcoming you. ABOUT THE BOOK Winner of the Hugo, Nebula, and Locus Award for Best Novella Winner of the Alex Award A New York Times and USA Today Bestseller Now an Apple Original series from Academy Award nominees Paul Weitz and Chris Weitz and starring Emmy Award winner Alexander Skarsg√•rd. A murderous android discovers itself in All Systems Red, a tense science fiction adventure by Martha Wells that interrogates the roots of consciousness through Artificial Intelligence. ‚ÄúAs a heartless killing machine, I was a complete failure.‚Äù In a corporate-dominated spacefaring future, planetary missions must be approved and supplied by the Company. Exploratory teams are accompanied by Company-supplied security androids, for their own safety. But in a society where contracts are awarded to the lowest bidder, safety isn‚Äôt a primary concern. On a distant planet, a team of scientists are conducting surface tests, shadowed by their Company-supplied ‚Äòdroid‚Äîa self-aware SecUnit that has hacked its own governor module, and refers to itself \(though never out loud\) as ‚ÄúMurderbot.‚Äù Scornful of humans, all it really wants is to be left alone long enough to figure out who it is. But when a neighboring mission goes dark, it's up to the scientists and their Murderbot to get to the truth. ABOUT THE AUTHOR MARTHA WELLS has written many novels, including the New York Times and USA Today-bestselling Murderbot Diaries series, which has won multiple Hugo, Nebula, Locus, and Alex Awards, and was adapted into an Apple Original TV series. Other titles include Witch King, City of Bones, The Wizard Hunters, Wheel of the Infinite, the Books of the Raksura series \(beginning with The Cloud Roads and ending with The Harbors of the Sun\), and the Nebula-nominated The Death of the Necromancer, as well as YA fantasy novels, short stories, and nonfiction.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival
description:
Revolutionizing the Film Festival Experience

The Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival is the San Francisco Bay Area's premier documentary film festival, offering four days of curated films, award presentations, cinephile panels and forums, upscale gatherings, VIP receptions, and casual meet-and-greets-all in the heart of Sonoma County.

From its roots as a local fest showing about 40 films in 2007, SDFF now receives more than 700 submissions from 62\+ countries per year. In 2025, 57 films were programmed and shown and the event was attended by filmmakers, as well as a robust audience of film lovers. In addition to its commitment to honoring diversity in all its forms by providing open calls for entry, SDFF is an Oscar¬Æ-qualifying film festival for short and mini form documentaries.

SDFF is proudly progressive in its curation of topics and forms. Now more than ever, festival organizers seek to amplify urgent messages, uplift stories from marginalized communities, and support earnest efforts to provoke political change, effect social justice, and encourage personal growth

For more information about how you can submit your film, volunteer to help with the fest, donate money, or promote our vital work, please visit https://www.sebastopolfilm.org/.

About SDFF \(Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival\):

Founded in 2007, the first ever Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival \(SDFF\) boldly curated 44 films that brought into focus a wealth of talented filmmakers from Sonoma County and the greater San Francisco Bay Area.

Sixteen years later, nearly 700 titles from 62 countries were openly submitted for SDFF 2023. Sixty-three films were programmed, the event was attended by 93 filmmakers and an impressive audience, through in-person and streaming delivery.

SDFF honors diversity in all forms. We continue to provide equal opportunity for filmmakers through open calls for entry; explore what it's like for any life to wake to its existence.

SDFF is an Oscar¬Æ qualifying Film Festival for documentaries in the short form. Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival is proudly progressive, often featuring spotlights on social justice, journalism, current issues. When the right films come through we've programmed different POV's of the same story. Given the proliferation of AI, documentaries might become our only touchstone for what was 'real' at a moment in time. What better platform than a non-fiction film festival to encourage fresh and critical thinking?

Date and Time: Thursday, 09 April 2026 at 09:00 - Sunday, 12 April 2026 at 17:00

title: Lawyers in the Library: Employment & Civil Law
description:
Local volunteer attorneys offer free legal information and referral for matters of civil and employment law only. These lawyer consultations will last up to 20 minutes. Sign-ups are first come, first served in person and begin at 11:30 am. \(30 minutes before the program begins\) The attorneys are volunteers and provide only legal information. They do not provide specific legal advice and should not be considered as personal lawyers for any reason. You will be required to sign a waiver before speaking to an attorney that states that no attorney-client relationship is being created with this free service. No language translation services or interpreters are offered or provided by library staff. Participants must bring their own interpreter if one is needed. Participants may also bring support persons, family members or other affiliated persons to meet with the attorney together. For deaf and hard of hearing participants, the Sonoma County Bar Association will make arrangements for ASL interpretation with at least two days' advance notice. Please contact Reception@SonomaCountyBar.org or \(707\) 542-1190 ext.100 for assistance. The program is a partnership between the Sonoma County Library, the Sonoma County Law Library, and the Sonoma County Bar Association and is staffed by volunteer attorneys. Learn more about the Lawyers in the Library program here.

$25 ‚Äì One Bag or Doll Entry $40 ‚Äì Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 ‚Äì 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we‚Äôll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Date & Time: Thursdays @6:30PM ‚Äì 7:30PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival
description:
Revolutionizing the Film Festival Experience

The Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival is the San Francisco Bay Area's premier documentary film festival, offering four days of curated films, award presentations, cinephile panels and forums, upscale gatherings, VIP receptions, and casual meet-and-greets-all in the heart of Sonoma County.

From its roots as a local fest showing about 40 films in 2007, SDFF now receives more than 700 submissions from 62\+ countries per year. In 2025, 57 films were programmed and shown and the event was attended by filmmakers, as well as a robust audience of film lovers. In addition to its commitment to honoring diversity in all its forms by providing open calls for entry, SDFF is an Oscar¬Æ-qualifying film festival for short and mini form documentaries.

SDFF is proudly progressive in its curation of topics and forms. Now more than ever, festival organizers seek to amplify urgent messages, uplift stories from marginalized communities, and support earnest efforts to provoke political change, effect social justice, and encourage personal growth

For more information about how you can submit your film, volunteer to help with the fest, donate money, or promote our vital work, please visit https://www.sebastopolfilm.org/.

About SDFF \(Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival\):

Founded in 2007, the first ever Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival \(SDFF\) boldly curated 44 films that brought into focus a wealth of talented filmmakers from Sonoma County and the greater San Francisco Bay Area.

Sixteen years later, nearly 700 titles from 62 countries were openly submitted for SDFF 2023. Sixty-three films were programmed, the event was attended by 93 filmmakers and an impressive audience, through in-person and streaming delivery.

SDFF honors diversity in all forms. We continue to provide equal opportunity for filmmakers through open calls for entry; explore what it's like for any life to wake to its existence.

SDFF is an Oscar¬Æ qualifying Film Festival for documentaries in the short form. Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival is proudly progressive, often featuring spotlights on social justice, journalism, current issues. When the right films come through we've programmed different POV's of the same story. Given the proliferation of AI, documentaries might become our only touchstone for what was 'real' at a moment in time. What better platform than a non-fiction film festival to encourage fresh and critical thinking?

Date and Time: Thursday, 09 April 2026 at 09:00 - Sunday, 12 April 2026 at 17:00

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Painting Flora and Fauna in Watercolor
description:
Schedule

Fridays, March. 20- April 24, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

All Levels

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$275** ‚Äì Registration Cost **$25** ‚Äì Materials Fee **$300** ‚Äì Total Registration CostIn this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium.

About the Class

In this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. We will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational drawing skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step-by-step layering process that trains the artist to see value and color. Our subject matter will be flora and fauna ‚Äì a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬† Instructor Hannah Day is a passionate nature lover and watercolorist and will share her unique approach to rendering botanicals and animal portraits in watercolor. This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With six class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬† This class is open to artists of all skill levels. All materials are provided.

title: Threads That Tie Us
description:
Explore the blurred lines between everyday objects and artistic expression with a focus on fiber and textile art. In this rebellion against the distinction between Craft and Art, we invite you to experience the surprising and delightful diversity of these works while marveling at the skill, intuition, knowledge and wisdom behind their making. The fiber artists include Britt-Marie Alm, Stephanie Brown, Risa Iwasaki Culbertson, Amanda Farrell, Jennifer Laursen, Youngmi Angela Pak, Leigh Ann Parente and Vida Vazquez who each create, in unique ways, something new from raw or recycled materials, intuitively and humanely imbuing them with beauty and authenticity.

description:
**We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18+ crowd!**

**Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.**

**$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!**

**Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!**

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†**No experience is necessary**¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

title: Indie After Dark
description:
Indie After Dark ‚Äì Vallejo‚Äôs Night for Original Music

September 12 performers:

üî• Agness Twin

San Francisco‚Äôs hypnotic post-punk / indie project led by Elisa Ovrahim. Gorgeous layered vocals, ringing guitars, cinematic folk shadows, and minimalist ethereal pop. Their new album Turn To Gold \(2024\) was mastered by John Golden \(Soundgarden, Melvins\) and has already carved its place on indie radio. Fresh from the Love & Rockets tour, Agness Twin‚Äôs live set will swallow you whole.

üî• Pro-Pain!

Bay Area 4-piece that‚Äôs ‚ÄúHAVING A BLAST.‚Äù High-voltage energy, pure grit, and a sound built to light up the room. With their recent Bombs Away video, they‚Äôre proof that Vallejo‚Äôs underground scene is very much alive and screaming.

Every Second Friday, Indie After Dark brings the spotlight to independent music at the intimate and vibey 4th Corner Speakeasy in downtown Vallejo. Just steps from the heart of the Vallejo Art Walk, this monthly series invites you to discover bold new sounds in a setting made for connection‚Äîwhere the lights are low, the cocktails are strong, and the music runs deep.

Come early for the art, stay late for the music. It‚Äôs a night where Vallejo‚Äôs creative soul shines.

title: Emmet Cohen Quintet
description:
Creator of Live from Emmet‚Äôs Place, the most-viewed online jazz show in the world, and winner of the American Jazz Pianist Competition, Emmet Cohen has gained a reputation for connecting with audiences through his artistry and commitment to intergenerational exchange. With the Emmet Cohen Trio plus special guests Tivon Pennicott and Jeremy Pelt, he celebrates the centennial of perhaps the two greatest names in jazz history: Miles Davis and John Coltrane. Featuring Jeremy Pelt on trumpet‚Äînamed a Rising Star by Downbeat Magazine‚Äîand Tivon Pennicott on tenor sax‚Äîwhose ‚Äúearthbound yet galactic‚Äù style earned him the label ‚Äúsonic healer‚Äù \(All About Jazz\), the ensemble gives their slant on the legacy of the two jazz greats in a concert sure to be warmly familiar and also something entirely new.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Emmet Cohen presents: Miles and Coltrane at 100
description:
In celebration of the centennial of John Coltrane and Miles Davis, pianist Emmet Cohen brings together an all-star quintet to explore the fundamental questions that shaped their artistry: Why are we here? What are we reaching for? Where does the music take us?

A dynamic ensemble led by pianist Emmet Cohen, featuring saxophonist Tivon Pennicott and trumpeter Jeremy Pelt will celebrate these geniuses in Miles and Coltrane at 100.

Guided by the spirit of the infinite, Cohen continues the journey set forth by the architects of jazz ‚Äî seeking deeper truths through sound.

A dedicated champion of the musical community, Cohen believes in jazz as a living, evolving conversation ‚Äî one that unites people across time and place.

Join Cohen and his ensemble for a bold, reimagined experience of the music that forever changed the course of jazz.

Supported in part by Oliver's Markets and Balletto Vineyards

Source: North Bay Bohemian

***‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a feel good riot from start to finish.‚Äú* ‚Äî Jay Darcy, Mancunion Media Group** 

**Get ready for a wild, laugh-out-loud adventure with *HEAD OVER HEELS*‚Äîthe electrifying musical comedy from the creative forces behind Hedwig and the Angry Inch, Avenue Q, and Spring Awakening! Nominated for *Outstanding New Broadway Musical* in 2019 and powered by the chart-topping hits of the legendary all-female rock band The Go-Go‚Äôs, this high-energy show features beloved anthems like ‚ÄúWe Got the Beat,‚Äù ‚ÄúOur Lips Are Sealed,‚Äù ‚ÄúVacation,‚Äù ‚ÄúHeaven is a Place on Earth,‚Äù and ‚ÄúMad About You.‚Äù**

title: Medic First Aid CPR and AED Training
description:
Course Description: This course goes a step beyond basic CPR. In this four-hour class, students will learn information and skills to provide effective emergency care to an injured or ill person before first responders arrive. The workplace is the focus, using industrial and office settings for the scenario-based learning environment. CPR, plus other lifesaving skills including bleeding control, choke saving, hazardous conditions awareness, and an introduction to the AED. Each students receives a manual, instruction, mannequin use and Medic First Aid card valid for two years. Course Audience: The class-of-choice for non-medical people, this class is the perfect course for any individual who would like to be prepared to respond to a cardiac emergency, anytime and anywhere. Great for on-site training for employees who have a duty to respond to a cardiac emergency due to job responsibilities or regulatory requirements.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Bachata Beginners Saturday
description:
This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That‚Äôs why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps:¬†You‚Äôll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work:¬†Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns:¬†We‚Äôll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We‚Äôve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required:¬†Whether you‚Äôve never danced before or it‚Äôs been a while, you‚Äôre welcome here!

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles:¬†This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival
description:
Revolutionizing the Film Festival Experience

The Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival is the San Francisco Bay Area's premier documentary film festival, offering four days of curated films, award presentations, cinephile panels and forums, upscale gatherings, VIP receptions, and casual meet-and-greets-all in the heart of Sonoma County.

From its roots as a local fest showing about 40 films in 2007, SDFF now receives more than 700 submissions from 62\+ countries per year. In 2025, 57 films were programmed and shown and the event was attended by filmmakers, as well as a robust audience of film lovers. In addition to its commitment to honoring diversity in all its forms by providing open calls for entry, SDFF is an Oscar¬Æ-qualifying film festival for short and mini form documentaries.

SDFF is proudly progressive in its curation of topics and forms. Now more than ever, festival organizers seek to amplify urgent messages, uplift stories from marginalized communities, and support earnest efforts to provoke political change, effect social justice, and encourage personal growth

For more information about how you can submit your film, volunteer to help with the fest, donate money, or promote our vital work, please visit https://www.sebastopolfilm.org/.

About SDFF \(Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival\):

Founded in 2007, the first ever Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival \(SDFF\) boldly curated 44 films that brought into focus a wealth of talented filmmakers from Sonoma County and the greater San Francisco Bay Area.

Sixteen years later, nearly 700 titles from 62 countries were openly submitted for SDFF 2023. Sixty-three films were programmed, the event was attended by 93 filmmakers and an impressive audience, through in-person and streaming delivery.

SDFF honors diversity in all forms. We continue to provide equal opportunity for filmmakers through open calls for entry; explore what it's like for any life to wake to its existence.

SDFF is an Oscar¬Æ qualifying Film Festival for documentaries in the short form. Sebastopol Documentary Film Festival is proudly progressive, often featuring spotlights on social justice, journalism, current issues. When the right films come through we've programmed different POV's of the same story. Given the proliferation of AI, documentaries might become our only touchstone for what was 'real' at a moment in time. What better platform than a non-fiction film festival to encourage fresh and critical thinking?

Date and Time: Thursday, 09 April 2026 at 09:00 - Sunday, 12 April 2026 at 17:00
