title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

description:

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

Intermediate

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$225** ‚Äì Registration CostAdvance your drawing skills with deep study of composition, value, and technique. Strengthen your creative process through focused practice.

About the Class

In this class, we will explore composition, value, and other aspects of drawing but on a deeper level. Beginning drawing classes have a lot of ground to cover so the concepts are skimmed over in order to give you exposure to as many as possible. Next-level drawing takes the time to do a deeper dive into some of the principles of drawing. When drawing we use limited tools which allow us to isolate both our strengths and weaknesses. Using this opportunity to really investigate our own process will serve to strengthen all aspects of our creative work. Drawing can be a challenge but when you see how it enhances the creative process, you will know it is worth it. This class is suitable for students who have a basic understanding of drawing and want to work on their skills. Please bring the following materials to class: 20‚Ä≥ x 26‚Ä≥ drawing board with clips, 18 ‚Äúx 24‚Äù Strathmore drawing pad (other brands are fine as long as the paper is drawing quality), soft willow charcoal, compressed charcoal (Char-kole brand black), white plastic eraser, notebook, Staedtler drawing pencils 2B and 6B, Pigma micron pens black (one fine-tip and one medium-tip).Membership has its benefits

The Rohnert Park Cotati Library will be hosting the Library Commission Budget Workshop. The Sonoma County Library Commission is an 11-person body responsible for governing the library. The commission establishes policy; sets goals and objectives; hires and evaluates the director; establishes and monitors the annual budget; and exercises such other powers, consistent with the law to foster the effective use and management of the library. We are now enrolling for our School Year Wellness Workshops for girls in 3rd-8th grades.

Meeting for a full 15 weeks, members make fantastic friendships, have fun engaging in activities and art projects, and learn social-emotional-physical tools that will help them throughout their lifetime.

We‚Äôve got 3 amazing facilitators and workshops are hosted at McKinley School in Petaluma-though members come from a variety of schools and towns to attend opening up even further opportunities for making even more friends!

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Barbies & Bags Workshop
location:
Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
Schedule

Sunday, February 15, 2026 1:00 PM ‚Äì 4:00 PM

Location

Room 201, Fiber Arts Studio

Experience Level

All Levels

Kids, Programming, Sustainability

Age\(s\)

All Ages are welcome to attend Children under 16 must be accompanied by an adult

$25 ‚Äì One Bag or Doll Entry $40 ‚Äì Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 ‚Äì 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we‚Äôll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

Address:¬†4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Painting Flora and Fauna in Watercolor
description:
Schedule

Fridays, March. 20- April 24, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Location

Room 208

Experience Level

All Levels

Drawing & Painting

Age(s)

18 and older

**$275** ‚Äì Registration Cost **$25** ‚Äì Materials Fee **$300** ‚Äì Total Registration CostIn this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium.

About the Class

In this six-week course, participants will learn a unique approach to watercolor, intended to alleviate the frustration that many experience when learning this beautiful yet challenging medium. We will focus on strengthening one‚Äôs observational drawing skills, giving the artist a foundation off of which to build their paintings in a step-by-step layering process that trains the artist to see value and color. Our subject matter will be flora and fauna ‚Äì a sampling of plants and animals. These subjects are great for beginners and experienced artists alike; their organic shapes make them forgiving drawing subjects, but their beauty can be a muse for life.¬† Instructor Hannah Day is a passionate nature lover and watercolorist and will share her unique approach to rendering botanicals and animal portraits in watercolor. This class will work both from photographs and from life, practicing observational drawing in addition to watercolor technique. With six class sessions, participants will have the opportunity to develop their skills and build muscle memory with a medium that often feels like it has a mind of its own.¬† This class is open to artists of all skill levels. All materials are provided.

title: Sip & Solve Trivia Night at St. Francis Winery
description:
Sip & Solve Trivia Night at St. Francis Winery invites guests to put their knowledge to the test-and their wine glasses to good use-in the heart of Sonoma Valley. Set at St. Francis Winery, this lively and social evening unfolds against glowing vineyard views at sunset, creating a relaxed Wine Country atmosphere perfect for gathering with friends or meeting new ones. Trivia rounds feature a fun mix of wine-themed questions and unexpected topics, keeping the competition lighthearted and engaging. Guests may enjoy St. Francis wines available by the glass, along with a complimentary grazing table of seasonal bites. With prizes, plenty of laughs, and a welcoming vibe, Sip & Solve offers a playful way to experience the winery. Offered seasonally throughout the year, reservations are strongly recommended.

title: Twilight Welcome Party | Passport to Dry Creek Valley
description:
Join us on April 24, 2026 as we kick off the best weekend of 2026 in Wine Country! Chef Kevin O'Connor of Hulu&'s Chefs vs. Wild, and his team, will be back for the 2nd year to heat things up at Bacchus Landing with their thoughtfully planned & executed open-fire cooking! description:
Gary Owen has been entertaining audiences for more than two decades with his sharp observational humor and fearless storytelling. Known for his unapologetic, rule-defying style, his material draws from his personal life, time in the military, and the everyday absurdities that connect people across backgrounds. With a fanbase that has grown by the millions in recent months and continues to surge across social media, Owen‚Äôs reach has cemented his place as one of the most in-demand touring comedians today.

Beyond stand-up, Owen has appeared in a wide range of feature films and television. He continues to write, produce, and perform his own groundbreaking comedy specials. In addition to his on-stage and on-screen work, Owen hosts his own podcast, \#GetSome with Gary Owen.

We‚Äôve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

title: A Year to Live
location:
Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

Source: North Bay Bohemian
description:
with Vinny Ferraro, Frank Ostaseski and Pam Dunn

This yearlong journey, inspired by Stephen Levine‚Äôs¬†*A Year to Live*, is a heartfelt invitation to people of all ages, at any stage of life. Together, in the spirit of community, we will explore how contemplating death can profoundly deepen our experience of living.

In our modern world, where we often shy away from the reality of our mortality, we rarely pause to consider the preciousness of each moment. The Buddha encouraged us to reflect on death not out of fear, but as a way to awaken to the fleeting beauty of our lives. By embracing this practice, we come to appreciate the fragility and impermanence of our existence.

This program is a yearlong exploration of forgiveness, gratitude, and letting go. Through guided meditations, thoughtful inquiry, and intimate group discussions, we will support one another in discovering what death has to teach us about life and vice versa.

**Program Includes**

**Format**: Online via Zoom (must know how to join a specific breakout room manually)

**Teachings**: Monthly (12) large group sessions (attendance at 10 of 12 live sessions required; this must include the first session on Jan 31st)

**Home Groups (required!)**: Monthly (12), 1-hour, self-facilitated, self-hosted Home Groups that meet in between large group sessions. They are a foundational aspect of this program and will be organized by Spirit Rock. Each group will determine a time/day and location (online or in-person) that works for everyone during the January large group session.

**Home practice**: Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

Source: North Bay Bohemian

Packed with irresistible music, over-the-top comedy, and a whole lot of love, *HEAD OVER HEELS* is a dazzling, feel-good spectacle that will have you dancing in your seat!**

title: Javier Zamora in Conversation with Albert Flynn DeSilver
description:
The San Geronimo Valley Community Center, in partnership with Canal Alliance and Book Passage, is proud to present an evening with acclaimed poet and author¬†Javier Zamora, in conversation with poet, memoirist, and educator¬†Albert Flynn DeSilver, on¬†Saturday, April 25¬†from¬†6 ‚Äì 7:30PM¬†at the San Geronimo Valley Community Center.

Javier Zamora is widely celebrated for his powerful, intimate writing that explores migration, identity, and belonging. Born in El Salvador, Zamora came to the United States by himself at the age of nine and later lived in the Canal District of San Rafael‚Äîan experience that profoundly shapes his work. His bestselling memoir,¬†Solito, and his poetry have resonated with readers nationwide for their lyrical language and deeply human storytelling.

In this special event, Zamora will be interviewed by Albert Flynn DeSilver, known for his dynamic presence and thoughtful, wide-ranging conversations that invite both literary insight and personal reflection. Together, they will explore Zamora‚Äôs creative process, lived experience, and the themes that animate his work.

This event is¬†presented by Canal Alliance, the San Geronimo Valley Community Center and Book Passage, organizations united by a shared commitment to literacy, community, and cultural exchange

Simultaneous English to Spanish interpretation will be provided.

Javier Zamora es reconocido por su escritura poderosa e √≠ntima que explora la migraci√≥n, la identidad y el sentido de pertenencia. Nacido en El Salvador, Zamora lleg√≥ a los Estados Unidos solo, a los nueve a√±os, y vivi√≥ en el vecindario del Canal de San Rafael ‚Äî experiencias que marcan su poes√≠a y su exitoso libro, Solito. En este evento especial, Zamora ser√° entrevistado por Albert Flynn DeSilver; juntos explorar√°n su proceso creativo, su experiencia de vida y los temas que dan forma a su obra.

BUY TICKETS  

 

Phil Collins‚Äô one-of-a-kind drum work and songwriting have left an enduring mark on music. Collins and his Genesis bandmates, Tony Banks and Mike Rutherford, penned unforgettable hits featured in this symphonic tribute. Accompanied by vocalists Aaron Finley and Brook Wood, along with drummer Brian Kushmaul, Guest Conductor Stuart Chafetz will lead some of the best of the best, including ‚ÄúFollow You Follow Me,‚Äù ‚ÄúAbacab,‚Äù ‚ÄúI Missed Again,‚Äù ‚ÄúTurn It On Again,‚Äù ‚ÄúSussudio,‚Äù ‚ÄúOne More Night,‚Äù ‚ÄúTake Me Home,‚Äù ‚ÄúTwo Hearts,‚Äù and the iconic ‚ÄúIn the Air Tonight.‚Äù 

Generous support provided by Nancy & Michael Hall, Betty & George Ferris

Accompanied by vocalists Aaron Finley and Brook Wood, along with drummer Brian Kushmaul, Guest Conductor Stuart Chafetz will lead some of the best of the best, including ‚ÄúFollow You Follow Me,‚Äù ‚ÄúAbacab,‚Äù ‚ÄúI Missed Again,‚Äù ‚ÄúTurn It On Again,‚Äù ‚ÄúSussudio,‚Äù ‚ÄúOne More Night,‚Äù ‚ÄúTake Me Home,‚Äù ‚ÄúTwo Hearts,‚Äù and the iconic ‚ÄúIn the Air Tonight.‚Äù

title: Old Wine, New Bottle
description:
What if Mozart‚Äôs music could surprise you with new colors you didn‚Äôt know you were missing? This program shines a spotlight on two of his favorite voices: the basset horn and the basset clarinet. Deeper, warmer, and more velvety than their modern descendants, these instruments were prized in Mozart‚Äôs time for their ability to sing, sigh, and whisper with uncanny intimacy.

The program begins with a charming quintet by Mozart‚Äôs contemporary Johann Backofen, whose writing shows off the basset horn‚Äôs mellow glow and conversational wit. Mozart‚Äôs youthful ‚ÄúMilanese‚Äù string quartet follows, sparkling with elegance and invention. The program culminates in Mozart‚Äôs beloved clarinet quintet, a work of timeless beauty, virtuosity, and ingenuity performed here on a replica of the original basset clarinet Mozart had in mind. Performed on period instruments, this concert offers a chance to hear familiar music scrubbed clean‚Äîlighter, more transparent, and irresistibly alive.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Jazz Adventures
description:
Welcome to my hometown of Healdsburg‚Ä¶ in the heart of Sonoma wine country, a town so special that Cond√© Nast named it one of the finest cities in the country.

I invite you into our world‚Ä¶ where our friendships with winemakers, chefs, and musicians will create an unforgettable Adventure just for you. An intimate group trip, you‚Äôll start each day from the boutique Hotel Healdsburg in the center of our charming town and every moment is personally curated by us. We‚Äôll take you to the world-renowned regions of Russian River Valley, Alexander Valley and Sonoma Valley. Along the way, you‚Äôll enjoy private winery visits to the uber-luxury Robert Young Winery, the site of one of our very first dates, and a winery that Eric used to manage, the legendary Buena Vista Winery. We‚Äôll visit the most sought after cult brewery in the world, the Russian River Brewing Co \(yes, this is beer in Sonoma as well‚Ä¶ trust us ‚Ä¶ we know our alcohol\).

Oh, you will eat‚Ä¶ and eat very well at my favorite Sonoma restaurants including dinner at The Dry Creek Kitchen, and a private lunch that may include more lobster than you‚Äôve ever seen in one place, and of course, dinner at the most popular restaurant in Healdsburg, The Matheson. You‚Äôll understand why when you visit!

We love to eat and drink, but what sets our Adventures apart is the music‚Ä¶ a truly exclusive experience you won‚Äôt find anywhere else. I will host intimate private concerts with my friends and guest musicians, set in stunning locations across picturesque Sonoma. Some past artists have included Vincent Ingala, Richard Elliot, Peter White and Rick Braun.

And, if you‚Äôre interested in extending your stay with me, there is an optional one-day  extension add-on that has become the signature day of our domestic Adventures, where you will experience the very finest Sonoma has to offer.

I can‚Äôt wait to welcome you into this extraordinary place, a little slice of heaven we call home!

Cheers! Mindi üé∂ \+ Eric üç∑

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Yoga with Carem - Restore, Rejuvenate, Reconnect
description:
Unwind, restore, and reconnect with your mind and body.¬†Designed for all levels, each session focuses on gentle yet purposeful poses, mindful breathing, and deep relaxation to help you release the stress of the day.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to improve flexibility, build strength, calm your nervous system, or simply create space for self-care, this class offers a supportive environment to nurture both body and mind. End your day feeling centered, refreshed, and rejuvenated.

What to Expect:

Gentle, mindful sequencing suitable for all levels

Focus on alignment, posture, and breath awareness

Deep stretches and calming poses to promote relaxation

Optional modifications to meet your individual needs

Bring a mat, water, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

About Carem

Carem Love is a wellness advocate, professional dancer, and certified yoga instructor with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Dance. She has extensive training in Bellydance, a deep passion for Latin dance, and is certified in Hatha, Vinyasa, and Children‚Äôs Yoga.

Yoga has profoundly supported her health, well-being, and dance career, inspiring her to help others experience the same body-mind benefits. In her classes, students strengthen their bodies, improve posture, mobility, balance and flexibility and learn to connect more deeply with themselves.

What to bring: ¬†mat, water, yoga blocks if you need them, and an open mind, and leave feeling balanced, relaxed, and ready for a restful evening.

Date & Time: Mondays @ 7PM

Address: 4140 Redwood Highway \#8 San Rafael, CA

Note: Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

description:
Discover your family story at our Family Search Center You will find our center in the Lakeport building in the room next to the nursery. Local volunteers can help jumpstart your family history journey. Our center is staffed on Tuesdays from 1pm - 4pm, reach us in person or by phone \(707\) 280-9545 during those hours. All services provided in centers are free. You‚Äôll enjoy: Personalized help Center guests can receive personal help from volunteers in one of more than 5,400 centers worldwide. Access to technology Centers offer complimentary access to computers, internet, and subscription family history websites. Available resources vary by location. Access to exclusive records Visitors to FamilySearch Centers get special access to images of historical records that are only available in centers. Websites available at all locations: Ancestry, My Heritage, Family Search, Find My Past, American Ancestors, Geneanet https://www.family search.org Explore videos about family history and temples at collection/temple-and-family-history-messages-from-leaders?lang=eng

title: Fit Forever
description:
In this class is about making sure you can do what you want to do, for as long as you want to do it. It‚Äôs about creating that strong foundation for a truly active lifestyle. Dance, Exercise, and Staying Fit.

low impact

building muscles

movement

confidence

We focus on the most important things: building strong muscles using safe, low-impact movements. We‚Äôll also dedicate time to flexibility and balance, because true fitness isn‚Äôt just about strength‚Äîit‚Äôs about moving through the world with ease and confidence.

My promise to you is that you‚Äôll leave here feeling stronger, more energized, and ready to take on your week. There‚Äôs no pressure, just progress, and we move at a pace that is right for everyone.

Bring your own weights \(optional\)¬†, find our focus, and commit to being Forever Fit!

title: After School - Create Your Own Storybook World!
description:
Every Tuesday 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM

Please see website: Exact dates are available on Enrichment.kids. Click the registration links below.

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Category: Kids

Age\(s\)

7-11

$100 ‚Äì Monthly Session Cost

Children will be inspired by a different artist each month and create 3D sculptural worlds from their own conceptualized 2D drawings.

What you‚Äôll do

In this imaginative, hands-on art class, young artists will explore the magical worlds of beloved artists & illustrators. Each month they will learn about a different artist: ¬†Phoebe Wahl \(January\), Antje Damm \(February\),¬†Karen Collins \(March\), Richard Scary \(April\), and Hayao Miyazaki \(May\)¬†. Inspired by their playful styles, students will¬†design and develop their very own characters‚Äîdeciding where these characters¬†live, work, play, eat, and sleep!¬†Students will be working independently as well as in groups to develop their visual storytelling muscles.¬† Children will create 3D sculptural worlds from their conceptualized 2D drawings. They will bring their stories to life using a mix of expressive art materials, including:

¬†watercolor, paint, pens,¬†and¬†collage

¬†recycled and found objects to build unique scenes

Together, we will learn:

How to use¬†watercolor techniques¬†to add color and mood

How¬†scale¬†helps characters and environments feel real

The¬†arc of a story‚Äîbeginning, middle, and end

How to build a world using¬†background, middle ground, and foreground

By the end of the class, each child will have created their own illustrated story scene full of imagination, personality, and creativity. A perfect class for kids who love drawing, storytelling, and building new worlds!

Pick-up & Drop-off

Drop off at 3:30 PM and pick up at 5:30 PM Drop-off and pick-up will happen outside Room 116 each week. For safety purposes, we ask that parents come inside to sign their child in and out after each session. You can view a map of our building here.

Pick-up Service

We also offer a free pick-up service for your kids if you are unable to drop them off after school. More more information, please contact Melissa Agocs at¬†melissa@sonomacommunitycenter.org.

Membership has its benefits

title: Intermediate Salsa Class
description:
This class is designed for dancers who have a solid grasp of the basics and are eager to expand their repertoire with more complex and fluid movements.

Pre- requisite:

Salsa Class Beginners

Each week, we‚Äôll break down a new move, focusing on the technique and connection that will make you a more confident and stylish dancer. We‚Äôll go beyond the foundational steps to cover a wide range of essential intermediate patterns and styling, including:

Turns and Spins:

Master your inside and outside turns, double spins, and the elegant 360 and Hand Toss moves.

Intricate Patterns:

Learn to execute the 360, wrap, as well as various Cross Body Lead variations like the U-Turn and Spiral.

Footwork and Styling:

Enhance your rhythm and flair with advanced footwork like the Suzy Q, Front Tap, and Mambo Step. We‚Äôll also work on styling with a wrap and improving your posture and upper body movement.

This class is your chance to refine your technique, improve your lead-follow connection, and add a variety of fun and dynamic moves to your salsa vocabulary. Join us and elevate your dance!

Details:

No partner necessary ‚Äî rotations ensure everyone gets to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles¬†to protect the floor.

Arrive 10 minutes early to warm up and get settled.

title: Bachata with ALEX
description:
Bachata with ALEX

Ready to take your bachata to the next level?

This intermediate bachata class is for dancers who have already mastered the basics and are ready for a new challenge. We‚Äôll build on your foundation with a focus on more intricate footwork, technique, and partner work.

Advanced turn patterns and combinations

Styling and body movement to add flair to your dancing

Musicality to connect with the rhythm and emotion of the music

Feeling comfortable with your basic bachata steps and ready for more?

Our¬†intermediate bachata class¬†is designed for dancers who want to elevate their skills. We‚Äôll move beyond the fundamentals to focus on more complex¬†technique, footwork, and partner work.

This class will help you:

Refine your leading and following

Learn combinations and techniques

Develop your personal style and musicality

If you‚Äôre ready to add some fire to your dancing, this is the class for you!

Important Details

Basic steps and turns required.¬†We‚Äôll be moving into combinations, so a solid grasp of your basic steps is essential.

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear non-marking shoe soles: This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

description:

Whether you're working on your own project or eager to explore new mending techniques like darning and appliqu√©, this is the perfect space to gather, share ideas, and sew together. We provide hand-sewing supplies and materials, but feel free to bring your own - it's all about community, creativity, and enjoying the process.By repairing what we already have and re-using materials, we're not just preserving memories and adding unique touches to our belongings - we‚Äôre also reducing waste and contributing to a more sustainable lifestyle. title: Spooky Book Club
description:
Spooky Book Club meets at 6pm on the last Wednesday of each month. Read any novel, novella, graphic novel, etc. that fits the monthly theme and join us for great conversation and community.

THEMES

January

Monsters & Creatures:¬†Vampires, werewolves, demons, cryptids, or anything non-human and terrifying. 

February

Folk Horror & Urban Legends:¬†Curses, rituals, superstition, isolated communities, local myths.

March

Survivor‚Äôs Guilt:¬†Survivors, slashers, killer-on-the-loose stories.

April

Psychological Terror:¬†Unreliable narrators, paranoia, mind games, and slow-burn dread.

May

Haunted Places:¬†Ghosts, cursed houses, abandoned buildings, restless spirits.

June

Weird Fiction & Cosmic Horror:¬†Eldritch vibes, the unknowable, reality-bending strangeness

July

Body Horror:¬†Transformation, disease, medical terror, the uncanny in flesh.

August

Dark Academia:¬†Creepy campuses, secret societies, intellectual obsession.

September

Eco-Horror & Nature Strikes Back:¬†Creatures, plants, or environmental forces turning hostile.

October

Supernatural Thrillers:¬†Possessions, exorcisms, occult forces, or mysterious powers.

November

International Horror:¬†Any horror written by or set in another country/culture.

December

Gothic Classics & Modern Gothics:¬†Old mansions, family secrets, brooding atmosphere, gothic romance elements.

title: The Wedding Present Concert
description:
Join us for a special evening with THE WEDDING PRESENT with support by MARK ROBINSON SINGS UNREST

presented by \(\(\(folkYeah!\)\)\) and Gundlach Bundschu Winery 

WHEN: Wednesday, April 29th 2026 

WHERE: GB Redwood Barn 

TIME: Doors 7pm | Show 8pm 

PRICE: $79 

BUY TICKETS

Food available for purchase \(vendors will be announced prior to the show\) 

¬† 

TICKETING:

Have your ticket ready when you arrive! If you opted for mobile delivery, please make sure it‚Äôs ready to go on your phone. Printed tickets? Have them out and ready to be scanned. Bacchus Club members, enjoy express entry with your special line. 

PARKING:

Parking is complimentary for Bacchus Wine Club members. To encourage carpooling, we offer free parking to vehicles with 3\+ passengers, full 2-seaters, motorcycles, and electric vehicles. Otherwise, parking will be $16.50 pre-paid in advance or $20 \(cash only\) at entry. For ADA accommodations please let the parking attendant know. 

PLEASE NO:

Coolers

Water \(bring an empty bottle as we have filtered re-fill stations\)

Pets

Chairs with legs of any length \(stadium seats that sit flat on the ground are permitted\)

Outside food or drink

Bad Attitudes‚Ä¶¬†this is Rhinefarm after all

ACCESSIBILITY:

For any questions regarding ADA accommodations related to parking, seating, restrooms, etc. please contact us at info@gunbun.com or 707.938.5277. 

YOUR EXPERIENCE, YOUR ADVENTURE:

At Gundlach Bundschu Winery, we invite you to immerse yourself in the magic of our historic Redwood Barn, where the beauty of nature blends with unforgettable performances. As with all great adventures, attending an outdoor event carries a touch of unpredictability. 

Whether it‚Äôs the rustle of the vines in the breeze, the gentle slope of the hillside, or the surprises nature has in store, we encourage you to embrace the moment. While we strive to create a safe and enjoyable environment, the great outdoors brings its own set of risks. By joining us, you understand and accept the inherent possibilities, but not limited to, uneven ground, changing weather, and the occasional visit from our local wildlife. We ask that you tread carefully, come prepared for all conditions, and remember to look after yourself and your belongings. 

By attending our events, you acknowledge that your participation is voluntary, and you assume all responsibility for any personal injuries, accidents, or loss of property that may occur during your time with us. Gundlach Bundschu Winery and its team are dedicated to your safety, but cannot be held liable for incidents that may arise from the natural elements of this experience. 

In purchasing a ticket and joining us under the open sky, you agree to these terms and release Gundlach Bundschu Winery from any claims or liabilities associated with the inherent risks of an outdoor gathering. We look forward to sharing this special place with you, where every moment is part of the journey. 

MAKE SURE TO VISIT OUR VENUE INFORMATION PAGE ‚Äì HERE

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: Barbies & Bags Workshop
location:
Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

description:

$25 ‚Äì One Bag or Doll Entry $40 ‚Äì Two Bags or Dolls entryTransform plastic dolls and create upcycled bags from trash into unique art. Join our hands-on Trashion workshop for the Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction.

About the Class

This hands-on workshop invites participants to rescue and reinvent plastic dolls \(Barbies, Kens, and dolls that are under 12 inches\) often destined for landfills, where they can take 20 to 500 years to decompose. As part of Trashion Season, join us for the beloved Gallery 212 Exhibit and Auction \(April 3 ‚Äì 25\) where discarded materials are transformed into small-scale works of art for a good cause. Together, we‚Äôll reclaim these forgotten figures and reimagine them as expressive, one-of-a-kind artworks for submission to the gallery exhibit and auction. New this year: Bags! In addition to dolls, we‚Äôre expanding the exhibit to include bags‚Äîthink totes, clutches, cross bagsm fanny packs, coin purses, and backpacks. Just like the Trashion runway, the only rule is that your piece must be made from unconventional materials and/or upcycled/used textiles. Participants will have access to access to sewing machines, hot glue guns, irons, hair dryers and other creative tools as well of a wide selection of trash and upcycled materials to bring their vision to life. BYOT \(Bring your own trash\) is also welcome and encouraged! The workshop registration is your application fee to the gallery exhibit! Come play, experiment, and collaborate while contributing to a dynamic gallery exhibit that raises funds for Sonoma Community Center programming through the auction. It‚Äôs a joy to see your art find a new home‚Äîand to be part of a creative community turning trash into treasure.

Thank you to Recology Sonoma-Marin for donating Barbies & Dolls for our gallery exhibit every year.

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: ReNewAll Spring Retreat
description:
ReNewAll Spring Retreat | May 1-3, 2026 Join movement educators Lila Heller and Cary Berkley for a rejuvenating weekend at Mandala Springs in beautiful Cobb, California. Surrounded by nature's serenity, this retreat invites you to reconnect, restore, and remember what makes you feel alive. Through guided movement, mindful connection, and moments of stillness, you'll nourish your body, quiet your mind, and awaken your senses. Step away from the everyday and step into renewal this spring. The Experience Spring is a time of renewal-a natural invitation to let go of what's heavy and welcome what's ready to bloom. Through movement, stillness, community, and nature, you'll be guided back to your natural rhythm and vitality. You can expect: Daily movement and breathwork sessions to reconnect to your body A morning hike through the beautiful Mandala Springs grounds A deeply restorative sound bath led by Cary Delicious, nourishing meals Spacious time to rest, journal, or explore Evenings of connection, music, and shared stories around the fire All levels are welcome. Come as you are-curious, tired, inspired, or simply ready to breathe a little deeper.

title: Creed Fisher
description:
If you listen to just a few tracks from his latest album, you might think Creed Fisher was born with a guitar in his hand. One after another his songs remain relevant today, yet steeped with tradition classics that everyone else already knows and you don‚Äôt want to miss. Clearly he‚Äôs sharing his own stories, with experiences that range from great victories to deep battle scars. 

Fisher hails from Odessa, TX,  where his family‚Äôs roots trace back to his granddad, who was highly involved in the oil game back in the fifties. However, Fisher took on a different passion when he started playing football at the age of 10, which eventually led to the Minor Leagues for 9 years. 

But, as his football career came to a close, Fisher also saw his marriage of twelve years come to an end. It was at this point he decided to do some serious ‚Äúsoul searching‚Äù. Fisher tells us that the music simply ‚Äúfound him‚Äù during this time. He picked up a guitar in 2010 and never let it go; and after touring tirelessly for 4 years, Fisher moved from West Texas to a small town outside of San Antonio, TX, where he put together a new band, and picked up where he left off.

Fisher‚Äôs second album "Ain't Scared To Bleed" went Top 30 on the ITunes Country charts and continues to be embraced by fans all around the world. When it came to his 3rd album "Rednecks Like Us" it was reviewed by Country Music People magazine and got 4 out of 5 stars. Here is what they had to say...

‚ÄúCreed Fisher sings and writes with the confidence and authority of someone who has been at it for a hell of a lot longer than 6 years. He is at his strongest on the ballads, but tackles the ‚Äòangry redneck‚Äô stuff just as well. There‚Äôs the odd moment when it can all get a bit crashy and loud for me, but I‚Äôd say the same about Hank Jr. All things considered, this is very impressive indeed and I‚Äôd like to see Creed Fisher go far.

Friends and fans alike anxiously await Creed Fisher‚Äôs release of his 4th album. There is no denying that Fisher is truly speaking from passion when it comes to his music. Fisher is the guy you meet that you feel like you‚Äôve known all your life and his music feels like the songs you‚Äôve been singing since you first discovered music. His lyrics

are comfortable; his story, genuine; his spirit, humble and his talent, undeniable.‚Äù

Country Music People Magazine 

- September 2016

- Duncan Warwick 

Recently in 2021, he‚Äôs been back on the road touring and will be looking forward to putting out new music for his fans.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Petaluma River Full Moon Paddle
description:
Come play on the river at night.

Join The Floathouse for a magical evening paddle on the Petaluma River‚ÄîPetaluma‚Äôs Longest Park‚Äîtimed to catch the full moon rising over the wetlands just south of downtown. As twilight fades, we‚Äôll head out together in Hobie pedal kayaks for a relaxed, guided glide that turns nighttime into playtime.

These pedal-powered kayaks make the journey smooth and easy, even if there‚Äôs a breeze or moving tide. We‚Äôll cruise about a mile and a half downriver to the perfect moonrise vantage point, where calm water, wide skies, and glowing reflections set the scene.

This is a social, feel-good outdoor experience designed for anyone looking for something a little different to do after dark‚Äîpart nature, part adventure, part pure vibe.

**$60 per person includes everything:** ‚Ä¢ Hobie pedal kayak ‚Ä¢ PFD and safety lights ‚Ä¢ Experienced local guide ‚Ä¢ A memorable, moonlit river experience

‚ú® Easy. Playful. Peaceful. Spend your evening under the full moon‚Äîon the water.

title: Bachata Beginners Saturday
description:
This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That‚Äôs why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps:¬†You‚Äôll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work:¬†Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns:¬†We‚Äôll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We‚Äôve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required:¬†Whether you‚Äôve never danced before or it‚Äôs been a while, you‚Äôre welcome here!

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles:¬†This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: 11th Annual Duckhorn Vineyards Derby Party and Discussion Release
description:
This year, we‚Äôre bringing the festivities to a new setting at our sister property, The Duckhorn Collection at Paraduxx, where the legacy continues in a fresh new way.

Settle into the day with Southern-inspired bites from our new Culinary team led by Chef Dominic Orsini and our signature wines poured across our lounge, beneath the old oak tree, and beside the vines. From Duckhorn Vineyards to Goldeneye and beyond, experience the spirit of The Duckhorn Collection as our home becomes yours for an afternoon of food, wine, and celebration.

Tradition and excellence unite as we debut the 16th vintage of The Discussion Red Blend‚Äîa wine that embodies the ongoing dialogue of craftsmanship and connection in winemaking. Be among the first to savor the new 2022 vintage of this Bordeaux-inspired blend while reveling in the excitement of the 152nd Kentucky Derby!

No Derby celebration would be complete without our Best Dressed Competition, inviting guests to showcase their finest race-day style‚Äîfrom big hats and fascinators to sport coats and bow ties. For those seeking a touch more elegance and ease, The Winner‚Äôs Circle offers relaxed comfort and curated service. Enjoy personalized wine selections and thoughtful pairings, with a dedicated host ensuring you won‚Äôt miss a moment of the action. From start to finish, it‚Äôs an effortless, unforgettable Duckhorn Derby Day.

\*Derby-inspired attire suggested.

\*\*Guests must be 21 and over to attend. No pets are allowed at this event.

\*\*\*All ticket sales are non-refundable

title: UC Master Gardeners - Climate Adaptation in Your Yard
description:
This talk offers concrete, achievable, science-based means to use your own garden for carbon sequestration, food security, plant and animal habitat, and increased resilience to extreme weather and other climate change events. Leah Halper is a Master Gardener and Garden Sense consultant who helps Sonoma County residents transition their yards to use less water and support more beneficial plants and animals. She is also a UCANR-trained Climate Steward with special interest in resilience food gardening, carbon sequestration, and preserving habitat for plant and animal species at risk. Registration Encouraged: Visit Upcoming Events to complete your registration. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about attending the library talk. Learn about home gardening, pest management, water conservation practices, and more from your Sonoma County UC Master Gardeners! Different presentation topic per location.

title: Santa Rosa Symphony - Shakespeare in Music
description:
Shakespeare in Music

May 2, 3 & 4, 2026

Weill Hall, Green Music Center

Francesco Lecce-Chong, conductor

Claire Huangci, piano

Nicola Vann, actor

SAMUEL COLERIDGE-TAYLOR: Incidental Music from Othello

WOLFGANG AMADEUS MOZART: Concerto No. 20 in D minor for Piano and Orchestra, K. 466

PYOTR ILYICH TCHAIKOVSKY: Hamlet \(Fantasy Overture\) in F minor, Opus 67

PYOTR ILYICH TCHAIKOVSKY: Romeo and Juliet \(Fantasy Overture\) in B minor

Step into the world of Shakespeare‚Äôs dramatic, enduring tales. Tchaikovsky‚Äôs passionate Romeo and Juliet is a timeless and familiar classic, while Coleridge-Taylor‚Äôs evocative Othello offers a compelling counterpoint for interpreting Shakespeare in music. Plus, pianist Claire Huangci makes her Weill Hall debut with Mozart‚Äôs expressive Piano Concerto No. 20.

Programs, dates, artists, and prices are subject to change without notice. Tickets are subject to availability.

Photo by ¬†Jean-Baptiste Millot

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Head Over Heels
description:
**A Kingdom at Risk, a Beat That Won‚Äôt Quit, and Love That Rules All!**

***‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a feel good riot from start to finish.‚Äú* ‚Äî Jay Darcy, Mancunion Media Group** 

**Get ready for a wild, laugh-out-loud adventure with *HEAD OVER HEELS*‚Äîthe electrifying musical comedy from the creative forces behind Hedwig and the Angry Inch, Avenue Q, and Spring Awakening! Nominated for *Outstanding New Broadway Musical* in 2019 and powered by the chart-topping hits of the legendary all-female rock band The Go-Go‚Äôs, this high-energy show features beloved anthems like ‚ÄúWe Got the Beat,‚Äù ‚ÄúOur Lips Are Sealed,‚Äù ‚ÄúVacation,‚Äù ‚ÄúHeaven is a Place on Earth,‚Äù and ‚ÄúMad About You.‚Äù**

**Join a spirited royal family on a whirlwind quest to save their kingdom from doom‚Äîonly to realize that the key to their future isn‚Äôt written in fate, but in their own hearts. Packed with irresistible music, over-the-top comedy, and a whole lot of love, *HEAD OVER HEELS* is a dazzling, feel-good spectacle that will have you dancing in your seat!**

Thursdays, Fridays & Saturdays @ 7:30pm, Saturdays and Sundays at 2:00pm Run Time: Two hours, 15 mins including intermission

Thursdays Adult $33Fri/Sat Eve Adult $44.95; Senior $38.95; Under 18 $31.95Sat/Sun Matinee Adult $55.95; Senior $48.95Value seating $37.95\*All prices include fees(707) 523-4185**boxoffice@6thstreetplayhouse.com**

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Classic Rock Dinner Show at the Swiss Hotel in Sonoma with Randy Foisy
description:
A live music classic rock dinner show at the Swiss Hotel in Sonoma, with acoustic guitar and vocals performed by local musician Randy Foisy.

Randy covers a wide range of classic rock from the Allman Brothers to Frank Zappa, from the 60's, 70's, 80's, and beyond, and some of his own originals.

title: Brunch & Blush at St. Francis Winery & Vineyards
description:
Step into spring at St. Francis Winery with  Brunch and Blush , a ros√©-inspired brunch set beneath the vineyard portico overlooking Wild Oak Vineyard and Hood Mountain. Surrounded by sunshine, blooming vines, and fresh spring air, this whimsical gathering celebrates the best of the season in Sonoma Valley. Guests will enjoy a family-style brunch thoughtfully prepared by Executive Chef Peter Janiak, featuring vibrant, seasonal dishes paired with an artisan selection of St. Francis wines-plus plenty of ros√©. A French chill playlist sets a relaxed yet celebratory mood, perfect for lingering at the table. Whether you're planning a day with friends, celebrating an early Mother's Day, hosting a bachelorette outing, or enjoying a girls' day in Wine Country, Brunch and Blush is an ideal way to sip, savor, and welcome spring.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Italian Brunch Series at Seghesio Family Vineyards
description:
Experience the  Italian Brunch Series at Seghesio Family Vineyards, inspired by the family's deep Italian roots and tradition. This inviting gathering celebrates fresh flavors, warm hospitality, and the joy of sharing a meal around the table. Guests are welcomed to a relaxed brunch experience filled with laughter, abundant dishes, and thoughtfully paired wines. Enjoy beautiful pairings featuring Seghesio favorites such as crisp Vermentino, vibrant Barbera, and soulful Sangiovese each adding to the spirit of an Italian-inspired welcome. Dates include February 15, March 15, May 3, and September 20 for a special Harvest Edition. Includes a $25 Wine Credit with $100 wine purchase.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Sip n' Shop Mother's Day Market
description:
Celebrate Mom with a fun day out at the 360 Winery! Enjoy a chill vibe while sipping on some tasty wine and exploring unique local vendors. It‚Äôs the perfect spot to shop gifts, catch up with friends, and soak up good vibes all in one place. Bring your crew, grab a glass, and make this Mother‚Äôs Day super special! For photos and past event experiences or updates, visit us on Instagram @t.b.g\_events and @norcal.makers Vendor Applications are through TBG EVENTS, LLC ONLY!!! Do not apply or communicate with anyone in the comments. If you did not apply and receive a confirmation from TBG Events, please contact us at www.thebombshellgroupinc.com

Source: North Bay Bohemian

The Ely Stage Stop & Country Museum is located at 9921 Soda Bay Road, between Kit&'s Corner on Hwy 29 and the Riviera. The gates are open every week-end from 11 am to 3pm. Look for the Museum Flag!

title: Keenan Webster - Afro Roots World Music
description:
Experience the sounds of West African music with Keenan Webster who uses music to bring people together. Webster is influenced by music giants John Coltrane, Miles Davis, Taj Mahal, El Hadj Kouyate, Toumani Diabate, Robert Johnson, Slip James, Johnny Shines, Habib, Koite and Keltigue Diabate. The music traditions of Latin America, Sumatra and India also infiltrate his style.

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: TJ KLUNE
description:
SEBASTOPOL --

Copperfield‚Äôs Books is delighted to welcome perennial staff favorite and¬†New York Times bestselling author TJ Klune to Sebastopol in celebration of his enchanting and deeply stirring new novel ‚Äî¬†We Burned So Bright.

This is a ticketed, off-site event at The Sebastopol Community Cultural Center.

Each ticket \(book\+tax\) includes admission for one, seating and a signed hardcover of¬†We Burned So Bright.

Join us for a reading and warm discussion followed by an audience Q&A and book-signing with photo opportunities!

Scholarships available - Dying to attend but can't afford the ticket? Tell us why you can‚Äôt miss this special afternoon by emailing jmadsen@copperbook.com

A heart-wrenching standalone novel by \#1¬†New York Times¬†bestselling author TJ Klune,We Burned So Bright¬†follows an elder gay couple on an end-of-the-world road-trip.

The road stretched out before them. No other cars, just the headlights on the blacktop. Above, the cracked moon in a kaleidoscope sky‚Ä¶.

Husbands Don and Rodney have lived a good long life. Together they‚Äôve experienced the highest highs of love and family, and lows so low that they felt like the end of the world.

Now, the world is ending for real. A rogue black hole is coming for Earth and in a month everything and everyone they‚Äôve ever known will be gone.

Suddenly, after 40 years together, Don and Rodney are out of time. They‚Äôre in a race against the clock to make it from Maine to Washington State to take care of some unfinished business before it‚Äôs all over.

On the road they meet those who refuse to believe death is coming and those who rush to meet it. But there are also people living their final days as best they know how‚Äîimpromptu weddings, bright burning bonfires, shared meals, and new friends.

And as the black hole draws near, among ball lightning and under a cracked moon in a kaleidoscope sky, Don and Rodney will look back on their lives and ask if their best was good enough.

Is it enough to burn bright if nothing comes from the ashes?

Author:¬†TJ KLUNE¬†\(he/him\) is the¬†New York Times¬†and¬†USA Today¬†bestselling, Lambda Literary Award-winning author of¬†The House in the Cerulean Sea,¬†Under the Whispering Door,¬†In the Lives of Puppets, the Green Creek Series for adults, the Extraordinaries Series for teens, and more. Being queer himself, Klune believes it's important‚Äînow more than ever‚Äîto have accurate, positive queer representation in stories.

PRAISE FOR...

For¬†Somewhere Beyond the Sea: A \#1 New York Times, \#1 USA Today and \#1 indie bestseller! "An enchanting sequel about found family." ‚Äî¬†The New York Times For¬†In the Lives of Puppets: A¬†New York Times,¬†Sunday Times¬†and indie bestseller!

"Thoroughly entertaining and deeply stirring." ‚Äî¬†Chuck Tingle, Hugo Award finalist and author of¬†Camp Damascus For Under the Whispering Door: A¬†New York Times,¬†USA Today¬†and indie bestseller!

‚ÄúTenderness, wit, and skillful worldbuilding elevate this delightful tale. Fans of queer fantasy won‚Äôt want to miss this.‚Äù ‚Äî¬†Publishers Weekly For¬†The House in the Cerulean Sea: A¬†New York Times,¬†USA Today, and indie bestseller!

"I loved it. It is like being wrapped up in a big gay blanket. Simply perfect."¬†‚Äî V.E. Schwab, \#1¬†New York Times bestselling author of¬†The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue For¬†The Bones Beneath My Skin: A¬†New York Times,¬†USA Today, and indie bestseller!

"An uplifting and curious novel, a shining dot on an overlapping Venn diagram of sci-fi, fantasy, adventure and gay romance."¬†‚Äî¬†Aurealis

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: St Peter's Chapel Concert Series & VOENA present: Voices of Freedom
description:
What does freedom sound like? Join VOENA for an electrifying afternoon celebrating freedom of expression, cultural identity, and unity through song and rhythm. Voices of Freedom explores the many meanings of freedom across cultures and histories, featuring powerful performances from VOENA's diverse singers and global guest artists. This inspiring concert is held in the stunning St. Peter's Chapel, home to historic Tiffany stained glass windows. Special guests include Drumdala, the immersive percussion project by Richard Sherwood, and Japanese Taiko. Taiko brings a commanding presence to the stage, uniting movement, rhythm, and spirit. This spring, Taiko Drummer David Gonzalez joins VOENA, carrying the legacy and wisdom of Grandmaster Seiichi Tanaka, the father of taiko in America. A respected local Taiko artist, David has appeared in films such as Return of the Jedi and performed at renowned venues including Zellerbach Hall and Carnegie Hall. The Taiko performance is further enriched by Heidi Varian, a highly regarded Taiko artist and author of The Way of Taiko. Heidi's deep understanding of Taiko's cultural significance and her mastery of the art form adds a special layer to the performance, creating an unforgettable experience for the audience. VOENA's mission‚Ä¶ Uniting the world with children's voices, shines through as they bring global music traditions to life in one of the oldest Navy chapels on the West Coast. Tickets: $50 Reserved Seating \(First 3 Rows\) $40 General Seating

Source: North Bay Bohemian

title: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series: Ada Twist, Scientist & Friends by TheaterWorksUSA
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Back to All Shows

Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series

Ada Twist, Scientist & Friends

by TheaterWorksUSA

Sunday, May 3, 2026

3:30 pm

BUY TICKETS 

Individual Tickets go on sale for Members beginning August 19; General Public, August 22 

 

When Ms. Greer‚Äôs classroom field trip goes awry, three out-of-the-box thinkers must pull their STEM skills together to save the day! Meet Rosie Revere and her engineering dreams, Iggy Peck, with her relentless passion for architecture, and Ada Twist, whose science curiosity leads her to some adventurous problem solving. In this live musical performance, our heroes face the ultimate test of their problem-solving skills‚Äîa test that can only be conquered through teamwork. Don‚Äôt miss this fun musical based on the Andrea Beaty books,¬†Rosie Revere, Engineer; Iggy Peck, Architect, and Ada Twist, Scientist, which spotlight the STEM curriculum \(focusing on science, technology, engineering and math\). 

Recommended for ages 5-9, however, you know your child best. 

Run Time: 60 minutes 

Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video. 

 

Family Fun in the Lobby

Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. It‚Äôs a fun, free way for adults and children alike to get creative, while enhancing your enjoyment of the show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family‚Äôs budget in mind!¬†  

VIPs Meet the Cast

Subscription holders be sure to stick around after the show to meet the cast and get autographs! \(Except The Peking Acrobats¬Æ.\) 

 Family Fun Series ‚Äì Save 20% and see all 5 shows!

See the full series here: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series 

Timeline

New Subscriptions go on sale for Members beginning June 24; General Public, June 27.

Individual Tickets go on sale for Members beginning August 19; General Public, August 22.

Two ways to buy! Season ticket packages are available online or by downloading the form \(linked below\) and sending the completed form to us by mail or email. If you have any questions, call the Patron & Member Services Office at 707.546.3600. 

Purchase New Subscription ONLINE

Download New Subscription Form 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS

Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

It‚Äôs a fun, free way for adults and children alike to get creative, while enhancing your enjoyment of the show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family‚Äôs budget in mind!¬†  


VIPs Meet the Cast
Subscription holders be sure to stick around after the show to meet the cast and get autographs! (Except The Peking Acrobats¬Æ.) 

 Family Fun Series ‚Äì Save 20% and see all 5 shows!
See the full series here: Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series 



Timeline

New Subscriptions go on sale for Members beginning June 24; General Public, June 27.
Individual Tickets go on sale for Members beginning August 19; General Public, August 22.

Two ways to buy! Season ticket packages are available online or by downloading the form (linked below) and sending the completed form to us by mail or email. If you have any questions, call the Patron & Member Services Office at 707.546.3600. 

Purchase New Subscription ONLINE
Download New Subscription Form 
 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

Source: Luther Burbank Center

title: Jazz Adventures
description:
Welcome to my hometown of Healdsburg‚Ä¶ in the heart of Sonoma wine country, a town so special that Cond√© Nast named it one of the finest cities in the country.

I invite you into our world‚Ä¶ where our friendships with winemakers, chefs, and musicians will create an unforgettable Adventure just for you. An intimate group trip, you‚Äôll start each day from the boutique Hotel Healdsburg in the center of our charming town and every moment is personally curated by us. We‚Äôll take you to the world-renowned regions of Russian River Valley, Alexander Valley and Sonoma Valley. Along the way, you‚Äôll enjoy private winery visits to the uber-luxury Robert Young Winery, the site of one of our very first dates, and a winery that Eric used to manage, the legendary Buena Vista Winery. We‚Äôll visit the most sought after cult brewery in the world, the Russian River Brewing Co \(yes, this is beer in Sonoma as well‚Ä¶ trust us ‚Ä¶ we know our alcohol\).

Oh, you will eat‚Ä¶ and eat very well at my favorite Sonoma restaurants including dinner at The Dry Creek Kitchen, and a private lunch that may include more lobster than you‚Äôve ever seen in one place, and of course, dinner at the most popular restaurant in Healdsburg, The Matheson. You‚Äôll understand why when you visit!

We love to eat and drink, but what sets our Adventures apart is the music‚Ä¶ a truly exclusive experience you won‚Äôt find anywhere else. I will host intimate private concerts with my friends and guest musicians, set in stunning locations across picturesque Sonoma. Some past artists have included Vincent Ingala, Richard Elliot, Peter White and Rick Braun.

And, if you‚Äôre interested in extending your stay with me, there is an optional one-day  extension add-on that has become the signature day of our domestic Adventures, where you will experience the very finest Sonoma has to offer.

I can‚Äôt wait to welcome you into this extraordinary place, a little slice of heaven we call home!

Cheers! Mindi üé∂ \+ Eric üç∑
